We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us. Director of Network Engineering and Operations Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will manage critical network infrastructure in enterprise and manufacturing environments globally. This person will be responsible for architect and maintaining network design standards and solutions globally to provide secure, reliable and resilient network services. This role is responsible for overseeing the strategy, design, operation, and improvement of corporate, manufacturing and cloud networks enterprise-wide. This individual will manage a team of network engineers and a primarily outsourced network operations team to ensure the design, installation, upgrade, and stability of the wireless and wired networks, firewalls and switches, cloud, maintaining network security and issue reporting, and defining and documenting network architecture and standards. This individual will partner with global and regional Information Systems team members, vendors, and line of business team members to design and deliver network service to enable corporate and retail on-site and remote working scenarios. This includes troubleshooting and urgent response to any issues that arise, preventative maintenance, proactive scanning and security management and hardware/software upgrades. This includes the following activities: Ensure the stable performance of the systems through the monitoring, analysis, identification, and resolution of issues. Ensure problems are diagnosed and resolved in a timely manner and seek methods for improvement. Good technical expertise with enterprise On Prem Network Technologies – Switches, Routers, Load Balancers, Network Access Control, Remote Access technologies, SDWAN Devices, Wireless Networks, Proxy Services, as well as the supporting technologies like DNS and DHCP. Strong technical expertise with Cloud networking technologies and constructs. This includes their management and integration into enterprise networks. Strong Expertise in Enterprise Network Operations – HW/SW Life Cycle Management, Operational Monitoring/Alerting, Capacity Management, Redundancy/High Availability solutions, Operational Health Checks, IT Automation/Self-healing. Assess requirements, research, recommend, design, and implement vital solutions/tools to enhance productivity and cost effectiveness on connectivity technologies. These standards will also meet information security and all applicable compliance requirements Cultivate and manage relationships with service providers, vendors, and business leads. Participate in IT change control process and notifications to the business of changes, planned maintenance, or unplanned outages. Stay abreast of current technologies, developments, network compliance requirements, standards, and industry trends. Financial Accountability (Budget/Sales etc.): This role has responsibility for monthly forecasting and management of all budgets related to the department, including network hardware, managed services, workplace collaboration software and associated hardware and departmental travel expense. This role will also work with procurement to negotiate and manage vendor contracts and vendor relationships as needed. Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The dynamic professional we seek is a technology leader with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree and 4 years of Information Systems or Network Engineering/Operations experience Or Master’s degree and 8 years of Information Systems or Network Engineering/Operations experience Or Bachelor’s degree and 10 years of Information Systems or Network Engineering/Operations experience And 4 years of managerial experience directly managing people and/or leadership experience leading teams, projects, programs or directing the allocation of resources Preferred Qualifications: Experience with manufacturing, production, and warehouse environments Experience in designing, configuring Cisco Catalyst & Chassis Switches, Wireless Controllers and Access Points. Experience in setting up & managing networks in Microsoft Azure / cloud environments. Experience working closely with a Managed Service Provider to design & support application network requirements. Excellent organizational and verbal/written communication skills Superior troubleshooting experience and skills Positive, proactive, can-do attitude with the ability to work alone as an individual contributor, as a technical lead when required, and as a participant in a team environment Learn quickly and adapt to new technologies Thrive What You Can Expect Of Us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, so we work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. Vast opportunities to learn and move up and across our global organization Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where teammates are empowered to bring ideas to the table and act Generous Total Rewards Plan comprising health, finance and wealth, work/life balance, and career benefits Apply now for a career that defies imagination In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation. Amgen, a biotechnology pioneer, discovers, develops and delivers innovative human therapeutics. Our medicines have helped millions of patients in the fight against cancer, kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis and other serious illnesses. In this vital role you will be a part of Amgen’s Induced Proximity Platform (IPP) team. We are seeking an accomplished Director to lead our efforts to discover the next generation of novel small molecule Targeted Protein Degradation therapeutics. In this position you will lead a research team in the Induced Proximity Platform at the cutting edge of drug discovery to enable both platform technology development and enablement of pipeline programs. As a skilled organizational leader, this individual should be an efficient manager, a strong team builder and a collaborator who will provide robust organizational and scientific leadership consistent with Amgen’s culture of innovation and teamwork. Responsibilities: Supervise a group engaged in developing new platform technology for Targeted Protein Degradation, including PROTAC and molecular glues Contribute to the development and implementation of the research strategy in the Induced Proximity Platform, with a specific focus towards Targeted Protein Degradation Develop effective cross functional relationships with colleagues in therapeutic areas, including Oncology, medicinal chemistry, screening, and bioinformatics, Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. jobTitle: District Sales Manager- Bone Health- Atlanta, GA
jobDescription: Territory #B03C000 Covers: Atlanta, GA HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve earned your degree. How will you use that achievement to reach your goals? Do more with the knowledge you’ve worked hard to acquire and the passion you already have. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Become the professional you are meant to be in this meaningful role. Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will be the liaison to our customers by providing clinical knowledge of our products to medical professionals. Amgen's medicines treat serious illnesses and our research address diseases with a limited number of treatment options. With a robust and differentiated pipeline, Amgen remains committed to advancing science to dramatically improve people's lives. Amgen is a values-based organization with a powerful sense of shared purpose toward our mission: to serve patients. Within our US Commercial Operations (USCO), we provide the capabilities, resources, and rewards of a global enterprise, while maintaining the entrepreneurialism and verve that marked our early days as a biotechnology pioneer. We encourage our team members to have fulfilling and meaningful careers through challenging assignments, career development, and valuable opportunities such as this District Sales Manager opportunity.  This position will require strong ability to collaborate cross-functionally with other Amgen business units including District Sales Mangers, Regional Sales Directors and Corporate Account Managers. Additional Responsibilities and Duties Include: Track the progress of marketing messages and programs Provide feedback to district teams on the marketing, allocating, monitoring, and leveraging of internal and external resources (e.g., discretionary spend) Manage district teams to maximize their performance and help achieve/exceed sales and budget targets Screen, interview, and hire candidates Ensure compliance with training Demonstrate the appropriate coaching and counseling to prepare individuals for future development Conduct annual and on-going performance reviews and competency assessments Communicate and coordinate with both district and cross-functional teams (e.g., Marketing, Finance, other Business Units) Share best practices with direct reports and peers Coordinate and/or participate in cluster teams Conduct district sales meetings to guide districts Develop local Opinion Leader relationships to achieve aligned objectives Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The sales professional we seek is a go-getter with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree and 2 years of Sales/Marketing experience OR Master’s degree and 6 years of Sales/Marketing experience OR Bachelor’s degree or and 8 years of Sales/Marketing experience OR Associate’s degree and 10 years of Sales/Marketing experience OR High school diploma / GED and 12 years of Sales/Marketing experience AND 2 years of managerial experience directly managing people and/or leadership experience leading teams, projects, programs or directing the allocation of resources. Preferred Qualifications: Three + years of specialty sales experience (Nephrology, Rheumatology and/or Dermatology marketplace) Experience in biologics Buy and bill model experience Ability to consistently and objectively recognize and promote success behaviors, as well as diagnose and change unsatisfactory behaviors through effective coaching Ability to leverage market & customer knowledge to strategically target messages, resources, and activities within the territory Demonstrates knowledge of local payor coverage Ability to understand and articulate clinical concepts, data, and conclusions Demonstrated ability to utilize clinical information to effectively address customer questions and objections Ability to recruit candidates that meet the minimum job criteria Interviews and hires sales representatives that are capable and committed to fulfilling the job requirements Strong sense of responsibility and demonstrated self-discipline Setting appropriate short term and long term objectives; demonstrated success in communicating & collaborating with sales staff, peers, business unit counterparts in an effective and timely manner. In this vital role you will provide docketing support for the Patent Law Team related to U.S. and Foreign patents. This position can sit anywhere in the US remotely. Job duties include but are not limited to: Reviewing and docketing incoming correspondence using the Anaqua system, including its integration with USPTO Private PAIR; de-docketing deadlines; monitoring and forwarding correspondence from central docketing mailbox Researching country law requirements using public databases and Kluwer IP Law Creating, maintaining, auditing, and updating the patent database records; preparing docket reports and various portfolio status reports Reconciling and responding to annuity queries; and serving as a resource to the Patent Department regarding U.S. and foreign patent rules and regulations, including making presentations at patent staff meetings Identify gaps and recommend improvements in docketing processes and systems Assist with the preparation and timely handling of all non-US formalities, including ordering certified PTO documents; scheduling signatories and notarizations; corresponding with foreign agents; facilitating documents requiring Apostille and Legalization; and updating Anaqua database with details during each phase of completion Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The legal professional we seek is a diligent and motivated worker with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Masters Degree in a related field, OR Bachelors Degree in a related field and 2 + years of paralegal experience, OR Associates Degree in a related field and 6+ years of paralegal experience, OR High School Diploma/ GED and 8 + years of paralegal experience Preferred Qualifications: ABA-approved legal assistant/paralegal program completion 4+ years of docketing or paralegal experience Expertise in patent filings and prosecution practices in the US, PCT, EP, and other common jurisdictions worldwide Experience preparing patent formality documents (Powers of Attorney, Assignments, Declarations, etc.) and obtaining legalization where needed Prior experience with docketing in patent management systems; knowledge/familiarity with Anaqua IP Management System is a plus Prior experience creating patent searches and reports from docketing systems, analyzing large patent data sets, spotting errors, and reconciling data discrepancies Knowledge of researching patent status on public patent databases (US, EP, PCT, etc.) Expertise with researching country law requirements using tools like Kluwer IP Ability to perform quality assurance of database records and recommend improvements in docketing processes and systems Organized with excellent verbal and written communication skills Technology savvy with advanced proficiency in MS Office - specifically Excel and Outlook Experience in the Biotech or Pharmaceutical industry, or education or work experience in a scientific discipline, especially biology or chemistry is a plus Thrive Some of the vast rewards of working here As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. jobTitle: Downstream Senior Process Engineer - Advanced Technology
jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role. Downstream Senior Process Engineer - Advanced Technology Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. Lead or work with teams in design, development and selection of new DS systems, instruments, and consumable components. Evaluate capabilities of current and potential suppliers, and assess new technologies that could provide cost, throughput, or other unique capabilities to Amgen manufacturing. Deliver capital projects in accordance with company procedures to ensure they are completed on schedule and within established budget. Employ engineering skills and practices to capture user requirements and translate them into technical documentation for execution. Ensure new systems are crafted and constructed in a quality fashion per user requirements, corporate standards, design codes, and safety standards. Provide subject matter expert support for the development and solving of DS processes, operations, and equipment. Perform field evaluations of existing systems and provide engineering recommendations for design improvements. The Sr. Engineer will be encouraged to keep current on the latest industrial, scientific, and regulatory trends in order to develop the most competitive and innovative drug substance manufacturing technologies with industry leading capability. This role provides a great opportunity for significant career development in areas of leadership, partnership, collaboration, communication and to develop network influence by partnering with colleagues in Process Development, Corporate Engineering, and Manufacturing, as well as Quality and Information Systems. While the future impact of COVID-19 cannot be known, this role is currently conducted on site from the office or lab when needed, and from home the remainder of the time. Travel is currently limited. Pre-pandemic travel for this role was estimated at 5-15% for training/symposiums, vendor site visits, FAT/startups, or investigation support. Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our outstanding contributions to serve patients. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree OR Master’s of Science degree in Biochemical, Chemical, Mechanical or Process Engineering, and 3 years of Engineering or Operations experience OR Bachelor’s of Science degree in Biochemical, Chemical, Mechanical or Process Engineering, and 5 years of Engineering or Operations experience OR Associate’s degree and 10 years of engineering experience OR High school diploma / GED and 12 years of engineering experience Preferred Qualifications: 6+ years of experience in DS process development, characterization and/or commercial process support Knowledge of Cell Culture, Scale-up, Perfusion, and Centrifugation operations, equipment design and process control Knowledge of Chromatography, Virus Inactivation, Virus Filtration, Tangential Flow Filtration, Normal Flow Filtration, and Clean-In-Place systems are an added benefit Comprehensive understanding of Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) equipment design and biologics manufacturing requirements in accordance with the following agencies and codes: OSHA (including obtaining inspection and listed certification via NRTL), ASME B&PV, ASME BPE, NFPA 70E/79, NEC Demonstrated understanding of process engineering principles for the scale up of unit operations from bench to commercial scale. Experience using, or an understanding of the application of, Process Analytical Technologies in biotech applications. Knowledge of mechanical and material science principles pertaining to stainless and single-use applications in biopharmaceutical production Project management experience including the ability to coordinate and communicate across different functions and sites to advance sophisticated projects to completion Experience leading or supporting large capital projects, including design, procurement, commissioning, and qualification of production scale equipment Ability to build and maintain strong, multi-functional partnerships, manage project resources, and elevate relevant issues to project lead and management Experience conducting system hazard analysis (HAZOP), layer of protection analysis (LOPA), or failure mode and effect criticality analysis (FMECA). Ability to apply innovative thinking, engineering principles, and statistical analysis, including design of experiments, in-order to solve processing or equipment design issues and evaluate opportunities for improvement Experience conducting root cause analyses and solving equipment, instrumentation, or manufacturing process related issues Experience developing and transferring process technology into GMP production environment Ability to work under minimal direction on multiple projects in a deadline driven environment. Drug Substance Manufacturing Senior Manager - MST The Senior Manager of Manufacturing will lead a team responsible for safe and compliant manufacturing within ATO B23. ATO B23 manufactures clinical and commercial drug substance, introduces multiple new products annually and implements new DS manufacturing technologies. The Manufacturing Support Team (MST) provides critical support to the manufacturing operation ensuring equipment readiness for processing, raw materials availability, consumables, and critical process buffers are prepared and available for use, ensuring the manufacturing process runs efficiently and to schedule. Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. The Sr Manager of Manufacturing will interact with multiple functions across Amgen and will have the opportunity to influence technology development at Amgen, drive safety culture and focus on continuous improvement and sustainability. The Sr Manager of Manufacturing is encouraged to have a deep understanding of cell culture and purification unit operations, process equipment, automation systems, scheduling and have strong demonstrated leadership capabilities. Responsibilities include: Lead and advise an organization of 40 – 50 manufacturing associates Develop, own, and deliver CI and sustainability programs for the area Staff selection, training, oversight, performance evaluations, and development Represents the plant and functional area during regulatory inspections Ensures schedule adherence for tasks including but not limited to manufacturing, qualification, and maintenance activities Ensures standard operating procedures are accurate for executing unit operations, batch record review is completed accurately meeting disposition timelines, and non-conformances are initiated and closed with right the first-time documentation Utilizes appropriate systems for job duties (SAP, QMTS, and LIMS etc.) Lead and manage cross functional projects, advance maturity of new technology in preparation for commercialization, which is accomplished through collaborating with pilot plant, drug substance process development, engineering, quality and manufacturing staff Interacts with business partners and internal/external audit teams including regulatory agencies Identifies and implements process and safety improvements Assists in the introduction of new products into the facility Interacts with business partners to assist with scheduling of maintenance tasks, engineering evaluations, quality control sample submission, and quality investigations. Communicate production floor and project work at different levels of management Elevate critical and impactful events to plant director Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our outstanding contributions to serve patients. Ability to lead at all levels of the organization and effectively partner throughout the organization and across functions. jobTitle: Early Development Leader - Solid Tumor, Oncology
jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Early Development Leader - Solid Tumor, Oncology Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. Amgen is advancing the largest early Oncology pipeline in our history spanning several innovative technology platforms – Bispecific T Cell Engagers (BiTE®s), Cellular Therapies, Bispecific Antibodies, Small Molecules, and Oncolytic Viruses – across many targets and more than a dozen tumor types. We seek collaborative and innovative world-class talent to ensure these molecules become medicines and reach their full potential while helping patients. To support that effort, the Oncology Early Development Group is looking for a Medical Director. The Medical Director will lead early phase clinical development of oncology compounds from first-in-human studies through proof of concept. They define, design, and execute early phase clinical and translational projects as the initial strategy for drug development. They typically serve as clinical project leaders for one or more of Amgen’s Product Strategy Teams through their role as an Early Development Leader (EDL). These experts represent Medical Sciences/Early Development internally and externally, contributing intellectual insight into experimental design and data analysis. They provide subject matter expertise in clinical and translational trial science as well as the biology and treatment of cancer. Responsibilities: Serve as an internal clinical expert in translational and clinical oncology. Serve as medical monitor for clinical trials and assist in resolving major issues that may affect the studies. Present information internally and externally, anticipating and proactively managing problems across a broad spectrum of cross-functional teams. Coordinate clinical approaches to operational issues and assign monitoring and safety reporting resources. Provide guidance and assistance in the identification and management of oncology phase 1 collaborators, consultants, and/or Clinical Research Organizations (CROs) in the completion of key projects. Ensure appropriate training, recruitment, and development requirements for matrix team resources. Will be the primary Medical Sciences contact for basic scientists studying hematologic and solid tumor malignancies as well as for clinical research scientists overseeing later clinical development. Evaluate external opportunities for partnering or licensing new oncology assets Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The Clinical Research Medical Professional we seek is a leader with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: MD or DO degree from an accredited medical school AND 2 years of clinical research and/or basic science research experience Preferred Qualifications: Subspecialty board eligibility/certification in Oncology/Hematology. Strong basic science or clinical research background in academia or industry Prior experience authoring, monitoring, analyzing, and presenting oncology clinical trials Effective presentation and communication abilities (both written and oral) Ability to anticipate problems and find creative solutions In-depth understanding of the scientific method and clinical applications based on medical, scientific, and practical rationale including working knowledge of biomarker methods and clinical imaging endpoints A record of high-quality peer-reviewed publications Experience functioning as a medical expert in a complex matrixed environment Previous experience in early phase development and/or biomarker work Previous experience in late-stage oncology clinical trials and regulatory filings Demonstrated expertise in conducting translational and/or clinical oncology research Expertise in Spotfire or other data analysis tools Knowledge of GCP, EMA, and FDA policies Expertise in authoring clinical sections of CTA or INDs Thrive What You Can Expect Of Us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. In this pivotal role, you will drive extraordinary EHSS performance across the site in a diverse biotech/pharma environment. The role will be responsible for the implementation of key EHSS processes, including: Overall EHSS support for diverse and complex manufacturing processes Measuring EHSS performance through the use of leading and lagging indicators Analysis of EHSS data while providing constructive feedback/mentor when appropriate Provide subject matter expertise (SME) on several EHSS programs, including process safety, combustible powder, chemical safety, and industrial safety. Responsibilities Partner with internal clients (including but not limited to pilot plant, manufacturing, facilities & engineering, warehouse operations, etc.) to enhance EHSS performance Provide guidance and support to clients so that: EHSS is integrated strongly into facilities, products/processes, and business decision change management EHSS risks are evaluated, prevented, controlled, and reduced through proper risk mitigation planning Staff/contractors demonstrate active caring behavior while integrating EHSS into their daily work and decisions Substandard performance and errors are investigated and learned from Support and implement EHSS Management System processes such as change control, complex risk assessments, audits, inspections, behavior-based safety activities, training, etc. Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. An ability to lead teams with varied strengths and influence management 5 – 7 years of experience in the pharmaceutical/biotech industry implementing industrial and safety programs Strong communication and presentation skills, productive, self-starting, program development and project management Strong technical writing skills Understanding of hazardous area classification, combustible powders, PSM (Process Safety Management) and chemical safety Experience in emergency response planning Ability to read P&IDs Ability to translate complex process safety topics into comprehensible language for managers and operators Certified Industrial Hygienist (CIH) and or Certified Safety Professional (CSP) Thrive Some of the vast rewards of working here As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role. EHS Manager, Business Performance Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. This position reports to the Global Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) Business Performance and Operational Excellence Director. The successful candidate will be an experienced EHS professional responsible for: Global Program Owner for incident investigation and management. Work with site EHS leads to establish incident investigation standards and methodologies, monitor the quality of incident investigations, ensure adequate training is available, and to lead serious incident investigations when and where needed. Global Program Owner for EHS inspection management. Work with EHS site and program leads to establish inspection standards, methodologies, and tools. Work with our inspection management system to help sites upload inspection schedules, maintain inspection checklists, and run performance reports. Responsibilities include determining training needs and provide subject matter expertise when needed. EHS performance analysis and metrics reporting. Work with Global Program Owners to establish efficient means to collect performance data, establish central data repository systems, and use data analytics and reporting tools such as Tableau to make trending results and metrics reports available to staff and management. Accuracy and integrity of data reports. Periodically auditing source data to ensure accuracy and integrity of reported business performance measures. Examples of reported performance measures include recordable injury rates, lost-time injury rates, notices of compliance violations, and the various EHS management system elements that are used to mitigate EHS risks. Prepare reports and provide updates to EHS and Amgen management on emerging performance trends and provide recommendations to mitigate or manage these trends. Assist in preparation and data review for the company external reporting (CRCC, ESG, etc.) Responsible for optimizing data flow and reporting Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The dynamic professional we seek is an individual with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree and Or Master’s degree and 3 years of directly related experience Or Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of directly related experience Or Associate’s degree and 10 years of directly related experience Or High school diploma / GED and 12 years of directly related experience Preferred Qualifications: Master’s degree in a Science or Engineering program and 4 years of directly related experience. Bachelor’s degree in a Science or Engineering program and 6 years of directly related experience. Conversant across multiple EHS fields Uses a management system approach to drive continuous improvement Ability to work in teams to accomplish common goals Self-driven, managing multiple activities and set priorities Makes decisions easily within sphere of influence Excellent written, oral and presentation skills. Microsoft Office skills (Excel subject matter expertise and PowerPoint); and Proficient with a variety of IS applications and databases including SharePoint, Tableau and Tableau Prep, and Smartsheet. Delivers high-quality work products with minimal supervision. Strong analytical, numerical, and reasoning abilities. Proficient facilitation, negotiation, problem-solving and conflict resolution skills Ability to explain complex concepts clearly to executive management. Strong interpersonal skills, ability to interface cross-functionally in a dynamic environment. Highly driven, focused, energetic, with a strong attention to detail. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role. Engineer—Mechanical Auto-injector Platform Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this dynamic role you will participate in the design, development and lifecycle management of drug delivery devices and combination products. This includes technical operations support for design control activities, failure investigation, leading and assessing design changes, development of test procedures, scale-up, global launch, supplier development, contract manufacturing, and continuous improvement. Scope includes mechanical injection systems such as fluid transfer devices and automatic pen injectors. The qualified candidate will be part of a device engineering team that manages lifecycle and maintains design history files of the mechanical delivery devices and combination products. The engineer will participate in multi-functional teams to support activities such as analytical failure analysis, developing product improvements, implementing design solutions, assessment of proposed changes, product launches, defending inspection, and follow through of commitments. Responsibilities include: Applying all conventional aspects of the subject matter, functional area, and assignments. Plan and conduct work requiring judgment in the independent evaluation, selection, and substantial adaptation and modification of standard techniques, procedures and criteria, and devise innovative ways to solve problems. Accountability of developing and maintaining technical records within design history file associated with assigned products. Develop test method, generate and maintain design specification. Responsible for protocol and report writing, prototyping, DOE/SPC, product optimization, design verification and validation, FMEA, etc. Lead or support system level root cause investigation, coordinate design improvements with development partners, problem solving, critical thinking, and implementation of design changes and improvements. Work with Scientists and Engineers internally and externally to assess and develop appropriate design and manufacturing specifications. Individual contributor with Leadership attributes to effectively represent Platform Device Engineering within a large network and matrix organization. Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The Engineering professional we seek is a collaborative partner with these qualifications. Engineer- Physical Methods Amgen discovers, develops and delivers innovative human therapeutics. A biotechnology pioneer since 1980, Amgen was one of the first companies to realize the new science’s promise by bringing safe, effective medicines from lab, to manufacturing plant, to patient. Amgen therapeutics have changed the practice of medicine, helping millions of people around the world in the fight against cancer, kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis, and other serious illnesses. With a deep and broad pipeline of potential new medicines, Amgen remains committed to advancing science to dramatically improve people’s lives. The Engineer, in Physical Methods, is responsible for engineering activities required for the development / qualification / validation and transfer of physical GMP test methods for combination products, devices, primary containers, and secondary packaging components. The Engineer shall have the ability to work on multiple projects at one time that may involve changes or new product, processes, tooling or equipment introduction to improve quality and reliability and reduce cost. Phases of projects include: developing combination product test methods, providing key expert support for qualification, validation, transfer, and life cycle support of methods for manufacturing, new product introduction, training, and production support. Responsibilities Develop, qualify, and validate GMP physical test methods for vials, prefilled syringes, and injection devices. Work in teams to transfer new combination product test method and assembly requirements to manufacturing, by developing six sigma processes and compiling documentation for manufacturing assembly requirements. Develop, qualify, validate, and transfer new equipment, software, systems, and methods. Implement projects per Final Product Technologies and company procedures to ensure projects are completed on schedule and within established budget. Provide expert support for investigations as well as new process development required to improve manufacturing operations. Coordinate test method development and delivery with selected contractors. Ensure that qualification parameters are met for product assembly requirements. Support development of cost estimates for new processes, gauges and equipment development used in generation of capital request documentation. Generate procedures necessary to support department and new process equipment. Provide expert training to individuals in the operation and maintenance of processes, test methods and equipment introduced to Quality Control and/or the manufacturing department (i.e. production operator, mechanics, process engineers). Participate in and assume responsibilities of team functions as assigned (i.e. Product Improvement Teams). Generate/author and own the Test Method documents. Gather test method requirements that result in equipment that operates safely and considers ergonomic factors in the design Perform other duties as required by the Group Manager Comply with the requirements, responsibilities, and authority as required Maintains integrated timelines capturing appropriate cross functional details and deliverables which are aligned with the functional and project deliverables Networks internally to ensure alignment, commitment to project objectives and timelines as well as to ensure effective execution of projects Networks with manufacturing, quality and regulatory organizations both internal and external to Amgen Drives the cross-functional communication and integration of information to optimize decision making, issue resolution and change management throughout project lifecycle Excellent verbal and written communication skills are utilized to communicate project status and risks associated with integrated timelines to leadership Collaborates with other functional leaders to ensure project success, momentum and commitment Proactively identifies issues and/or risks and develops mitigation options to resolve or escalate efficiently Integrates partner/vendor timelines with Amgen timelines as appropriate Assist with CAPAs and change controls for the continuous improvement and lifecycle management of production transferred methods The position will require approximately 10% travel to international locations assisting our development partners during implementation of container closure integrity methods into their processes. Basic Qualifications Master's Degree OR Bachelor's Degree and 2 years of engineering/scientific experience OR Associate's degree and 6 years of engineering/scientific experience OR High school diploma/GED and 8 years of engineering/scientific experience. Preferred Qualifications M.S. in Mechanical Engineer, Chemical or Biomedical Engineering, or Chemistry Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to work in a highly matrixed team environment 2 years of experience in the biotechnology/pharmaceutical industry 2 years of experience in equipment, method, and mechanical design Technical writing experience Experience with SolidWorks (or other 3D-CAD software) Experience with combination products and regulatory requirements Experience utilizing Minitab (or other statistical software packages) Experience with machine controls (PLC, HMI) and vision systems Join Us If you're seeking a career where you can truly make a difference in the lives of others, a career where you can work at the absolute forefront of biotechnology with the top minds in the field, you'll find it at Amgen. HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve earned your degree. How will you use that achievement to reach your goals? Do more with the knowledge you’ve worked hard to acquire and the passion you already have. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Become the professional you are meant to be in this meaningful role. The Engineer - Technical Investigator conducts technical investigations of Level 2 and 3 complaints associated with product design and/ or usability issues and conducts trend and consolidated investigations using data analytics. This role identifies the failure mode for mechanical and/or electromechanical medical devices and associated product components such as packaging, returned due to product complaint using root cause analysis tools and processes. Additional equipment such as CT scanners, FTIR material analysis and Instron tensile test machines may be used. This engineer supports trend investigations through the review of manufacturing batch records, evaluation of returned product, product reserve sample inspections, and review of complaint histories and trends. Upon completion of these activities, this role will support authoring final reports in accordance with established procedures, which may include data collection and statistical analysis of the data. S/he will own CAPA’s in support of identifying design solutions based on root cause and will also support cross functional ideation of design solutions. Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will maintain close interaction with the engineering and quality functions to contribute to product improvement. Understand customer / patient use of/ manufacturing processes for Amgen’s packaged and/or distributed mechanical and/or electromechanical products Support technical trend and consolidated investigations, including statistical assessment of data to identify trends, as well as generation of monthly reports Support cross functional ideation of design solutions based on output of root cause analysis Support the development and performance relational data analytics in support of investigations Support failure analysis of mechanical and/or electromechanical product to identify root cause using tools such as tolerance analysis, fishbone diagrams, “5 Whys”, and risk assessments such as FMEA’s or Fault Tree Analysis CAPA ownership in support of ideation phase Provide input to management for trend and failure investigation process improvement Support functional management initiatives and objectives Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The process engineering professional we seek is a collaborative leader with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications Master’s degree OR Bachelor’s degree and 2 years of engineering or life science experience OR Associate’s degree and 6 years of engineering or life science experience OR High School diploma/GED and 8 years of engineering or life science experience Preferred Qualifications Degree in Mechanical, Electrical, or BioMed Engineering 5+ years of progressive experience as an engineer within the appropriate field of study 2+ years of experience in complaints or failure analysis investigation within a development or manufacturing environment, working with Medical Devices, ideally Class II and Class III Proven experience with mechanical and/or electromechanical medical devices Demonstrated applied 6 Sigma competency, specifically for root cause analysis methodology Knowledge of risk management per ISO 14971 (System Risk Analysis, User Risk Analysis, DFMEA/FMEA and other Risk Management tools) Experience with protocol and report writing, process and test development and execution Strong technical writing and interpersonal skills Thrive Some of the vast rewards of working here As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, so we work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role. Engineering Projects Manager Live What You Will Do Let’s do this! Let’s change the world! In this vital role within Amgen Rhode Island's Capital Projects team, the Engineering Projects Manager will direct key construction projects and programs that will make a significant contribution to the site operation and risk profile. To be successful, the candidate must have strong leadership skills, communication skills, and the ability to approach issues from a strategic perspective, as well as significant experience delivering engineering construction projects in a highly regulated GMP environment. Presently, as part of the Facilities & Engineering Organization, the team is responsible for leading key projects through excellence in Engineering and Project Management. It is critical for this individual to first and foremost understand Safety, Quality and Compliance are our highest priorities in how we manage and perform our work. The Engineering Projects Manager will lead project teams and interact across functional and site department groups to achieve project objectives. These capital projects, typically <$5M, could include facilities/utilities system and or equipment Lifecycle replacements, upgrades, manufacturing improvements and changes to support New Product Introductions. With minimal guidance, the candidate will lead all aspects of their project(s): Safety, planning, cost, schedule, risk, communications, resources, team dynamics and performance, implementation, monitoring, completion and follow-up. Duties include: Implement projects by working closely with multiple groups; including manufacturing, facilities, engineering, process development and quality assurance Supervise contingent workers as needed. These workers include construction managers and all general craft labor including CSA, electrical, architectural and mechanical Manage any construction projects, safely and compliantly, oftentimes within an operational GMP facility Implement projects in accordance with all corporate requirements, such as Environmental Health & Safety by Design and Amgen’s Engineering Project Delivery process Present projects to senior leadership at governing bodies for updates and approvals Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The Engineering Project Management professional we seek is a hands-on team player with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: High School Diploma / GED and 12 years of Engineering Field experience Or Associate’s Degree and 10 years of Engineering Field experience Or Bachelor’s Degree and 5 years of Engineering Field experience Or Master’s Degree and 3 years of Engineering Field experience Preferred Qualifications: Ten years field experience managing multiple crafts and/or contractors Engineering background preferred (Electrical) Be a team player, and self-starter who is capable of growth and increased responsibility Working knowledge of GMP Biopharmaceutical manufacturing processes and the functions that support them Significant experience of delivering Engineering Capital Projects from initial design through construction to commissioning/qualification Excellent communication skills both written and verbal are crucial for this role Demonstrated ability in leading and motivating cross-functional teams to advance complex projects to completion Demonstrated ability to forge and maintain strong relationships within multiple functional areas Ability to tactfully and effectively negotiate and influence Proficiency in project management methodology and tools Demonstrated ability in leading craft of wide skills and expertise (Mechanical, Electrical, Automation, CSA) Thrive Some of the vast rewards of working here As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. At Amgen, every challenge is an opportunity. And every opportunity brings the potential to change lives. Our shared mission—to serve patients—has driven our status as one of the world’s preeminent biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Leverage your high-level expertise to lead and forge partnerships that advance the biotechnical and biopharmaceutical science that can turn the tide of serious, life-interrupting illnesses. Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role, the Executive Director, Cybersecurity will be directly accountable for delivering high quality Digital Forensics & Incident Response (DFIR) and Cyber Operations services across Amgen’s global operating environment. This leadership position provides timely reports to the Global Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) and other leaders to help manage broader business risk decisions. The Executive Director works with stakeholders from Digital, Technology & Innovation (DTI), Human Resources, Compliance, Law, Corporate Security, and Privacy to effectively monitor, detect, respond, and recover Amgen’s valuable information systems during a cyber crisis. The Executive Director is responsible for organizing, developing, training, and equipping a diverse global team of Amgen staff and contractors in manner that is aligned to Amgen’s core values. The leader performs all activities that support service delivery management to include planning, designing, building, testing, and deploying solutions and processes that enable Amgen’s ability to serve patients. The role incorporates stakeholder driven engagements and requires 24/7 coverage, as cyber crises can emerge at any moment. The leader, by way of effective targeted communications, ensures strategic alignment with staff, business constituents, key stakeholders, and leaders. The Executive Director, Cybersecurity is part of the Global Information Protection Leadership Team and reports to the Vice President Information Security and Global CISO (based at Amgen’s Headquarters in Thousand Oaks, California). Key responsibilities include: Leads strategy development, quality control, compliance, and continuous improvement of Amgen’s global Cybersecurity Operations (Monitoring, Detection, and Attack Surface Reduction), and Digital Forensics & Incident Response, eDiscovery, and Security Orchestration and Automation Response (SOAR) services Delivers timely transparency reports to the key stakeholders and senior business leadership Engages in collaboration with global industry partners and service providers on Cyber Resilience as a contributor for the Health Information Sharing and Analysis Center (H-ISAC) Manages cross-functional security teams to achieve continuous improvement in cyber defense/response Accountable for technologies and designs that ensure integration and interoperability with Amgen’s technology ecosystem Builds and manages services and technologies roadmap based on industry frameworks (e.g., ISO 27001/2) Maintains outstanding service delivery and ensures effective issue identification, problem resolution, tool integration, documentation, gap assessment, gap resolution and continuous improvement Collaborates diligently with global functional teams (e.g., Law) to manage cyber risk Builds and executes effective communications plans during incidents Adheres to the DTI enterprise tool rationalization process by employing best of breed and platform technologies that align to the GIP and DTI ecosystem Acts as an escalation point for procedural issues and becomes engaged in critical system related issues/events, as needed Manages a diverse global team of security engineers, security analysts, and security managers across JAPAC, EU and North America Creates and manages budgets for yearly support, enhancements and build efforts and maximize resource allocation across multiple services and tools; this includes operational costs for resources (full time employees, contract workers, and managed service providers) used to operate the department Empowers employees through Amgen’s Decision, Advice, Inform (DAI) model; delegates responsibilities accordingly and expects accountability and regular feedback Fosters teamwork and unity among department members that allows for disagreement over ideas, conflict and expeditious resolution, and the appreciation of diversity Coaches, mentors, and develops staff, including overseeing new employee onboarding and provides quarterly career development sessions Leads employees using a performance management and development process that provides an overall context and framework to encourage employee contribution and includes goal setting, and continuous feedback Guides the talent identification and development processes Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The professional we seek is a leader with these qualifications. Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will support and lead the Global Infrastructure Services team. This position will report to the Vice President of Digital, Technology, and Innovation (DTI) – Research and Development Informatics (R&DI) and Global Infrastructure Services (GIS). The Executive Director of DTI – Global Infrastructure Services will lead a global team of approximately 130 professionals and a team of strategic technology service providers in the support and evolution of Amgen’s digital infrastructure. They will oversee, direct, and manage all aspects of global service delivery (outsourced, managed service providers, contingent workers, and staff) related to the Amgen’s digital infrastructure, including Amgen’s corporate cloud services and automation, software engineering platforms, development operations and testing platforms, network & monitoring, systems management, and other technology platforms/capabilities. This role will be accountable for the development and deployment of a modern infrastructure combining traditional on prem network, compute, and storage for highly resilient business capabilities, with large scale cloud implementation, modern software engineering platforms, as well as monitoring, self-healing, and automation. The includes responsibility for collaborative strategy development, and implementation and operational management of Amgen’s ongoing migration to a predominantly cloud-based environment. This role also plays an important role in shaping our overall Amgen Technology Strategy. It is essential that this role proactively and strategically partner with the business facing and enterprise DTI teams as well as key business partners such as our manufacturing operations sites. The Executive Director will be responsible for and have global decision rights for the development, deployment and execution of the global infrastructure strategy and resources, including responsibility for maintaining and refining the vision, strategy and execution of the Global Infrastructure Services Plan and Cloud Operating Model deployed across more than 50 countries globally. Key Responsibilities include: Develop and execute a global plan to complete migration from remaining eligible on-premises infrastructure environment to a primarily cloud-based environment. This role will be accountable for all aspects of the migration plan including identifying and mitigating operational risks, developing, and delivering on financial targets and global communication and change management activities. Responsible for design, development, and implementation of Infrastructure engineering to include the development of an infrastructure engineering organization and the development of the global infrastructure engineering capability. Accountable for translating the collective information needs of Global Infrastructure Services into clear strategy and action plans. Provide leadership for the implementation of the DTI strategy within Global Infrastructure Services. The strategy provides a foundation for organizational effectiveness and requires effective business process and information integration. Champion innovation and build strong relationships with others who are either drivers of innovation or sponsors/key stakeholders for innovative investments. Establish external networks and engage as appropriate to ensure strategies are developed with appropriate consideration of environmental factors, competitive intelligence and/or awareness of new possibilities offered through digital capabilities. Influence the development of business area strategy where appropriate. This should be done more than just informally, for example through the proactive presentation of solution options that might address key business problems and/or opportunities and that might be considered for Long Range Plans or nearer-term investments. Evaluate key business challenges and direct solution execution. Frame problems and solutions in the context of choices we can make. Additional accountabilities Include: Provides leadership and direction for all operational activities related to Infrastructure Services on Amgen premises and in the Cloud – including compute, network operations, storage, development operations, automation platforms, and data hosting & monitoring services. Optimizes Amgen’s global infrastructure including our networks, core infrastructure, databases, servers, and other components to provide performance and seamless integration of services globally. Ensure resilience in infrastructure to support the organizational growth, minimize outages and meet the global organizational resilience needs (high reliability). In partnership with key customers and service-provider partners, continuously improve and advance Amgen’s Infrastructure and associated offerings by applying best practices, and fit for-purpose decision making Coordinate with internal teams and service providers to ensure infrastructure service projects are planned, executed, and achieve business/cost objectives Ensure compliance with enterprise technology policy, process, procedures, and controls by all staff Ensure all servers, storage environments and data centers and related systems and tools have sufficient capacity to meet the current and future business needs and effective and efficient strategies around lifecycle management and refresh Provide the leadership and detailed technical expertise for the overall cloud, network, datacenter, storage, virtualization, and network design Accountable for communication to Functional and Site leadership regarding DTI initiatives, including those that are directly in support of Global Infrastructure Services and those that are more generally benefitting the Enterprise as a whole. Lead, manage, recruit, and retain team of technology staff in support of Global Infrastructure Services. Champion innovation and build strong relationships with others who are either drivers of innovation or sponsors/key stakeholders for innovative investments. Leadership capabilities include: Accountable for succession planning and talent development across the Global Infrastructure Services team. This leader will provide regulatory expertise and guidance to therapeutic area commercialization teams and other governance bodies with responsibility for development and execution of global therapeutic area regulatory product strategies for the oncology portfolio; represent Global Regulatory Affairs on Therapeutic Area Governance (TAG) and other key commercialization governance bodies; and lead and oversee the United States regulatory strategies, submissions, and interactions within the oncology therapeutic area. of global regulatory strategies and the US Regulatory Lead (USRL) in the development of US regulatory strategies, including precedence, risk management and contingency planning Provide global oversight of regulatory decisions within the oncology therapeutic area Management review and approval of Global Regulatory Strategic Plan Participate and represent Global Regulatory Affairs on TAG, providing expert regulatory strategy and regulatory decision making Management review and approval of key documents for regulatory submissions Participate in the Executive Labeling Board (ELB) and agency interactions Advocate for Amgen and Global Regulatory Affairs by building relationships with key external stakeholders including senior regulatory agencies, trade associations, and influential professional bodies Work externally to influence regulatory legislative environment in line with Amgen policy priorities for the therapeutic area Participate and represent Amgen Global Regulatory Affairs on external partnership committees Oversee and participate in licensing/acquisition due diligence and other activities in partnership with Amgen Licensing groups Provide managerial leadership and direction to the global and United States regulatory teams within assigned area Recruit, engage and retain talented regulatory affairs professionals. jobTitle: Global Category Sr Manager - Strategy - US remote
jobDescription: Job Summary The Global Category Strategic Sourcing Senior Manager – Strategy will report into the Executive Director Center of Excellence - Enabling Capabilities within Global Procurement.  The role will own the strategic category management process and utilize the process to create 3-5-year category strategies.  The Senior Manager will be accountable to understand business strategy and then develop a comprehensive, long term, category strategy in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.  They will also be accountable for providing detailed analytical insights and fact base to support the strategy. The Sr. Manager will use an agile Category Management approach to develop strategies to identify breakthrough value opportunities.  Strategic Contribution Partners with internal and external stakeholders to understand business strategy and translates internal and external market data to formulate a strategic plan to deliver year on year Productivity Acts as a trusted business advisor providing category management expertise whilst developing category strategies Leads and influences stakeholder groups with sound and articulate business case recommendations (i.e., build vs buy strategy) with quantifiable financial benefits Serves as team expert on the Category Management process and can effectively utilize the tools and associated outputs to drive comprehensive, long term category strategy development Deep dive data analytics to develop insights addressing current/future business needs Delivering Value for Customers Owns the category management process and the frame-work and set of practices used to optimally manage supply categories to meet business objectives Owns the entire data collection and data lifecycle process, ensuring consistency, scrubbing, cleaning and quality of the data to ensure accuracy to support category strategy development Understanding of the Agile methodology and ability to apply it to the Category Management process   Developing Category Strategies Proven ability to utilize a fact-based category management process to develop multi-year category strategies, including internal business requirements and external market forces Able to build analytical models to evaluate the potential value of category scenarios / options / recommendations Brings and grows internal function-specific fact-base and proactively identifies opportunities for Productivity Change Management Ability to constructively challenge executive leadership; and ability to develop and evaluate strategic options, including risks and risk mitigation strategies Compelling and persuasive communicator (oral and written) with excellent interpersonal and influencing skills Ability to influence team members in a matrix organization, across geographies, including individuals with no direct reporting line   Analytical & Technical Proven technical knowledge and business ability related to a broad base of spend categories within the Biotech industry Ability to develop and model multiple business cases to demonstrate the potential opportunities and impact of options across a category Proficiency in MS Office tools (PowerPoint and excel), analytical tools, ERP systems etc. CPM qualification (US) or CIPS qualification (UK) is desirable Experienced with Agile methodology Basic Qualifications Doctorate degree and 2 years of Sourcing plus any combination of Management Consulting, Investment Banking, Strategy, Supply Chain Management, Procurement OR Master’s degree and 4 years of Management Consulting, Investment Banking, Strategy, Supply Chain Management, Procurement OR Bachelor’s degree and 6 years of Management Consulting, Investment Banking, Strategy, Supply Chain Management, Procurement OR Associate’s degree and 10 years of Management Consulting, Investment Banking, Strategy, Supply Chain Management, Procurement OR High school diploma / GED and Management Consulting, Investment Banking, Strategy, Supply Chain Management, Procurement Preferred Qualifications Ability to provide thought leadership, ability to influence and actively shape strategy Strong executive communicator with the ability to create and communicate complex business cases in a simple and effective manner Solid analytical skills that drive strategic insights Independent self-starter and able to motivate others to accomplish ambiguous tasks Solid understanding of procurement/sourcing/category management methodology and able to drive value for customers leveraging the right sourcing levers Excellent and disciplined project management and prioritization skills with ability to react to project adjustments and alterations promptly and efficiently Amgen is committed to unlocking the potential of biology for patients suffering from serious illnesses by discovering, developing, manufacturing and delivering innovative human therapeutics. jobTitle: Global Category Sr. Manager - US remote
jobDescription: The Global Category Strategic Sourcing Sr. Manager will report into the Global Research, Process Development, and Contract Manufacturing Director within Global Strategic Sourcing (GSS). Role will be responsible for developing sourcing strategy, leading supplier selection and supplier relationship management for the Lab Consumables, Lab Support Services (LSS), Lab Equipment, and LAMP (Lab Asset Management Program) categories (~$200M spend). The Manager will be accountable to understand business strategy and then develop a comprehensive, long term, category strategy which will deliver maximum value to Amgen internal customers, shareholders and patients in this spend category. Strategic Contribution Serves as the category leader and market expert in this category for the company Develops strong, mutually beneficial relationships with key internal stakeholders to understand internal needs and strategies Develops deep supplier relationships and expert understanding of the supply market Collaboratively creates a multiyear strategy for the category that will delivery year over year productivity Leads the Supplier and Source selection process for the category Provides leadership in establishing supplier segmentation and supports the SRM process Provides subject matter advice to internal and external stakeholder groups addressing current/future business needs, demonstrating marketplace knowledge Acts as a trusted business advisor, providing thought leadership and consistent customer service Leads the contracting process and strategy for the related supply base. Leads and influences stakeholder groups with sound and articulate business case recommendations (i.e. make vs. buy strategy) with quantifiable financial benefits Ability to effectively communicate strategies, drive decisions and challenge stakeholders Champion of Productivity efforts within the category Delivering Value for Customers Owns the category management process and the frame-work and set of practices used to optimally Acts as an ambassador for the GSS function and be the key point of contact for the category, both within and outside of GSS Effectively drives cross-category collaboration where ‘overlapping’ stakeholder groups, geographic regions and / or requirements exist Manages, minimizes and mitigates supply/contractual/regulatory risk by leveraging other key Amgen functions where appropriate Ability to develop and model multiple business cases to demonstrate the potential opportunities and impact of options across a category Analytical & Technical Proven technical knowledge and business ability related to Contract Manufacturing categories within the Biotech industry Proven ability to use the Category Management process and ability to use relevant tools to develop strategic plans Ability to develop baseline cost models to accurately represent current state and ability to build dynamic total cost of ownership models with multiple scenarios in order to evaluate and quantify value Proficiency in MS Office tools (PowerPoint and excel), analytical tools, ERP systems etc. CPM qualification (US) or CIPS qualification (UK) is desirable Basic Qualifications Doctorate degree and 2 years of Sourcing plus any combination of Finance, Engineering/Computer Science, Management Consulting and Data Sciences experience OR Master’s degree and 6 years of Sourcing plus any combination of Finance, Engineering/Computer Science, Management Consulting and Data Sciences experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 8 years of Sourcing plus any combination of Finance, Engineering/Computer Science, Management Consulting and Data Sciences experience OR Associate degree and 10 years of Sourcing plus any combination of Finance, Engineering/Computer Science, Management Consulting and Data Sciences experience OR High school diploma / GED and 12 years of Sourcing plus any combination of Finance, Engineering/Computer Science, Management Consulting and Data Sciences experience Preferred Qualifications Solid understanding of procurement/sourcing/category management methodology and able to drive value for customers leveraging fit-for-purpose sourcing levers Excellent and disciplined project management and prioritization skills with ability to react to project adjustments and alterations promptly and efficiently Ability to conform to shifting priorities and have ability to drive multiple simultaneous projects Strong business acumen in order to quickly understand functional/category dynamics and develop category strategies that drive value Proven ability to deliver complex multi-regional and/or global projects in a matrixed and global environment Broad knowledge of the market forces shaping a customer’s business context (e.g. supplier base, legal & regulatory environment, sources of competitive advantage) Ability to understand external market information, including ability to conduct benchmarking to address cost, quality, risk and innovation considerations Ability to understand cost drivers, internal costs and future demand and re requirements Ability to provide thought leadership, ability to influence and actively shape strategy Strong financial acumen and problem-solving skills Independent self-starter and able to motivate others to accomplish ambiguous tasks Clear thinker, disciplined, logical and organized with the ability to prioritize Strong oral and written communication / presentation / collaboration skills Strong executive communicator with the ability to create and communicate complex business cases in human therapeutics. This approach begins by using tools like advanced human genetics to unravel the complexities of disease and understand the fundamentals of human biology. jobTitle: Global Customer Capabilities Director, Web Strategy & Operations (US Remote)
jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Global Customer Capabilities Director, Web Strategy & Operations (US Remote) Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world! In this vital role will work globally and cross functionally to hone Amgen’s digital web strategy, conceptualize and execute critical digital capability builds suitable for our commercial and Medical functions, and oversee global web operations and governance. You will be responsible to define Amgen’s global web ambition, establish our web standards and guidance, identify strategic opportunities and lead execution to standardize Amgen’s compliant approach to web operations, lead development and scaling of strategic web solutions, optimize our global governance for the web channel, advise global Commercial and Medical functions and local affiliates on web solutions to solve their business needs, lead change management and the adoption of new web solutions and processes; and act as product owner for strategic digital assets. Driving our digital strategy is a critical success factor for Amgen. The successful candidate will assess market trends and listen to our global affiliates across Commercial and Medical to shape the vision, as well as inspire their team to oversee the critical collaborations and milestones needed to get us there. This Director position will report to the Executive Director of Global Customer Capabilities (GCC), Digital, and will collaborate closely with leadership and multiple cross functional partners across Amgen. Key Responsibilities: Assess the digital landscape internal and external to Amgen to stay on top of trends, ensure future proofing, and drive better experiences for our end users Work with a broad array of global cross-functional partners within commercial, medical, marketing, technology, compliance, legal, regulatory, privacy, and data & analytics to achieve our goals in a compliant and effective manner Work to identify and drive efficiencies to improve processes, operating models, speed to market, and compliant access to data Effectively partner with Amgen’s 3rd parties to benchmark and pressure test ideas, and foster a culture of collaboration Manage, coach, and inspire team members to ensure they are fulfilled and understand how their work aligns with Amgen’s mission of serving patients Act as Business owner for multiple web solutions across global commercial and medical functions Maintain awareness and drive pull through within the web space re: compliance and privacy nuances across the globe (e.g., GDPR, CCPA, CPRA) Understand the crucial importance of change management and act as a champion with a strong ethical ability to influence Prioritize, forecast, and effectively manage a budget Employ a fact-based approach, based on data and analytics, to propose and support ideas in the digital space Promote an environment of Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DI&B) Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The strategic professional we seek is a collaborative partner with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree and 4 years of commercial or medical operations, information sciences, and/or project management experience Or Master’s degree and 8 years of commercial or medical operations, information sciences, and/or project management experience Or Bachelor’s degree and 10 years of commercial or medical operations, information sciences, and/or project management experience And 4 years of managerial experience directly managing people and/or leadership experience leading teams, projects, programs or directing the allocation of resources Preferred Qualifications: Technical skills including the ability to understand Amgen’s systems/ecosystem, websites, data & user flows, registration, and validation needs across the globe, GxP requirements, and integrations 3+ years of managerial experience directly managing people 5+ years of experience working in commercial or medical leadership roles Prior experience with cross functional team leadership Understanding and experience working in Agile methodology model Strong relationship building skills, with proven ability to build and maintain lasting relationships with stakeholders Ability to exercise strong decision-making skills and live up to the highest ethical standards Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong track record in leading cross-functional teams in a matrix environment Thrive What You Can Expect Of Us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being.
