The Global Marketing Executive Director/ Global Marketing Leader (GML) for General Medicine serves as primary Global Commercial Operations (GCO) interface with Research & Development and Operations. You will provide commercial leadership and “one GCO voice” throughout the lifecycle of the product and serve as a center of excellence for disseminating GCO best practices across regions. The GML position is complex and demanding. It will require a commercial executive with marketing capabilities, analytical skills, cross-functional collaboration skills, the ability to operate globally and locally, and highly effective influencing skills. Assigned products for this role include Repatha and key responsibilities of this position include: Key contributor of the Product Team (PT) and potential for Product Team Lead (PTL) assignment Leadership of the Insight and Brand Platform Team Development and execution of Global Commercial Plan (GCP) and leadership role in Global Brand Planning Ensuring that Amgen maximize the value its pipeline and inline brands Leading all Global Marketing activities for assigned brands consistent with agreed Global Marketing processes Provide Commercial input on Business Development efforts Manage and coordinate with our Partners Communicate commercial vision for the product Ensure timeliness and quality of key commercial inputs Forge relationships and cross-functional collaboration and regional collaboration Represent commercial interests on Research Project Teams and licensing teams Communicate regional interests to create consolidated and integrated global marketing perspective – “one GCO voice” Ensure Insight and Brand Platform Team members including regions and functions deliver upon the GCP Facilitate quality and timely cross regional product specific knowledge and best practice sharing Develop and oversee execution of global market research strategy Co-development of documentation and portal materials and presentations Manage global marketing budget in support of the above Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The professional we seek is a leader with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications Doctorate degree & 6 or more years of marketing experience OR Master’s degree & 10 or more years of marketing experience OR Bachelor’s degree & 12 or more years of marketing experience AND 6 years of managerial experience directly managing people and/or leadership experience leading teams, projects, programs or directing the allocation of resources Preferred Qualifications At least eight years of experience and a series of commercial roles of increasing scope, scale, and complexity, with leading companies in the biopharmaceutical industry Experience developing and implementing innovative global marketing and commercial strategies for pipeline products, successfully launching therapeutic products and repositioning products to maximize commercial value. Prior experience launching multiple products in diverse therapeutic areas is highly desirable Experience in commercial positions with global responsibilities is important. Experience living and working outside the United States is highly desirable. Possesses an understanding of broad, global market dynamics and the cultural awareness and sensitivity to form relationships and work effectively with colleagues around the world Broad therapeutic area expertise. Has worked in diverse commercial roles supporting several different disease states, on products in various stages of the lifecycle, with a diverse set of customers in challenging and competitive markets. Experience supporting partnered assets/programs is desirable Experience in a tactical, “line” marketing role, implementing marketing strategies in local markets, is a plus Understanding of global market access, pricing, and reimbursement issues Experience leading cross-functional teams in a matrix environment, managing global projects involving multiple functions and shared accountabilities Experience supporting product licensing and acquisition transactions. Has contributed commercial expertise in evaluating internal assets and prioritizing external opportunities. jobTitle: Global Safety Medical Director- Global Safety Officer US-Remote
jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us. Global Safety Medical Director Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role within the Global Patient Safety (GPS) organization, you will serve as the safety expert for the assigned development product(s), establishing the strategy, direction, and priorities of pharmacovigilance activities and will be accountable for the overall safety profile and all product-related decisions and deliverables for assigned products. You will also lead the Safety Analysis Team (SAT) and Global Safety Team (GST) and will be a core member of the Executive Safety Committee (ESC). In addition, you will participate as a member of the Evidence Generation Team and other relevant cross functional teams and will be assigned as delegate for the Therapeutic Area Head (TAH) and have management of Global Safety Physicians. Key Activities: Validate safety signals and lead safety signal assessments Develop and maintain Core Safety Information (core data sheet, core risks in informed consent forms, etc.) Prepare/review core and regional risk management plans including additional risk minimization measures Prepare/review safety sections of periodic aggregate reports Provide safety input to protocols, statistical analysis plans, and clinical study reports Prepare/review safety sections of new drug applications and other regulatory filings Serve as safety expert on Evidence Generation Team for assigned products Inspection Readiness Travel: Domestic and International travel up to 10% may be essential Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The medical professional we seek is a proactive leader with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: MD or DO degree from an accredited medical school OR PhD OR PharmD AND 2 years of global safety experience in Oncology, Inflammation, Nephrology, Bone, Cardiovascular or Neurology Preferred Skills: Clinical/medical research experience Product safety or clinical development in the biotech or pharmaceutical industry Previous management and or mentoring experience Experience in leading teams and or projects Expertise in Signal Detection Strategy and/or Risk Management Strategy Plans Previous experience in lead safety signal esculations with executive leadership and interactions with regulatory authorities. Vast opportunities to learn and move up and across our global organization Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where teammates are empowered to bring ideas to the table and act Generous Total Rewards Plan comprising health, finance and wealth, work/life balance, and career benefits Apply now for a career that defies imagination In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Our medicines have helped millions of patients in the fight against cancer, kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis and other serious illnesses. jobTitle: Global Safety Medical Officer - General Medicine
jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Global Safety Medical Officer – General Medicine Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will serve two primary functions: A safety expert of the assigned product(s), establishing the strategy, direction, and priorities of pharmacovigilance activities. Be accountable for the overall safety profile and all product-related decisions and deliverables for assigned products. The GSO leads the Safety Analysis Team (SAT), Global Safety Team (GST) and is a core member of the Executive Safety Committee (ESC). The GSO also is a member of the Evidence Generation Team. The GSO will be assigned as delegate for the TAH as needed and has management of Global Safety Physicians. Below are the key responsibilities: Accountable for the overall safety profile and all product-related decisions and deliverables for assigned product (s) Accountable for Product safety profile, benefit-risk evaluation, and risk communication for the assigned product Develop signal detection strategy, evaluate safety signal detection findings, validate signals, need for further actions on safety issues, cross-functional discussion, and further communication as needed and lead safety signal assignments Develop and maintain core reference safety information like Development Core Safety Information (DCSI), and Core safety information portions of Core Data Sheet (CDS) Prepare and review core and regional risk management plans including additional risk minimization measures Prepare and review safety sections of periodic aggregate reports Provide safety input to protocols, statistical analysis plans, and clinical study reports Prepare and review safety section of new drug applications and other regulatory filings Serve as safety expert Evidence Generation Team for assigned products; Participate in safety governance meetings per Standard Operating Procedures and Manuals such as Facilitates, Chairs, and Presents Participate in cross-functional teams and serve as the delegate for the Therapeutic Area Head Be a representative and point of contact for Health Authority Inspection and Internal Process Audits within the remit of role and responsibility Develop a strategy as needed for updating safety-related portions of Investigator’s Brochure and Informed Consent Form Participate in activities related to Data Monitoring Committees (DMCs) and internal data review teams (DRTs) Travel: Domestic and International travel up to 10% may be essential While this position is based at our main headquarters in Thousand Oaks, California, other locations may be considered. Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The medical safety professional we seek is a leader with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: MD or DO degree from an accredited medical school with 2 years of industry pharmacovigilance (PV) experience AND Completion of an accredited medical or surgical residency OR Clinical experience in either an accredited academic setting or private practice (including hospital based) setting Preferred Qualifications: Product safety in the bio/pharmaceutical industry or regulatory agency; previous management and/or mentoring experience; board certification or equivalent training. Experience in related disease areas including General Medicine, Metabolic, Cardiac or Internal Medicine. Grad Intern – ML Model Development for Protein-Protein Interactions Live This could be your everyday Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. During this program, you will develop machine learning-based tools for efficient sampling and ranking of poses for protein-protein complexes. These tools will play an important role in guiding the design of new molecules for targeted protein degradation and will be developed with mentorship from computational/medicinal chemists, data scientists, and machine learning engineers. The primary responsibilities of this role include: Understand and contribute to an existing python package to predict and rank protein-protein interactions Compare the performance of machine learning models with physics-based approaches for protein docking Develop techniques to incorporate protein flexibility into pose prediction Improve sampling efficiency using the attention mechanism or other techniques Hold regular result sharing presentations and discussion with members of the team Win Here’s What It Takes To Win We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. Grad Intern – Process Development (Summer 2023) Live This could be your everyday Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. Operations is one of the three foundational functions at Amgen with a mission to be consistent and efficient in delivering safe and effective medicines around the world. Operations manufactures and delivers Amgen therapeutics to our patients. Made up of five functions: Global Supply Chain, Process Development, Quality, Manufacturing, and Engineering, and spread across nine sites, Operations’ aspiration is simple: Ensure patients have access to the Amgen products they need. Every patient, every time. Process development (PD) is the department within Operations that takes molecules from Research & Development and turns them into products which can be manufactured for therapeutic use. With the support of their hiring manager, the PD intern will complete a lab-based project in one of the following areas: Drug Substance Technologies, Attribute Sciences, Development Supply Chain, Drug Product Technologies, or Final Product Technologies. The intern will be responsible for rigorously conducting and documenting their experiments as well as analyzing and interpreting data into meaningful, business-influencing outcomes, and then communicating this process to their team in a clear and compelling manner. In conjunction with the project work, interns will have the opportunity for professional development through training sessions, an Executive Speaker Series, lab and facilities tours, one-on-one mentoring, and various networking events. Interns will also be able to interact with peers at Amgen-sponsored social events. Example projects from previous internships: Drug Substance Technology – Cell culture optimization through transcriptomics, media evaluation, and single-use bioreactor modification Drug Substance Technology – Assaying cell line stability at the single-cell level using Berkeley Lights next-general nanofluidic technology Drug Product Technology – Challenging the viscosity/fill volume design space and exploring novel technology in drug product filling Drug Product Technology – Increased product stability by understanding stopper moisture impact on lyophilized products Win Here’s What It Takes To Win We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? Do more with the knowledge you’re working hard to acquire and the passion you already have. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. Grad Intern – R&D (ML for Proteins) Live This could be your everyday Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. During this program, you will apply innovative machine learning techniques to the prediction of protein properties important for the development of novel drugs. The Discovery Protein Science team, based in South San Francisco, is responsible for crafting, planning, and completing the generation of key enabling DNA and protein reagents to support discovery of small and large molecule therapeutics and ground breaking novel modalities across Amgen’s therapeutic areas. This internship explores machine learning methods that use both sequence and structural information to predict and design protein properties important for the development of novel drugs. The successful intern will explore various implementations, multitask learning, self-distillation, and evaluate their method on datasets as well as by visual inspection. The final method will then be applied to new incoming data for ongoing testing to improve performance. Well-suited applicants will have a background in machine learning and a strong curiosity about proteins. The intern will gain hands-on experience in protein evaluation and design in an industrial setting and will have the opportunity to interact with various computational and experimental functions within Amgen. Past interns in this group have patented, published, and go on to full time positions at big tech companies. This opportunity will allow the intern to see first-hand how early-stage large molecule drug development is conducted. This internship will be conducted remotely. Win Here’s What It Takes To Win We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The individual we seek has a background in machine learning and a curiosity about proteins with these qualifications: Basic Qualifications Amgen requires that all individuals applying for a grad internship or a co-op assignment at Amgen must meet the following criteria: 18 years or older Graduated with a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with a 3.0 minimum GPA or equivalent Currently enrolled in an MBA program for an MBA internship OR a Master’s program for a Master’s internship OR a PharmD program for a PharmD internship OR Ph.D. for a PhD internship from an accredited college or university and completion of the first year of MBA OR Master’s OR Pharm D OR Ph.D. program before the internship starts Enrolled in an accredited college or university following the potential internship or co-op assignment Must not be employed at the time the internship starts Student must be located in the United States for the duration of the internship Preferred Qualifications Degree concentration(s) in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Bioengineering, Bioinformatics, or related area Familiarity with Python or other programming languages Familiarity with PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX, or related packages Familiarity with ML protein structure prediction models (i.e. AlphaFold, OmegaFlow, IgFold, etc.) or protein pretrained language models (i.e. ESM-1b/1v, ProGEN2, AntiBERTy, ABlang, etc.) is a plus Familiarity with protein structure and protein structure visualization (i.e. PyMOL) and design tools (i.e. Rosetta, MOE, Schrodinger) is a plus Thrive Some of the vast rewards of working here As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth in addition to their well-being: Build a network of colleagues that will endure and grow throughout your time with us and beyond. Grad Intern - Computational Scientist Live This could be your everyday Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. Amgen is seeking a computational scientist at the Intern level to work in the Department of Translational Safety and Bioanalytical Sciences (TS&BA). This is an exciting opportunity for a talented energetic scientist to join a team that makes impactful contributions to drug development from target identification and validation through product registration and post marketing activities. The ideal candidate will possess an outstanding combination of computational skills and biological understanding coupled with a proven ability to develop solutions that are fit for purpose. The ability to distill complicated technical data into biologically meaningful results and recommendations is essential. Primary responsibilities of the Intern include: Provide subject matter expertise in one or more of these areas: RNA-sequencing and single cell RNA-sequencing data, including assessment and construction of gene models across numerous species, Mining of public domain human genetics data for drug safety applications, Analytic modeling and/or machine learning applied to multivariate datasets Work in multi-disciplinary cross-site teams Document work and author technical reports that summarize complicated computational and bioinformatic analyses in an accurate, yet simplified manner which can be understood by a diverse scientific audience Win Here’s What It Takes To Win We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. Grad Intern - Inflammation/Immunology Live This could be your everyday Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. During this program, you will be involved in research efforts in, identifying and characterizing key signaling pathway associate to autoimmunity diseases using experimental approaches such as genetic manipulation, cytokine profiling, and immunophenotyping based on flow cytometry analysis. Grad Intern – R&D (Computational Chemistry) Live This could be your everyday Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. During this program, you will develop machine learning-based tools for efficient conformational sampling of both small molecules and protein-ligand complexes. You will also have the opportunity to apply the tools you develop to drive drug discovery projects, by providing fast and accurate estimates of protein-ligand binding free energies. These tools will play an important role in guiding small molecule discovery and will be developed with mentorship from computational/medicinal chemists, data scientists, and machine learning engineers. The primary responsibilities of this role include: Understand and build upon an existing python package for conformational sampling using normalizing flows Develop new capabilities to include multiple entities in the conformational search process using internal coordinate mapping Further improve sampling efficiency using attention mechanism or other techniques Develop techniques to estimate or rank protein-ligand binding affinities based on the generated conformational ensembles Hold regular result sharing presentations and discussion with other members of the team Win Here’s What It Takes To Win We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The intellectually curious and creative individual we seek is a next generation computational chemist with these qualifications: Basic Qualifications Amgen requires that all individuals applying for a grad internship or a co-op assignment at Amgen must meet the following criteria: 18 years or older Graduated with a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with a 3.0 minimum GPA or equivalent Currently enrolled in an MBA program for an MBA internship OR a Master’s program for a Master’s internship OR a PharmD program for a PharmD internship OR Ph.D. for a PhD internship from an accredited college or university and completion of the first year of MBA OR Master’s OR Pharm D OR Ph.D. program before the internship starts Enrolled in an accredited college or university following the potential internship or co-op assignment Must not be employed at the time the internship starts Student must be located in the United States for the duration of the internship Preferred Qualifications Degree concentration(s) in Computational Chemistry, Computational Physics, Applied Mathematics, Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Biomedical Engineering, Computer Science, or a similarly quantitative discipline. Experience in machine learning algorithm development and a basic understanding of molecular dynamics/statistical mechanics principles Familiarity with molecular dynamics simulation software (Desmond, AMBER, GROMACS, OpenMM, or others) Familiarity with Python and data science/machine learning tools (scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or others) Thrive Some of the vast rewards of working here As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth in addition to their well-being: Build a network of colleagues that will endure and grow throughout your time with us and beyond. jobTitle: Health Economics & Outcomes Research (HEOR) Senior Manager (US Remote)
jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us. Health Economics & Outcomes Research (HEOR) Senior Manager Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world! Reporting to the HEOR Director, the HEOR Senior Manager is accountable for executing on the HEOR Book of Work, strategically aligned with the Access Strategy Lead (ASL), for one or several assets across the life cycle management The HEOR Book of Work comprises generating global-impact payer-relevant evidence, patient reported outcomes (PRO) and clinical outcomes assessment (COA) strategy, and evidence synthesis. Additionally, the HEOR Senior Manager is responsible to ensure delivery of global core materials to support Health Technology Assessment (HTA) submissions, including the Global Value Dossier (GVD) and economic models The HEOR Senior Manager role involves execution of deliverables, as well as engaging with internal and external stakeholders. Responsibilities This role is global, with tactical execution. The HEOR Senior Manager will use their expertise in developing payer-relevant evidence generation, PRO/COA strategy, evidence synthesis and HTA requirements. The HEOR Senior Manager needs to engage effectively with internal customers to align and support the comprehensive HEOR plan, including the ASL, top-10 countries and cross-functional teams: Evidence Generation Team (EGT), Global Medical Affairs Team (GMAT), Center for Observational Research, Real-world Evidence sub-Team (RWEsT), Global Biostatistical Sciences, US Value Marketing, Medical Value & Access. HEOR Book of Work: Payer-relevant evidence generation plan and execution of global-impact and United States local-impact studies. PRO/COA strategy Evidence synthesis Global core materials supporting HTA requirements The HEOR Senior Manager will also engage with vendors and external experts to validate HEOR strategy and technical approach. The HEOR Senior Manager's main responsibilities include: Translating strategic objectives into concrete execution via HEOR project plan Maintaining strong working relationships with top-10 countries, particularly the United States Ensuring compliance with HTA dossier governance DAI framework: D: Drives execution of the HEOR Book of Work A: Advices on payer-relevant evidence and HTA strategy to ASL and Global Access Team (GAT) I: Informed of Integrated Access Strategy (IAS) plans Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The technically astute professional we seek is a collaborative partner with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications Doctorate degree and 2 years of health economics & outcomes research experience Or Master's degree and 6 years of health economics & outcomes research experience Or Bachelor's degree and 8 years of health economics & outcomes research experience Or Associate’s degree and 10 years of health economics & outcomes research experience Or High school diploma / GED and 12 years of health economics & outcomes research experience Preferred Qualifications Health economics training (on the job or academic) Experience in writing research protocols and publications Experience in developing payer-relevant evidence, including real-world evidence Experience in designing PRO/COA strategy Experience in evidence synthesis (systematic literature reviews, indirect treatment comparisons and meta-analyses) Strategic and technical understanding of HTA requirements Experience in developing GVDs and AMCP dossiers Experience in developing economic models and predictive analytics Experience in the United States market Experience in influencing Access strategy with a HEOR lens Experience in Amgen products' specific therapeutic areas Experience with direct country HTA interactions Experience in early HTA engagement Ability to work with customers and colleagues based in different time zones Good presentation and communication skills Good interpersonal and soft skills Ability to influence without authority Understanding of clinical development process and regulatory evidence needs Ability to synthesize complex technical terms for non-technical audience Strategic thinking, while focusing on tactical execution Thrive What You Can Expect Of Us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, so we work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. Vast opportunities to learn and move up and across our global organization Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where teammates are empowered to bring ideas to the table and act Generous Total Rewards Plan comprising health, finance and wealth, work/life balance, and career benefits Apply now for a career that defies imagination In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Health Policy & Reimbursement Director Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world! In this vital role you will support the US Health Policy & Reimbursement team for Federal (US) payer issues as the policy lead for Medicare drug policy reforms in the Inflation Reduction Act of 2022. In this role the Director will (1) analyze policy proposals and HHS guidance documents and develop responses; (2) manage assigned aspects of Federal (US) payer engagement, agency engagement, or health policy objectives, (3) establish or update policy positions; (4) communicate policy updates to key internal stakeholders to inform business planning, (5) represent Amgen in Trade Group discussions pertaining to assigned policy areas While initial responsibilities will focus on policy issues pertaining to the IRA, the DIRECTOR may lead one or more Therapeutic Federal policy or other Federal Health Policy areas. This position will work collaboratively across functions to ensure a comprehensive view of product (s) and create and maintain strong collaborative working relationships with key internal and external stakeholders including with US Federal agencies like HHS and CMS as well as with our industry trade associations PhRMA and BIO. Internal stakeholders include colleagues in Global Government Affairs and Policy, the Business Units, US Value & Access, Medical, Development, Regulatory, Law, and other functions. Additionally, the individual will need to conduct relevant research and integrate clinical, market, and payer information to engage on reimbursement objectives. The position is based in Washington, DC. Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The strategic professional we seek is a collaborative team with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree and 4 years of health policy experience Or Master’s degree and 7 years of health policy experience Or Bachelor’s degree and 9 years of health policy experience Preferred Qualifications: Deep understanding of Federal (US) payer environment, including areas of (1) health care product and service coverage, reimbursement, coding, (2) health policy, (3) Federal (US) Executive and Legislative branch health care policy-setting authorities, processes, and responsible parties. Experience and deep understanding of Medicare and Medicaid statutes, regulations and sub regulatory guidance documents and policies Experience in reviewing clinical literature, including disease state information and target product profiles, in order to understand implications for payer actions and to develop submissions for Federal payer engagement Strong project management skills with ability to work in a matrix environment Demonstrated communication skills, including interpersonal skills to foster collaboration and oral/written presentation skills Provider or payer experience (direct or in a consulting capacity) Experience in product commercialization (direct or in a consulting capacity) Experience in Amgen therapeutic areas desirable (health policy, payer, or product commercialization) Experience in participation in multi-stakeholder groups including trade or disease-specific organizations desirable Federal agency engagement experience Strategic planning and health policy experience Thrive What You Can Expect Of Us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. In this vital role Amgen seeks a motivated and passionate Human Resources Director at our Rhode Island Site Lead. Do you love developing/coaching high performing teams and driving staff engagement efforts? If you have a passion for talent development, diversity, inclusion and belonging, and you want to be a part of Amgen’s mission to serve patients – every patient. every time – then check out this exciting new opportunity. Amgen is seeking a Human Resources (HR) Site Leader who will be an important member of the Amgen Rhode Island (ARI) Site Leadership Team. In this role, you will be accountable for staff engagement efforts, talent acquisition strategies, employee value proposition, and corporate talent programs. You will serve as the trusted advisor and coach to the site leadership team in areas of HR strategy, culture, leadership, talent management, rewards, and change management. You will ensure Amgen Rhode Island continues to be the best place to work as you… Work with the ED of HR, Manufacturing and VP Site Lead to design and develop the site HR strategy, ensuring alignment with the overall business strategy for Amgen and meets the people needs of the site. Partner and collaborate with business leadership teams to lead organizational design in achieving a robust and efficient workforce, identify and develop critical capability needs to strengthen the organization and define a vision that drives innovation, growth and employee engagement. Act as a key advisor for Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging (DIB) efforts to ensure alignment with Amgen’s Diversity and Inclusion initiatives across the globe while making it relevant for the ARI workforce. Partner closely with site Employee Resource Groups and other site engagement programs Provide thought leadership to the ARI Talent Council and Staff Engagement Committee Ensure close collaboration with other Manufacturing HR partners to share best practices and enable career development efforts for global top talent Represent Amgen with external stakeholders and partners (Rhode Island Bio, SkillsRI, Advancing Workplace Excellence) Promote ARI as a great place to work & share insights through participation in relevant panel speaking engagements and involvement of media content via interviews, surveys, etc. Accountable for the performance management, recruitment, total rewards, and succession planning processes across the site Collaborate and act as a leader, role model and strong partner across the manufacturing and overall operations HR network, HR Centers of Excellence, and broader HR organization. Develop and drive initiatives and programs that meet local needs while remaining aligned with global strategies Management Responsibilities: Oversight of 2 HR staff positions Mentor and coach others across the ARI site, and the Manufacturing HR team. With over 650 employees and growing, Amgen’s new campus in South San Francisco is the company’s largest research facility outside of our headquarters. Scientists at ASF are focused on Discovery Research in Oncology, Inflammation and Cardiometabolic Disease, Therapeutic Technologies, Biologics, a special unit dedicated to Genome Analysis, as well as scientists working in preclinical Pathology, Toxicology, and Pharmacokinetics and Drug Metabolism. Intern - NGS Sequencing/RNA Biology (Summer 2023) Live This could be your everyday Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. During this program, you will utilize long-read sequencing technology to study the epitranscriptome to help elucidate disease mechanisms. The graduate or undergraduate intern will work in the Research Biomics group in South San Francisco as part of the next-generation sequencing group, where we leverage cutting-edge sequencing technologies for drug discovery. The intern will have the opportunity to work in both the wet and dry lab, generating analyzing sequencing data, including: Cell culture and treatment Isolation and QC of nucleic acids Library prep/QC or setting up sequencing runs in internal sequencers NGS data alignment, QC, and analysis Poster or project presentation in the group meeting Win Here’s What It Takes To Win We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The motivated individual we seek is a graduate or undergraduate student with these qualifications: Basic Qualifications Amgen requires that all individuals applying for a grad or undergrad internship or a co-op assignment at Amgen must meet the following criteria: 18 years or older Currently enrolled in a full-time Bachelor’s or Master's Degree or PhD program from an accredited college or university with a 3.0 minimum GPA or equivalent Completion of one year of study from an accredited college or university prior to the internship commencing Enrolled in a full-time Bachelor’s or Master's or PhD degree program following the potential internship or co-op assignment with an accredited college or university Must not be employed at the time the internship starts Student must be located in the United States for the duration of the internship Preferred Qualifications Degree concentration(s) in molecular biology, genetics, biochemistry, or bioinformatics. Experience working in a molecular biology lab. Familiarity with next generation and long-read library prep and sequencing. Familiarity with bioinformatic analysis and/or signal processing analysis. jobTitle: Job Posting Title Process Development Scientist - Pivotal Drug Substance Technology
jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role. Process Development Scientist - Pivotal Biologics Drug Substance Technology Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will be responsible for development, characterization, scale-up and support of drug substance processes to enable commercial advancement of programs from Ph II/III clinical trials to marketing application. Work in a coordinated group in which cell culture and purification scientists work together to advance Amgen’s rich, exciting and dynamic pipeline. With Amgen’s biology first approach, the position provides the outstanding opportunity of being able to work on multiple modalities from antibodies and oncolytic viruses to bispecifics and siRNAs. The Pivotal Drug Substance Process Development organization at Amgen develops, characterizes and supports the commercialization of biologics drug substance manufacturing processes for all late-stage programs across the Amgen portfolio. Apply established platform approaches and problem-solving skills to rapidly tackle drug substance challenges and build robust processes with efficient experimentation Drive innovation and utilize out-of-the-box thinking to contribute to technology development Expand and develop skills in cell culture and purification, thereby further contributing to the integrated group Participate in drug substance teams and collaborate cross functionally with analytical and drug product representatives to deliver drug substance manufacturing processes in a phase appropriate manner. Deliver process amenable to cGMP operation and carry out results of drug substance in a cGMP manufacturing environment Author, or provide direction for the authorship of, technical report or CMC regulatory submissions which may require minimal additional editing Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Lab Automation Applications Engineer Live What you will do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. The Research & Automation Technologies group is seeking to fill a Principal Engineer position to expand the group's impact into Process Development. In this vital role, you will be responsible for the delivery of innovative lab automation solutions that speed the development of critical drugs for Amgen’s patients. These solutions will come from the Principal Engineer’s ability to collaborate with stakeholder scientists to help develop and fine tune their processes through an innovative combination of existing and new lab automation and software. This position requires both breadth and depth of mechanical and software engineering skills, as well as industry knowledge and a lot of creativity. Specific responsibilities will include: Support the development of workflows for high-throughput robotic platforms in Drug Substance Technologies in Process Development including: Biologics: Liquid handlers including Biomek, TECAN, Hamilton and/or Dynamic Devices that support molecular biology, cell culture, and purification workflows Berkeley Lights Beacon Ambr 15, Ambr 250 Synthetics Unchained Powder Junior - Many-to-Many solid dispensing + 6-tip needle for liquid dispensing Unchained OSR/Junior – 1-tip needle for liquid dispensing; built-in 8-well pressurized reactor Quantos Chronect – Many-to-Many solid dispensing Quantos QS30 – Single-to-Many solid dispensing Automated Data Integration – Support Drug Substance Technologies team with automation of data integration from multiple instruments to automate data visualization and decision making. We have multiple servers that house different pieces of information. Our current process is to output each piece of data as csv file and manually manipulate to join the data together. Support someone who can write a program that can automate the data integration. Custom Built Lab Parts – Translate requirements into solid models (SolidWorks), then hand over for fabrication (by 3D printing, laser cutting, machining, etc.) custom parts and assemblies. For all of the above: Coordinate maintenance and update/s for hardware and software, instrument repairs and PM for automation platforms. Collaborate with IS and trouble shoot software, driver and connection issues. Support script writing and troubleshooting for Liquid handlers Track/record problems with the system and provide hands-on assistance in error-recovery / troubleshooting as needed Collaborate with internal and external groups to identify appropriate solutions to improve methods and workflows Help support the creation of user guides and train staff as needed and assist with operation of automation platforms. Point person for the latest automation technologies/ instrumentation for current and future business needs Win What we expect of you We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The dynamic professional we seek is an Engineer with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree and 2 years of related experience Or Master’s degree and 6 years of related experience Or Bachelor’s degree and 8 years of related experience Or Associate’s degree and 10 years of related experience Or High school diploma / GED and 12 years of related experience

Lab Based Associate Scientist, Pharmacokinetics & Drug Metabolism, Immunoassay, Large molecules Live The department of PKDM within Amgen is dedicated to the discovery and development of safe and effective medicines by elucidating the absorption, distribution, metabolism, excretion (ADME) and pharmacokinetic properties of novel therapeutic drug candidates to improve their pharmacological potential. PKDM works in close partnership with fields such as protein science, pharmacology, toxicology, pharmaceutical sciences, clinical pharmacology and regulatory to engineer promising clinical therapeutic candidates, conduct preclinical development studies, support clinical evaluation and contribute to IND and NDA filings. What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you as a member of the bioanalytical group will execute bioanalytical and/or biophysical methods for the quantitative and qualitative analysis of large molecule therapeutic candidates. Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to: Immunoassay (MSD, Gyros, ELISA) and other experiments to understand the ADME properties of large molecule therapeutics Generate data for the purposes of defining mechanisms of in vivo clearance Work and being responsible for preparation of samples from plasma, tissues, and other biological matrices, as well as data generation, and analysis within Watson-LIMS Data interpretation and communication of results to project team representatives and electronic laboratory notebook keeping of results Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. Basic Qualifications: Master Degree and 2 years of laboratory experience OR Bachelor Degree and 4 years mentioned above experience Preferred Qualifications: 2+ years of protein therapeutics drug discovery and development experience in biotech industry, basic understanding of protein therapeutics pharmacokinetics Experience with assay development, including optimization and troubleshooting Expertise, and a strong interest in evaluating protein-protein interactions using modern biophysical analytic techniques, including reagent preparation, assay development, optimization and troubleshooting. Ability to grasp new concepts and execute experimental procedures with technical proficiency. HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve earned your degree. How will you use that achievement to reach your goals? Manufacturing Specialists (Multiple Positions) Live What You Will Do Does the thought of building an entirely new site from the ground up excite you? Do you love cultivating sustainable systems and high performing teams? If you have a passion for talent development and want to be a part of Amgen’s mission to serve patients – every patient every time – then check out this exciting new opportunity. Amgen, one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies is investing $550 million to build a new multi-product drug substance biomanufacturing facility in Holly Springs, North Carolina, a biomanufacturing “hub” known for their life sciences industry. The new plant will combine two production formats, traditional stainless steel-fed batch and single use technology. This combination of capabilities is an approach that Amgen calls “FleX Batch” manufacturing, which makes the facility more dynamic and efficient, as well as requiring a smaller physical footprint than a traditional plant. Additionally, the plant will integrate innovations to advance digitalization and sustainability; aspiring to embed industry 4.0 capabilities and reduce energy consumption and waste generation to meet Amgen’s plan to be carbon neutral by 2027. The investment will bring approximately 355 jobs comprised of highly skilled workers that will be built on a foundation that promotes diversity, inclusion and belonging. The site will include the manufacturing plant, warehouse, central utilities, and office space. Amgen is targeting 2024 for site completion. Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will have the outstanding opportunity to support the start-up of the Amgen North Carolina (ANC) manufacturing facility. The Manufacturing Specialists will have process ownership and oversight of multiple manufacturing areas such as: Dispensing and Buffer/Media Preparation, Upstream Cell Culture, Harvest, and Downstream Purification. In this role, opportunities to be involved an any of the following: Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) creation, review, and approval; design, authoring, implementation, and validation of the electronic batch records; develop, manage, and run change controls associated to new product introductions (NPI); and complete deviation investigations along with corresponding preventive/corrective action records. Specialists will also be involved in applying process, quality, compliance, and analytical knowledge to keep the manufacturing area operational. Responsibilities: Provide technical support and subject matter expertise for manufacturing area. Oversee support and ongoing development of all the manufacturing systems including SOP, TRNQ, MES, Trackwise records, among others. Train staff (supervisors, operators, technical/QA/support) on assigned manufacturing systems. Support troubleshooting needs during commissioning/qualification, start-up, engineering run, and process performance qualification of the ANC manufacturing facility Facilitate process, area, and equipment risk assessments as needed to identify risks, failure modes, and mitigating actions Engage in regulatory inspections and in the NPI process to assess requirements for documentation, materials, training, and equipment modifications Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The professional we seek will possess these qualifications. jobTitle: Marketing Senior Manager, Omnichannel Design (US Remote)
jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Marketing Senior Manager, Omnichannel Design (US Remote) Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world! The Senior Marketing Manager will lead the design and implementation of Omnichannel promotions for Otezla, the first and only oral therapy approved for any adult patient with plaque psoriasis. Otezla exceeded $2B in worldwide product sales in 2021 and represents an important growth opportunity for Amgen over the next several years with a robust life-cycle management plan. Most importantly, Otezla serves a differentiated and key role in the market for patients who may have tried a topical therapy but are not yet ready for biologic treatment. Otezla can have a significant impact on patients, and you can influence and further evolve Otezla’s promotional strategy and tactics to HCPs. This role will report to the Marketing Director for Otezla and is primarily responsible for designing and implementing the HCP omnichannel ecosystem for Otezla in dermatology. As part of this responsibility, this person will lead the design of the optimal customer experience for the HCP, considering the various ways providers can engage with Amgen, including via the sales force, speaker programs, congresses, digital, and others. Key to this position will be strong cross-functional collaboration and project leadership by liaising with Amgen’s Global Customer Capabilities team and agency partners to understand what capabilities could be implemented for Otezla today and help inform a roadmap to achieve a future optimized state. In addition, this person will be responsible for creative development of marketing materials to support this omnichannel journey, in partnership with the full Otezla HCP marketing team across Rheumatology, Dermatology and Primary Care. Finally, this person will also work closely with our digital agency and marketing operations teams to define and track key performance metrics that will inform both areas of high impact as well as areas requiring rework as we test and learn quickly. This position will consist of agency and vendor management, as well as matrix management across Amgen’s commercial, global, value & access, medical, legal, regulatory, and analytics functions. Primary Responsibilities: Lead the design and implementation of the US HCP omnichannel customer journey, also known as Customer 360, for Otezla in Dermatology to drive impact and growth for the brand Identify critical leverage points in the patient journey or in HCP behaviors where the brand could have impact via “right message, right time, right customer” Generate a gap assessment between a desired future omnichannel journey and the current capabilities and assets available to leverage Liaise closely with the global customer capabilities team to deploy journey-relevant capabilities to the Otezla brand and inform future capability needs for Amgen Collaborate with your Otezla HCP cross-functional marketing colleagues and the marketing operations teams to pull through the Otezla brand strategy and key messaging as you develop and implement marketing tactics as needed to bring the omnichannel design to life Partner with medical, legal, regulatory, and other relevant functions to translate scientific data into impactful messaging Work closely with market research, marketing operations, analytics, and competitive intelligence to inform, measure and evolve the omnichannel strategy and individual campaigns Oversee budget and closely monitor spend to ensure cost-effective delivery of all assets and adhere to annual budget obligations Contribute to the development of the annual brand plan and quarterly business reviews Facilitate Medical/Legal/Regulatory compliance approval of all creative assets, and content development through standardized MAC process Collaborate with all cross-brand partners to ensure alignment to the brand strategy and tactical development in a manner that provides the optimal customer experience. Key cross-functional partners include HCP marketing, consumer marketing, sales, medical, value and access, corp comm, and the full Otezla x-functional brand team Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The strategic professional we seek is a collaborative leader with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree and 2 years of Marketing and/or business experience in a role aligned with a Marketing/Sales commercial organization Or Master’s degree and 4 years of Marketing and/or business experience in a role aligned with a Marketing/Sales commercial organization Or Bachelor’s Degree and 6 years of Marketing and/or business experience in a role aligned with a Marketing/Sales commercial organization Or Associate’s Degree and 10 years of Marketing and/or business experience in a role aligned with a Marketing/Sales commercial organization Or High school diploma / GED and 12 years of Marketing and/or business experience in a role aligned with a Marketing/Sales commercial organization Preferred Qualifications: MBA or relevant graduate degree in marketing, healthcare management, or related subject area 2+ years’ experience developing pharmaceutical campaign strategies and tactics for specialty products Proficiency in defining and shaping large, complex problems and working successfully in a highly matrixed organization to deliver tangible, practical solutions Strong executive communication skills with ability to summarize a considerable amount of complex detail into easy-to-understand key takeaways and next steps Self-starter and efficient project manager who is energized to “figure it out” when not all pieces of the problem are known or well understood; ability to informally lead others to meet multiple priorities simultaneously Thrive What You Can Expect Of Us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. Vast opportunities to learn and move up and across our global organization Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where teammates are empowered to bring ideas to the table and act Generous Total Rewards Plan comprising health, finance and wealth, work/life balance, and career benefits Apply now for a career that defies imagination In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. MBA Intern – Global Strategic Sourcing (Summer 2023) Live This could be your everyday Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. During this program, you will be assigned a project in Supplier Relationship Management or within one of GSS’ category sub-functions such as Marketing & Sales, Research & Development, Operations & Manufacturing, Technology & Devices, or Corporate Services, etc. Projects are timely and relevant, supporting Amgen’s strategic and tactical goals, and provide exposure to the cross-functional nature of a full-time position. Past projects have included: Oncology Data Strategy: Assess existing enterprise-wide oncology data landscape, develop sourcing strategies, and make recommendations to the senior leadership team Supplier Relationship Management: Assess market landscape in the cloud technology space, identify strategic partners to explore Amgen-wide innovative technological opportunities and build a cohesive and interoperable application footprint Sourcing for Consulting: Analyze suppliers’ spend in Financial Services, IS and Strategy Consulting to define opportunities for consolidation of services, cost savings, and strategic partnerships Demand Management and Capacity Planning: Assess people, processes and tools used by IS for demand management and capacity planning. Identify gaps and recommend opportunities to drive cost savings Responsibilities typically include benchmarking, market research, spend analysis, case development, negotiations, and developing key strategic recommendations to improve our sourcing and supplier management initiatives. Interns are given access to senior leadership and are encouraged to spend the summer participating in program activities and networking with staff across the organization Win Here’s What It Takes To Win We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. Lead initiatives, strategic analysis, and business case development on projects across the five Operations functions Develop a strategy that may result in a meaningful change to the business Work cross-functionally to clarify the problem, measure the current state, develop recommendations through qualitative and quantitative analysis, and present their findings with a final readout to executive management Focus on making effective, data driven recommendations to the organization’s senior leadership This internship will be approximately 10-13 weeks and includes both project- based and experiential learning. In conjunction with the project work, interns will have the opportunity for professional development through training sessions, one-on-one mentoring, and various networking events. MBA Intern (Marketing) - Commercial Leadership Program (Summer 2023) Live This could be your everyday Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. Amgen is seeking MBA students to join one of our commercial teams for a 10–13-week summer internship as part of the Commercial Leadership Program (CLP). For more than 25 years, the mission of the CLP has been to recruit, retain, and develop top MBA talent with leadership capabilities and aspirations to support the commercial talent pipeline. During this internship program, you will: Partner with us as a team member on one of our in-line or pipeline product brand teams Apply your expertise to solve real-time business challenges in Marketing, Value & Access, Commercial Data & Analytics, Sales, and more Collaborate closely with the team and cross-functional partners to develop deep project expertise Develop and deliver formal business recommendations to internal partners Gain an understanding of the biopharmaceutical industry today, as well as the challenges and opportunities that will drive the development of new medicines in the future Broad exposure across Amgen’s Global Commercial Operations organization, including VP/SVPs Be assigned an executive level mentor to coach you through your summer experience Experience the Amgen culture first-hand through various networking opportunities and social activities Successful interns will be given priority consideration to continue their career at Amgen and join our full-time Commercial Leadership Program (CLP) post-graduation. Amgen’s CLP is a leadership development program consisting of 3 full-time, 12-month rotations that provides members the unique opportunity to accelerate their commercial career in biotech through three foundational sales & marketing experiences. Program graduates are now in leadership roles throughout Amgen. Starting in 2021, Amgen initiated a company-wide virtual-first way of working with an option to be fully remote or partially onsite, thus allowing geographic flexibility. Author design control and technical documents, including test/verification plans, test protocols, test reports, engineering assessments, design outputs, and technical recommendations Hands-on testing of auto-injector devices, including the safe operation of test equipment and devices containing sharps (syringes) Develop a verification testing strategy to include differentiation between platform and combination product testing to ensure minimum duplication and maximum efficiency when commercializing multiple programs Ensure tests methods and test protocols are developed in a sound and robust framework with a high focus on eliminating test errors Prepare and provide communications to leadership in support of recommendations and assessments. Collaborate with and support manufacturing sites on design/fabrication of assembly and labeling equipment Provide complex mechanical design support to the mechanical engineering design organization. Conceptualize, design, and manufacture robust, accurate, and precise test fixtures to support test activities Familiarity with solid modeling (SolidWorks) and mechanical drawings using standard methodologies in accordance with ANSI/ASME Y14.5 Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing Standard and Y14.100 Engineering Drawing Practices Supply to and/or lead the implementation of drug delivery design projects in different therapeutic areas, including nephrology, oncology, psoriasis, RA Develop, implement, and review mechanical specifications, development plans, characterization plans, and other related development documents for assigned projects. Provide technical feedback for mechanical problems to programs as needed. HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us. Media Manager – General Medicine Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will be responsible for leading the planning and implementation of all media and media partnerships, critical to commercial success of General Medicine brands Repatha, Prolia and Evenity. The media manager will help manage media investment directed at both Consumer and Health Care Professionals. Critical to the role will be developing and evangelizing an in-depth understanding of the core targets, and extensive knowledge of the media landscape, both traditional and emerging. The Media Manager will partner heavily with internal and external cross-functional partners and be responsible for leading and managing our media agency partners. This position will report to the Senior Manager, Media, and partner heavily with the Repatha and Bone brand teams. Responsibilities include: Support the development and implementation of innovative, powerful multi-channel consumer and healthcare professional media plans, including strategic partnerships with critical media outlets. Lead development of brand media briefs in partnership with brand teams. Manage all elements of brand media plans, including managing the agency to develop a plan that meets agreed objectives, tracking weekly, monthly and quarterly critical metrics and ensuring delivery on budget. Lead strategic development and realization of media partnerships, improving return on investment, value and performance. Uncover insights to drive continuous optimization of media plans based on metrics, and ensure findings are shared and applied across brands. Management of media agencies to hold them accountable to the highest standards of performance. Systematically develop and track metrics for media mix and media effectiveness, while linking to the broader success metrics of the brand Be the brand liaison and key support to corporate advocacy. Implement test and learns to support marketing innovation in media. Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The media driven professional we seek is a candidate with these qualifications. Competencies/Skills: Technical competencies: Media targeting and segmentation, Multi-channel media plan development, media measurement and optimization, agency leadership. Expertise in media planning and deliveries across all channels. Strong analytical skills with an ability to uncover insights from performance/measurement tracking to drive action that increases brand impact. Strong ability in both leading cross-functional teams, and in being a member of a cross-functional team Strong communication effectiveness: The ability to effectively engage, connect, and influence senior management and marketing organizations Ability to translate and communicate complex information/strategies into simple and impactful carry out of plans Experience working within a media agency Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree & 2 years of marketing and/or sales management experience Or Master’s degree & 4 years of marketing and/or sales management experience Or Bachelor’s degree & 6 years of marketing and/or sales management experience Thrive What You Can Expect Of Us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role. Molecular and Cellular Biologist Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will be a part of Amgen’s Induced Proximity Platform (IPP) organization. The RNA Degradation (RD) group within IPP is seeking a motivated scientist to contribute to the discovery and development of new therapeutic modalities in the RNA space. The RD group is passionate about exploiting our understanding of RNA biology to advance Amgen’s drug discovery pipeline of intractable and difficult-to-drug therapeutic targets. You will work collaboratively with researchers across multiple functions within the IPP department as well as across disease therapeutic areas and the Therapeutics Discovery organization. The successful candidate will also work with external partners and contract research organizations (CROs) and have the opportunity to present work at national and international conferences. Primary Responsibilities Develop innovative platforms and modalities to impact ambitious targets across multiple therapeutic areas. Lead in hypothesis-driven experimental design, optimization, implementation, troubleshooting and documentation of research activities. Perform in cell and in vitro biochemical/biophysical assays related to RNA or RNA-protein interactions. Independently set project goals and timelines, interact with team members across different departments and research sites and communicate and present data to department leadership. Coordinate and connect with cross functional teams and facilitate decision-making. Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The qualified professional we seek is a Scientist with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications Doctorate degree or Master’s degree and 4 years of relevant scientific experience or Bachelor’s degree and 6 years of relevant scientific experience Preferred Qualifications 2+ years of postdoctoral or industry experience. Broad knowledge of molecular and cellular biology with demonstrated research eminence through first author publications. Extensive experience in develop and optimize molecular biology and biochemical assays, such as reporter assay, NanoBRET, FRET, alpha screen, immunoprecipitation etc. Experience with medium-high throughput workflow is preferred. Extensive experience in mammalian cell culture, stable line generation, manipulation, and characterization. Nucleic acid research experience is preferred, including but not limited to nucleic acid purification, precipitation, amplification (e.g. qPCR) and biochemistry. Experience with 2nd Generation sequencing is preferred but not required. Strong scientific reasoning, data analysis, attention to details and independent problem-solving skills. Excellent organizational, interpersonal and communication skill. In this pivotal role, you will be responsible for implementing Source-to-Pay, and Supply and Demand Planning processes for an assigned portfolio of Non-Amgen Medicinal Products (NAMP) supporting global clinical studies. Translate Product Supply Setup and MRP Planned Order requirements into an optimal global supply plan by working closely with Clinical Product Setup Leads, Development Supply Chain Leads, and Global Study Planners. Collaborate with Vendors, Partners, and Clinical Supply Chain; demonstrate demand forecast and use of SAP and other supply/scenario planning tools to ensure patient supply. Involvement in market assessments and gathering of market intelligence to determine the optimal sourcing strategy for each assigned Non-Amgen Medicinal Product based on demand, availability, documentation, expiry, pricing, quality, and any other relevant factors. Actively participate in planning meetings to ensure that project needs, priorities, and timing are understood. Resolve Sourcing and Delivery conflicts impacting studies and R&D breakthroughs, ensuring that supplies are not on the critical path. Resolve invoicing issues. Coordinate with others in Clinical Supply Chain and/or Contract Manufacturers on labeling, packaging, and shipment of drug products. Collaborate with Global Trade Organization (GTO) for international shipments and manage the import-for-export process. Implement quarterly PO/invoice reconciliation with Finance and provide ERP system updates to standard costs/export pricing annually. ERP System tasks such as: SKU Creation, Master Data updates, Purchase Orders Creation, Open Orders Reports. MyBuy/Ariba tasks: Create and manage Purchase Requisitions. Create Temperature Excursion (TE) forms and work with collaborators until completion. Provide NAMP supporting documentation to assess TE’s. Training of new employees. Strong procurement skills (e.g. gathering market intelligence, negotiation, vendor relationship management). Experience in managing transportation, including Import/Export of medicinal products. APICS, ISM or Lean/Six Sigma certification. Observational Research Manager Live What You Will Do Let’s do this! Let’s change the world. Being a first or contributing author for papers in peer-reviewed journals, abstracts for scientific congresses and internal reports. Finding opportunities to substitute for and/or complement interventional studies to reduce time and cost of drug development. Influencing cross-functional partners in the utilization and timing of non-interventional research to answer high-priority strategic business questions. Demonstrating real-world data and CfOR analytic approaches to inform high-value business decisions for multiple partners. Tracking business and functional priorities and aligning resources for those priorities. Contributing to the mission of the CfOR including progressing innovative epidemiological methods and analytical capabilities to support the CfOR’s leadership role within Amgen and the industry.
