jobTitle: Otezla Marketing Manager – Digital HCP promotions (US- Remote)
jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us. What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world! The Marketing Manager of Digital HCP promotions will support HCP digital tactics targeting dermatologists and their staff for Otezla, the first and only oral therapy approved for any adult patient with plaque psoriasis. Otezla exceeded $2B in worldwide product sales in 2021 and represents a significant growth opportunity for Amgen over the next several years with a robust life-cycle management plan. Most importantly, Otezla serves a differentiated and key role in the market for patients who may have tried a topical therapy but are not yet ready for biologic treatment Otezla can have a significant impact on patients and you have the opportunity to influence and further evolve Otezla’s digital presence in front of the healthcare community. The role of the Marketing Manager – Digital HCP promotions on the Otezla brand team reports to the Senior Manager of Digital Marketing and will focus on the Dermatology segment of the business. This role is responsible for supporting the design, development and execution of end-to-end digital marketing campaigns that uniquely reach targeted HCP audiences. This role will be responsible for pulling through the strategic imperative and behavioral objectives identified in the brand plan using market insights, campaign performance and analytics. The results of your work will deliver a high-impact omni-channel strategy that optimizes performance for a desired behavior change. This role will require collaboration across critical internal functions, and external agency partners to implement change with agility. The ideal candidate is collaborative, strategic, and has a deep understanding of omni-channel marketing, segmentation & audience strategy, agency management, content strategy, and is ultimately driven by a passion for serving patients. Relocation benefits available. Remote workers will be considered Job Responsibilities: Lead development of digital marketing tactics targeting dermatologists across search, display, print, and third-party custom programs, ensuring creative/campaign excellence and integration with overall HCP marketing strategic imperatives, behavioral objectives, and messaging priorities. Support ongoing initiatives that will strengthen the “right message, right customer, right time” vision that is the cornerstone of our omni-channel approach Collaborate with brand team partners to ensure alignment to tactical development in a manner that provides the optimal customer experience. Key cross-functional partners include HCP marketing, consumer marketing, sales, medical, value and access, and the full Otezla x-functional brand team Facilitate Medical/Legal/Regulatory compliance approval of all creative assets, and content development through standardized MAC process. Partner with Marketing Operations and other partners to ensure design, develop and deploy end-to-end HCP campaigns and tactics Support the Amgen-wide, cross-brand channel, digital, and content strategy working closely across all functions Contribute to the development of media planning efforts and the implementation of the annual brand plan and present recommendations to the team Develop and deliver on revenue and expense forecast expectations by managing budgets and closely monitoring performance to meet brand goals and objectives, ensuring cost-effective delivery of all programs. Continually evaluate evolving marketing data, trends and technologies to identify and recommend new channels and capabilities that drive improved ROIs Support agency management to develop and produce engaging creative and tactics via traditional and innovative channels. Partner with the Digital Marketing Sr. Manager to develop, implement, and monitor campaign KPIs Travel as needed ~10% Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The strategic professional we seek is a collaborative leader with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications Master’s degree and 2 years of Marketing and/or business experience in a role aligned with a Marketing/Sales commercial organization Bachelor’s Degree and 4 years of Marketing and/or business experience in a role aligned with a Marketing/Sales commercial organization Associate’s Degree and 8 years of Marketing and/or business experience in a role aligned with a Marketing/Sales commercial organization High school diploma / GED and 10 years of Marketing and/or business experience in a role aligned with a Marketing/Sales commercial organization Preferred Qualifications Experience developing and implementing innovative commercial strategies, within highly competitive markets where innovation and marketing prowess are a key factor of success Omnichannel execution experience across a range of online and offline tactics, including digital, search, and video, with attention to improving speed, quality, cost, and customer experience across multiple channels. Strong self-starter; project management and ability to lead others to meet multiple priorities simultaneously in a cross-functional environment Strong communication effectiveness: The ability to effectively engage, connect, and influence others Strong understanding of digital marketing, segmentation and audience strategy, and content development. Strong analytical skills, ability to draw insights from performance & analytics. Pharmaceutical or healthcare industry experience Thrive What You Can Expect Of Us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. jobTitle: PKDM Scientist in Large Molecule and Biophysical ADME group
jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role. PKDM Scientist in Large Molecule and Biophysical ADME group Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital lab-based role you will be involved in the discovery and development of safe and effective medicines by elucidating the pharmacokinetic properties of novel therapeutic drug candidates with the aim to improve their absorption, distribution, metabolism, excretion (ADME), and overall pharmacological potential. PKDM works in close partnership with teams such as protein science, pharmacology, toxicology, pharmaceutical sciences, clinical pharmacology and regulatory to engineer promising clinical therapeutic candidates, conduct preclinical development studies, support clinical evaluation, and contribute to IND and NDA filings. Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to: Design and implement cell-based in vitro methodologies to interrogate the biodisposition of biologics, including application of 3D cultures (e.g., spheroids) and microphysiologic systems (MPS) to study protein biodistribution, matrix stability, barrier permeability, and target engagement/turnover. Possesses a strong working knowledge of cell culture, manipulation, and analytical approaches (e.g. iPSC differentiation/culture, stable mammalian transfection, flow cytometry, fluorescence microscopy). Leverage in vitro cellular assay tools to establish in vitro-in vivo correlations (IVIVCs) of early-stage multi-specific therapeutic proteins and engineered monotherapies. Design and implement biological and/or biophysical experiments in support of both drug discovery and early development programs, and operating within a modality-independent framework. Emphasize technology development that can be enabling of in vitro PKDM assessments. Requires an individual that can work collaboratively in a fast-paced work environment. Effective communicator who can capture and communicate data-driven concepts to inform project teams for movement of the pre-clinical pipeline Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The PKDM Scientist we seek is a type of person with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree OR Master’s degree and 4 years of experience in pharmaceutical/biopharmaceutical industry OR Bachelor’s degree and 6 years of experience Preferred Qualifications: Experience in fabrication, culture, and application of microphysiologic systems (MPS) to the study of disease and/or drug response 2+ years of protein therapeutics drug discovery and development experience in biotech industry; basic understanding of pharmacokinetics (small & large molecules) Possesses a basic understanding of preclinical therapeutic adsorption, distribution, metabolism, and elimination (ADME) principles Expertise in cell biology techniques, including cell culture, molecular biology, assay development, optimization, and troubleshooting Experience translating biochemical and biophysical observations and phenomena into relevant cellular and animal-based models with mechanistic insights is desirable Thrive Some of the vast rewards of working here As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. jobTitle: Portfolio Resource Analysis Manager (Remote, Planisware Expert)
jobDescription: Portfolio Resource Analysis Manager (US-Remote) Planisware Expert Job Description HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us. Portfolio Resource Analysis Manager Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will work toward multiple goals that will enable outstanding medicines to move through the commercialization pipeline bringing therapies to patients. Amgen is seeking a Portfolio Resource Analysis Manager (Systems Expert) to join the Research and Development Strategy and Operations organization. In this role, you will provide Planisware V6 systems expertise for forecasting functional resources across R&D. This includes supporting the build of a systematic resource forecasting platform encompassing multiple sources of data. You will be part of the larger corporate mission of bringing medicines to patients with unmet medical needs every day. Our scale is global and supports our R&D organization around the world. Please join an outstanding team that delivers for our partners! Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Support Planisware system and process innovation within team and the larger organization Support a consistent algorithm design methodology across R&D functions Develop and manage styles, user attributes, drivers, and reporting attributes at different levels in Planisware system Build level 1 solutions using Planisware tables, relational attributes, and E7 system architecture Manage portfolios, versions, and level 1 objects in Planisware Create and maintain algorithms leveraging Planisware and Java application syntax Liaise with Information Systems to design specifications for new attributes Troubleshoot and facilitate resolution with user issues in algorithm syntax, user functions, and PEX reporting Build PEX reports in Planisware Manage input and outputs between Planisware and integrated systems Understand basic System architecture to manage process changes including PLW releases Perform UAT on Planisware changes Participate in cross-functional process improvement initiatives Execute special projects and assignments Adapt to a constantly evolving, fast-paced and often ambiguous environment Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The professional we seek is an inspirational leader with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree OR Master’s degree and 3 years of directly related experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of directly related experience OR Associate degree and 10 years of directly related experience OR High School diploma/GED and 12 years of directly related experience Planisware V6 experience Preferred Qualifications: BA/BS/BSc in the computer science or in management sciences (decision analysis, operations research), basic sciences, engineering or other majors with strong analytical focus 5 or more years work experience in information systems, life sciences or medically related field Strong clinical trials operations knowledge, drug development lifecycle and portfolio management processes Strong knowledge of planning, forecasting, data analysis Strong understanding of principals of customer service as it applies to internal and external customers Advanced computer and system operation skills Good organizational and planning skills Thorough understanding of financial management, budget process and project valuation metrics Advanced skills in configurable application software and analytical development methodologies (Excel, Access, Spotfire, Tableau, Smartsheet) Strong qualitative and quantitative analytical skills Self-starter with the ability to handle multiple responsibilities, priorities and tasks with minimal direction Ability to work collaboratively in a team-based environment, as well as build external relationships and navigate a matrixed organization Thrive What You Can Expect Of Us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, so we work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. You will provide Development Teams and Functional Management with a resource demand forecast and supply analysis to enable effective operational planning & decision making. You will provide stewardship of R&D resource algorithms to drive a systematic methodology and tool for forecasting functional resources in support of functional planning, portfolio management and process efficiency monitoring. You will be part of the larger corporate mission of bringing medicines to patients with unmet medical needs every day. Our scale is global and supports our R&D organization around the world. Please join an outstanding team that delivers for our partners! Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Oversee all aspects in the planning and delivery of the resource forecast and analysis outputs (standard reviews and ad hoc scenarios) to support Functional Leadership, Sr Management, Finance, Portfolio Management and Process Improvement objectives Partner with Functional Leads and Project Managers and Planners to provide context and insights to portfolio changes driving resource demand variances to prepare rationale for anticipated resourcing questions Drive system and process innovation within team and the larger organization to address stakeholder needs in alignment with organizational strategy and vision Drive a consistent algorithm design methodology across R&D functions Facilitate algo impact analysis for process improvement changes and governance of algorithm updates Drive functional partner engagement and ownership of resource algorithms Initiate and be responsible for the review of algorithm and portfolio assumptions with functional leads Drive the variance analysis of algo forecast to actual time allocation data to identify algo misalignment Maintain collaborations by communicating, seeking advice, and facilitating critical business decisions Drive information management strategy and continuous improvement initiatives Work to translate the portfolio trending insights to application of resources to portfolio Lead and participate in cross-functional process improvement initiatives Adapt to a constantly evolving, fast-paced and often ambiguous environment Partner with Finance and Functional budget gatekeepers to embed resource budget true up, impact and variance analysis into the resource forecasting process Support Functional Leadership in business case development of resourcing proposals in a way that demonstrates advocacy and builds credibility with team members Provide direction, coaching and mentorship for staff to deliver quality forecasting outputs Implement special projects and assignments Win What we expect of you We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The dynamic professional we seek is a leader with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree and 2 years of directly related experience OR Master’s degree and 6 years of directly related experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 8 years of directly related experience OR Associate degree and 10 years of directly related experience OR High School diploma/GED and 12 years of directly related experience Preferred Qualifications: BA/BS/BSc in the sciences or in management sciences (decision analysis, operations research, statistics, strategic planning), finance, economics, basic sciences, engineering or other majors with strong analytical focus 9 years work experience in life sciences or medically related field, including 6 years of biopharmaceutical clinical product development Strong clinical trials operations knowledge, drug development lifecycle and portfolio management processes Experience with resourcing applications (Planisware Preferable) Advanced skills in configurable application software and analytical development methodologies (Excel, Access, Spotfire, Tableau, Smartsheet) Proven exceptional interpersonal, project management, and strategic / critical thinking abilities and eye for business Strong qualitative and quantitative analytical skills Excellent oral and written presentation skills with ability to explain complex concepts clearly to a variety of audiences Self-starter with the ability to handle multiple responsibilities, priorities and tasks with minimal direction Ability to work collaboratively in a team-based environment, as well as build external relationships and navigate a matrixed organization Proficient facilitation, negotiation, problem-solving and conflict resolution skills Previous management experience of direct reports Thrive What you can expect of us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve earned your degree. How will you use that achievement to reach your goals? Do more with the knowledge you’ve worked hard to acquire and the passion you already have. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Become the professional you are meant to be in this meaningful role. Postdoctoral Fellow – Emerging Therapeutic Modalities Live What You Will Do Let’s do this! Let’s change the world. This vital role will join an academic-style lab to train under Dr. Ryan Potts, Executive Director, Research, and Dr. Avijit Ghosh, VP, Pharmacokinetics & Drug Metabolism, amongst other leading scientists in the field of Emerging Therapeutic Modalities. This is a unique opportunity to be part of Amgen’s R&D Postdoc Program Center of Excellence in Emerging Therapeutic Modalities located at our global headquarters and research site in Thousand Oaks, California. We are hiring multiple highly motivated postdoctoral fellows to perform independent research projects as part of a core team of cross-functional scientists and critical thinkers, passionate about the theme of Emerging Therapeutic Modalities. The positions are for 2-4 years depending on time to complete projects. Successful candidates will have access to Amgen’s cutting-edge technologies and innovation and be encouraged to make exciting scientific contributions to the field, present at scientific conferences and publish their work. Postdocs will be a part of the broader R&D Postdoc Program that focuses on training the next generation of industry scientists. An overwhelming majority of our postdocs go on to advance their careers in industry at leading pharma and biotech companies, including many at Amgen. We are looking for talented, self-motivated individuals passionate about science and making high impact discoveries to work on Emerging Therapeutic Modalities. A major focus will be in the exciting area of Proximity Biology, including Targeted Protein Degradation, E3 ubiquitin ligases, PROTACs and molecular glues. Design principles to overcome challenges in Targeting, Developability and ADME will be elucidated for these novel modalities. New postdoctoral fellows will take a multi-disciplinary approach combining chemical biology, molecular biology, biochemistry, cell biology, pharmacology, and analytical chemistry to carry out these studies. Please see representative publications: Cell. 2015 160, 715-28. Cell. 152, 1051-1064. Molecular Cell. S1097-2765(20)30466-4. Molecular Cell. 77(6):1206-1221.e7. Molecular Cell. 69,113-25. Science Advances. 5(5):eaav4832. Nature Communications. 11(1):4931 Drug Metab Dispos. DMD-AR-2021-000798 Drug Metab Dispos. 47(10):1097-1099 J Med Chem. 63(12):6407-6422 Analytical Chemistry 93(13):5562-5569 Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The Postdoctoral Fellow we seek is a professional with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications PhD at the time of appointment Preferred Qualifications PhD in biochemistry, molecular biology, cell biology, cancer biology, pharmacology, chemistry, or pharmaceutical sciences. Broad knowledge of molecular and cellular biology with demonstrated independent research eminence through first author publications in top journals Specific expertise and a record of publication in the biology and biochemistry of ubiquitin-proteasome system and/or protein degradation Research experience with biochemical, biophysical, molecular and cellular techniques, including enzyme and cell assay development, characterization of protein modification and turnover, and mechanistic studies of enzymes, including developing drug-target engagement assays Understanding of mechanistic pharmacokinetic principles including drug absorption, permeability, and key factors in optimizing bioavailability of new chemical entities Research experience with establishing novel assays to understand the role of drug transporters in both absorption and clearance Comprehensive knowledge of analytical chemistry with a focus on mass spectroscopy skills for quantitation of proteins and peptides out of biological matricesical matrices Excellent organizational, interpersonal and communication skills A passion to explore the unknown and make discoveries that will chart new areas of biology Thrive Some of the vast rewards of working here! As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? Do more with the knowledge you’re working hard to acquire and the passion you already have. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Through this program, you will acquire the valuable hands-on skills and foundational experience to become the professional you are meant to be in your chosen field. Postdoctoral Fellow – Cardiometabolic Disorders Live This could be your everyday Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. During this program, you will be provided with an enriching environment to inspire innovation that will contribute to the development of human therapeutics. The Cardiometabolic Disorders Research Department at Amgen is seeking a highly motivated postdoctoral fellow to study how fibroblasts in the heart control cardiac function during homeostasis and disease. The initial focus of the postdoctoral fellow is to determine the different cardiac fibroblast subpopulations present in homeostatic and disease states using state-of-the-art single-cell omics tools combined with bioinformatic analysis. Subsequently, utilizing the laboratory’s advanced biochemical, cellular, and molecular biology techniques combined with genetic engineering and in vivo animal models, the postdoctoral fellow will have the opportunity to interrogate the role of specific fibroblast subpopulations in the development of cardiac fibrosis. This position is ideal for those seeking to understand the fundamentals of therapeutic discovery and translational biology while honing their skills as an independent investigator focused on basic science. The postdoctoral fellow will be encouraged and expected to develop an independent line of research, to evaluate and interpret results of scientific experiments and complex, integrated datasets, and to present at scientific conferences and publish in leading journals. The successful candidate will operate in the context of a highly collaborative environment, with ample opportunities to interact with multi-disciplinary functions including Genome Analysis Unit, Oncology and Inflammation, Biologics and Translational Science. The postdoctoral position is for 3 years with the option to extend for an additional year. Win Here’s What It Takes To Win We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The dedicated individual we seek is a scientist with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications PhD at the time of appointment Preferred Qualifications PhD in molecular biology, cell biology, physiology, or immuno-oncology Previous research experience in one of the following areas: immunology, cardiovascular biology, bioinformatics, or computational biology is preferred Expertise with in vivo rodent models, multi-color flow cytometry, isolation and culture of primary cells, protein engineering and expression, scRNA-seq and/or bioinformatics analysis is also preferred Record of independent critical thinking and the ability to design, execute, and interpret experiments, as exemplified by high quality publications Our culture is what makes Amgen a special place to work. We have a powerful shared purpose around our mission – to serve patients. jobTitle: Postdoctoral Fellow - Digital Integration and Predictive Technologies
jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve earned your degree. How will you use that achievement to reach your goals? Do more with the knowledge you’ve worked hard to acquire and the passion you already have. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Become the professional you are meant to be in this meaningful role. Post Doctoral Fellow-Digital Integration and Predictive Technologies Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this dynamic role you will develop, apply and deploy rigorous mathematical models of biological systems and manufacturing process technologies with the goal to increase the efficiency of drug development and manufacturing processes. You will apply metabolic, biochemical, and bioprocess modeling to create and refine first principles and mechanistic models addressing the fundamental problems of predicting and optimizing performance of mammalian cell culture in bioreactors, from preclinical to commercial phase. Responsibilities include: Formulating the equations describing metabolic and phenotypic phenomena of interest, examining modeling simplifications and assumptions, and implementing models in commercial and proprietary software. Collaborate heavily with internal team members, as well as document and communicate the underlying technical basis of the models for the benefit of and use by engineers and scientists responsible for advancing processes to operation. Development and application of a predictive mechanistic model of cell culture performance in a bioreactor considering parameter uncertainty. Advancing the science of multiscale bioreactor and cell culture modeling Collaborating with academic leaders in cell metabolism and bioprocess modeling in renowned academic institutions Defining cell culture experiments in a bioprocess lab Implementing model features in Python Applying the model to immediately relevant problems in bioprocess development Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The Post Doctoral professional we seek is a collaborative partner with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Ph.D. in Chemical or Biochemical Engineering or related field completed by December 2022. Preferred Qualifications: Experience modeling biochemical systems and cell metabolism Outstanding command of fundamentals and first principles, including mammalian cell metabolism, complex kinetic systems, transport phenomena. Numerical techniques for model calibration and uncertainty quantification Modeling of biophysical systems such as bioreactors, mixing vessels, and downstream equipment. Experience analyzing multi-omics datasets and deriving mechanistic insight into biological systems Understanding of biopharmaceutical processes and unit operations. Intermediate or advanced programming skills in Python Ability to independently uncover and resolve issues associated with the development and implementation of scientific and engineering projects Thrive Some of the vast rewards of working here As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. jobTitle: Principal Engineer – Manufacturing Technology Advancement, Process Development
jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Principal Engineer – Manufacturing Technology Advancement, Process Development Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. Responsibilities: Driving the operationalization of new technologies into our CGMP manufacturing processes through handoff to Manufacturing and Engineering staff and under Quality oversight; Applying scientific, engineering, and technical principles (e.g., data science, robotics, programming, artificial intelligence, machine vision, etc.) to advance innovative process, automation, and analytics technologies; Staying abreast of industry trends on modern manufacturing technologies, especially in the realms of process automation, computer vision and artificial intelligence, and critically assessing external vendor proposals based on sound technical judgment and robust understanding of internal business needs; Participating in multi-functional teams to drive continuous improvements in the Process Development organization as well as across the worldwide Amgen manufacturing network; Supporting the team in designing, prototyping, and evaluating novel technologies in laboratory and pilot plant environments, following good laboratory practices, technically adhering to safety and environmental standards, and enthusiastically anticipating Quality and regulatory agency questions; Working with the team in generating, analyzing, documenting, and presenting data packages related to new manufacturing and analytical technology development, with an emphasis on critically assessing the benefits and drawbacks of candidate technologies; Ensuring knowledge management via multi-functional knowledge sharing, intellectual property capture, and technical documentation per good documentation practices; and As needed, traveling domestically and internationally up to 10% of the time. Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree and 2 years of experience OR Master’s degree and 6 years of experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 8 years of experience OR Associate’s degree and 10 years of experience OR High school diploma / GED and 12 years of experience Preferred Qualifications: Advanced degree in engineering, applied physics, computer science, or related field; 2+ years of experience in a manufacturing industry, or highly relevant academic experience; Cross functional individual contributor working within a mutplitdisplonary enviornment of high professional engineers and scientists with niche skills; Comfort with data science principles, coding, process automation, statistical techniques, deep learning, machine learning, artificial intelligence, robotics, machine vision, optics and additive manufacturing; Experience with industrial computer vision platforms such as Cognex, Keyence, MVTec Halcon or Matrox. Experience with industrial robotics platforms (Staubli, ABB or equivalents) Experience with PLCs, SCADA systems and general industrial automation control solutions. Familiarity with pharmaceutical fill-finish, inspection, assembly, labeling, and packaging manufacturing processes, or similar industrial automation; Strong written and verbal communication skills, as well as the ability to regularly and successfully interact with colleagues from diverse backgrounds and with a range of technical proficiencies; The ability to learn and act upon dynamic information at a rapid pace in a multi-functional environment; Proficiency in technical problem solving, critical thinking, and the delivery of value-adding solutions with limited executive oversight and technical direction. Thrive What You Can Expect Of Us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Principal Engineer - Drug Delivery Devices Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. The Principal Engineer will participate in the design development and lifecycle management related activities for commercialized drug delivery devices. This includes technical operations support for contract manufacturing, failure investigation, leading and assessing design changes, develop test procedures, scale-up and global launch, supplier development, and continues improvement. Scope includes mechanical and electro-mechanical delivery devices, such as; fluid transfer devices, automatic pen injectors, and micro-infuser delivery pump systems. The qualified candidate will be part of a sustaining engineering team that ensures compliance and lifecycle management of these devices. The position will focus on a leading design/development engineering assignments related to the introduction of a new electro-mechanical on-body injector system. Responsibilities include: Actively anticipating and managing product and project risks, continuously evaluating risk reduction efforts Accountability to the Core Team to contribute to project decision making; considering cross-functional product and project needs when making decisions; while remaining accountable to internal and external customers Participating in Global Mfg. Network(s) responsible for ensuring launch readiness and completing long term strategies Overseeing design and development efforts of technical team; ensuring integration points are captured, assessed, and designed properly Executing on individual design and development efforts as needed to maintain project timing and delivery Performing frequent design reviews, incorporating actions and feedback into product development efforts Owner and representation of the technology design and accountability for maintaining technical records within design history file associated with assigned products Lead system level root cause investigation, coordinate design improvements with development partners, strategic planning and execution of design changes and improvements Technical authorship in regulatory filings, supporting site inspections, and addressing any technical queries from regional regulatory agencies and call centers Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. jobTitle: Principal Engineer - MSAT Physical Science and Engineering
jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us! Principal Engineer - MSAT Physical Science and Engineering Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world! In this pivotal role reporting to the Director Physical Science and Engineering, Manufacturing Science and Technologies, the successful candidate for this position will provide integrated management of the Combination Products Organization key Physical Sciences, Engineering Fluid mechanics and mass spectrometry analysis of system performance in real world conditions (from cryogenic to ambient temperatures and ultra-low vacuum to ambient pressure conditions). This function serves Amgen in the development of characterization for system integrity (via fluid mechanics, mass spectrometry and other techniques), physical performance measurement systems, for medical device/combination product and design verification deliverables for all combination products and other systems. Role Responsibilities: The Principal Engineer will operate in a highly matrixed environment to collaborate effectively with cross functional teams. In addition to being the subject matter expert for fluid mechanics/mass spectrometry, transport phenomena, and optics, the principal engineer will lead a group of highly talented staff responsible for critical analysis of combination products and other systems, ensure laboratories maintain proper state of qualification, calibration and preparedness for inspections related to safety, compliance, and procedures. The Principal Engineer must also clearly communicate and elevate technical or strategic issues to team members and management as needed and make robust recommendations and/or decisions to guide successful execution of system integrity and mechanical testing for medical device and combination product systems as well as other key systems. Group members within the functional area, Manufacturing, and Quality rely on this position as a scientific/technical expert who can provide insight and guidance on associated issues as needed. Demonstrated supervisory skills are required. Own and maintain business processes for development, qualification, validation and transfer of system integrity methods for product verification of new products, and transfer of knowledge and technique to key partners. The Principal Engineer must contribute in a collaborative environment to ensure documentation can withstand an audit and pass GMP agency scrutiny Work with industry experts to advance state of the art system integrity methods inclusive of tracer gas methods, high voltage leak detection, optics, and other new emerging technologies Collaborate with system integrity work center teams to establish an executable strategy to meet the future needs and advance the industry standards. Expectation that this Principal Engineer participates in external organization and standards committees to drive consensus aligned with Amgen strategy Act as senior advisor across the physical science and engineering group 10-25% travel to domestic and international locations is needed to help the development partners during implementation of specific container requirements into their processes Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. Ability to participate in global cross-functional teams and work effectively in a highly matrixed team environment with rapidly evolving challenges Demonstrated competencies skills and proven track record of leading cross-functional projects, ability to coach staff, strong teamwork, excellent interpersonal and communication skills Experience with MS Office Suite, MS SharePoint, MS Project, Minitab/JMP, SolidWorks Thrive Some of the vast rewards of working here As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, so we work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Amgen discovers, develops and delivers innovative human therapeutics. A biotechnology pioneer since 1980, Amgen was one of the first companies to realize the new science’s promise by bringing safe, effective medicines from lab, to manufacturing plant, to patient. Amgen therapeutics have changed the practice of medicine, helping millions of people around the world in the fight against cancer, kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis, and other serious illnesses. With a deep and broad pipeline of potential new medicines, Amgen remains committed to advancing science to dramatically improve people’s lives. Reporting to the Physical Science and Engineering team in the Combination Product Operations (CPO) group, the Principal Methods Engineer (PME), will lead a group of combination product test methods development engineers. The test methods developed in this team will support testing for design control characterization / verification. These test methods will go on to serve as manufacturing process controls throughout the Amgen Global Manufacturing network. The position will require roughly 20% travel (post Covid-19). The successful PME candidate will have demonstrated multi-disciplinary and multi-functional product leadership experience. The PME will be responsible for supervising and coaching engineers though technical challenges in developing, characterizing, qualifying, validating and transferring methods that measure the electrical, mechanical and physical properties of primary containers, packaging components, mechanical drug delivery pens, and electromechanical autoinjectors. The PME will launch medium to long range projects to improve the test method process. Exposure to physical testing equipment is highly desirable. Group members within the functional area look up to this position as a scientific/technical expert who can provide guidance on associated issues as needed. The position needs demonstrated supervisory skills. Principal Engineer - Test Methods Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. Owns and maintains compliant business processes for development, validation, transfer and lifecycle management of electrical, mechanical and physical test methods for manufacturing process control. Manages the method lifecycle of released methods, including trending of methods metrics, pareto and root causing of methods issues at the manufacturing sites. Manages the CAPAs and Change Controls to fix them. Transfers validated methods to incoming inspection, process monitoring, and product release labs across the Amgen Global Manufacturing network. Ensures test methods validation, transfer, and lifecycle management documentation can withstand audits and pass regulatory agency scrutiny. Ensures that automated test equipment development, programming, and validation can withstand audits and pass regulatory agency scrutiny. Rapidly Design, develop and qualify and innovate automated inspection equipment for Amgen primary containers and devices to meet new and unique product requirements. Owns and manages the process for creation and use of working Reference Standards for use within Amgen’s engineering and manufacturing groups Advises others on methods to resolve measurement problems, current with information government and industrial standardization committees and professional societies Manage projects, personnel, and laboratory through development of innovative solutions based on insightful interpretation and analysis of the problem statement or investigation Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree and 2 years of engineering experience OR Master’s degree and 6 years of engineering experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 8 years of engineering experience OR Associate’s degree and 10 years of engineering experience OR High school diploma / GED and 12 years of engineering experience Preferred Qualifications: 8+ years of experience in the testing industry with 3+ years of test development, test equipment / test method validation, and manufacturing support of test methods. 3+ years’ experience in leading teams of lean a lean, hard-working multi-disciplinary and multi-functional technical staff. Experience working with physical testing equipment such as Instron, Zwick, or optical microscopes. Ability to communicate technical material to executive management teams in a clear and concise manner, in a style understood by management, for the purposes of procuring project authorization. Experience translating the needs of multi-functional groups (manufacturing, quality, marketing, regulatory, legal, supply chain) into actionable ideas and tasks for engineering and management teams. Experience participating and presenting in regulatory agency audits regarding testing subject matter. Excellent problem solving, trouble shooting, and communication skills. Ability to participate in global multi-functional teams and work effectively in a highly matrixed team environment with constantly evolving challenges Demonstrated proficiencies skills and proven track record of leading multi-functional projects, ability to mentor junior engineers, strong teamwork, excellent interpersonal and communication skills Solid Works engineering drawing, statistical study design, DOE, and DFM tool sets (Six sigma is highly desired). Experience with MS Office Suite, MS SharePoint, MS Project, Minitab/JMP, SolidWorks, LabView, and PLC controller software. jobTitle: Principal Quality Engineer, Complaints Business Performance
jobDescription: Career Category Quality Job Description HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Live What You Will Do Let’s do this! Let’s change the world! Amgen is seeking a Principal Quality Engineer and member of the Product Complaints and Surveillance team. The Product Complaints and Surveillance team owns and implements the global complaint process and management system, ensuring appropriate business connection across Amgen. In doing so, the focus is on assuring complaint processes and systems remain fully compliant through the quality operating standards and procedures to current, emerging internal and external requirements. In addition, the team translates information from the market to drive continuous improvement. The Principal Quality Engineer finds ways to prevent waste and inefficiency in processes. This role helps the complaint organization to identify and implement programmatic systems and processes, advance organizational capability development, and complete projects aligned with the functions’ strategic objectives to ensure long term success through continuous improvement and transformational capabilities. The Principal Quality Engineer designs efficient systems that integrate and assist in the prioritization and scheduling of workloads, identifying process improvements, and ensuring teams are managing daily activities most effectively. They also design processes to coordinate workload planning to minimize complaint processing issues and ensure complaint records are closed in a timely manner with the highest of quality standards. Designs, develops and maintains processing and oversight tools and practices to increase effectiveness, efficiency and space. Ensures the organization aligns with all standards for safety, quality, and compliance. Leads and/or works in a support role as needed on identified projects. Key Responsibilities: Reviews process information to understand methods and activities in the complaints and surveillance organization. This includes, but is not limited to, schedules, process flows and workflows. Designs systems and tools to minimize and resolve processing issues and increase productivity. Plans daily workload management to ensure all records and samples are processed in a timely manner Develops processes to ensure productivity and efficiencies Conducts daily stand-up meeting to ensure efforts are coordinated in an effective manner across working teams Designs and implements capacity models to drive proactive planning and efficiency across the organization Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The outstanding professional we seek will have these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree and 2 years of professional experience in Quality, Manufacturing Or Master’s degree and 6 years of professional experience in Quality / Manufacturing Or Bachelor’s degree and 8 years of professional experience in Quality / Manufacturing Or Associate’s degree and 10 years of professional experience in Quality / Manufacturing Or High school diploma / GED and 12 years of professional experience in Quality / Manufacturing Preferred Qualifications: 8+ years of Industrial Engineering, quality and/or manufacturing experience in a relative industry (i.e., Biotech, Pharmaceutical, Automotive) Quality and manufacturing experience in biotech or pharmaceutical industry Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Mathematics and/or a Science Field Strong background in statistics and complex statistical analysis Industrial Engineering Degree In depth knowledge of planning, prioritization, and scheduling tools Knowledge of current Global regulations and their application Understanding of Investigations and Root Cause Analysis Understanding of the criticality of aligning target timeline and driving process improvements Experience in planning, coordinating, and managing large throughput operations Detail-oriented with experience in QA/QC functions across a broad range of manufacturing, QC and/or supply chain processes Ability to work in a team matrix environment and independently interact with different levels of management Good communication skills, both written and oral Ability to create multi-functional networks/partnerships Ability to plan, monitor, and control a set of activities, ensuring efficient utilization of resources to achieve program objectives A passion for managing for daily improvement Indirect leadership skills and the ability to oversee multiple projects simultaneously Able to successfully and independently manage workload, timelines, and priorities Familiarity with advanced project management tools Ability to operate in a matrixed or team environment with site, functional, and executive leadership Ability to travel +/- 10% of time to domestic and international Amgen sites Thrive What You Can Expect Of Us Ensures the organization aligns with all standards for safety, quality, and compliance. Leads and/or works in a support role as needed on identified projects. Key Responsibilities: Reviews process information to understand methods and activities in the complaints and surveillance organization. This includes, but is not limited to, schedules, process flows and workflows. Designs systems and tools to minimize and resolve processing issues and increase productivity. Plans daily workload management to ensure all records and samples are processed in a timely manner Develops processes to ensure productivity and efficiencies Conducts daily stand-up meeting to ensure efforts are coordinated in an effective manner across working teams Designs and implements capacity models to drive proactive planning and efficiency across the organization Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The outstanding professional we seek will have these qualifications. GED and 12 years of professional experience in Quality / Manufacturing Preferred Qualifications: 8+ years of Industrial Engineering, quality and/or manufacturing experience in a relative industry HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role. Process Development Associate Live What You Will Do Let’s do this! Let’s change the world! Amgen Process Development (PD) organization is seeking an enthusiastic team-oriented Associate to join the ATO Rapid Analytics (RA) group within Attribute Science (AS). The ATO RA organization focuses on providing high throughput analytical testing services to support pipeline delivery across a wide range of therapeutic biologics in both Pre-Pivotal and Pivotal phases. In the highly matrixed fast-paced team environment, the primary responsibility of this Associate role is to perform product quality analysis and provide analytical data by adhering to projects timelines to enable process decisions. The candidate will be an integral member of a dynamic team, collaborating with research scientists at multiple Amgen sites, and working closely with groups in other functional areas. Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following: Complete analytical testing within expected turnaround time per established procedure for following assays: IEX (Ion Exchange chromatography), SEC (size-exclusion chromatography), HILIC (hydrophilic interaction) for glycan mapping, Affinity purification for titer, RP (Reversed Phase chromatography) and CE-SDS (Capillary Electrophoresis-Sodium Dodecyl Sulfate), etc. Adhere to ATO RA turnaround time for high throughput samples and all required metrics Ability to work and adapt in a fast-paced and dynamic environment Document, review results, and maintain electronic laboratory notebooks Work with development team to implement methods in ATO RA, analyze and interpret data Solve technical problems with both instrument and assay issues as part of troubleshooting Author, review, and data verify technical documents Communicate project updates as appropriate Participate and present scientific data in meetings Interact with clients for data and project demands Maintain instruments and follow lab’s general equipment cleaning protocols Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The dynamic professional we seek is an employee with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Analytical Chemistry, Physical, Life Sciences or related technical discipline Associate’s degree in Analytical Chemistry, Physical, Life Sciences or related technical discipline and 4 years of experience performing analytical testing Or High school diploma / GED and 6 years of experience performing analytical testing Preferred Qualifications: Good understanding of Liquid Chromatography and Capillary Electrophoresis and strong hands-on technical skills to address challenging technical issues Strong ability to analyze and interpret analytical results Excellent organization and communication (oral and written) skills and attention to details Ability to learn new technology quickly, multi-task and adapt in a dynamic environment Possess a positive attitude and strong self‑motivation Thrive Some of the vast rewards of working here As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role. Live What You Will Do Let’s do this! Let’s change the world! Attribute Sciences group within Process Development provides scientific and technical expertise to support development and commercialization of Amgen’s pipeline of drug candidates. The department identifies and coordinates the achievement of desired product quality attributes towards target product profiles, develops and applies fit-for-purpose analytical methodologies. This position is an exciting opportunity to be a part of Amgen. Our culture encourages open communication to help our staffs to excel throughout their career at Amgen. Amgen focuses on areas of high unmet medical needs and uses its expertise to strive for solutions that improve health outcomes and dramatically improve people’s lives. A biotechnology pioneer since 1980, Amgen has grown to be one of the world’s leading independent biotechnology companies, has reached millions of patients around the world and is developing a pipeline of medicines with breakaway potential. Amgen Process Development (PD) organization is seeking an enthusiastic team-oriented Associate. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing technical assessments using color, clarity, visual, pH, osmolality, density, concentration, solid state extraction, HIAC, Karl-Fisher techniques for early phase GMP biologic materials and supporting troubleshooting method related issues, transferring method into an early phase GMP laboratory, and delivering attribute characterization data in a compliance manner. The candidate should have proven skills and extensive experiences in color, clarity, visual, pH, osmolality, density, concentration, solid state extraction, HIAC, Karl-Fisher analytical methods used to test diverse modalities including monoclonal, bispecific antibodies, bispecific T-cell engagers (“BiTEs”), and other protein modalities. This individual will be a part of a team that collaborates with early phase and late phase attribute sciences development teams. Compendial GxP responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following: Work as an analyst to support product release and stability Compendial Assay testing in compliant with cGMP regulations. Document, analyze, and report results. Follow Standard Operating Procedure (SOPs) under direction of a Technical Supervisor. Author, review, and data verify technical documents. Analytical laboratory skills and technical knowledge of proteins and peptides. Experience with cGMP and/or QC environment, documentation and methods. Experience with the following techniques: color, clarity, visual, pH, osmolality, density, concentration, solid state extraction, HIAC, Karl-Fisher. Experience in working with LIMS is a plus. Collaborative personality and acute attention to detail. Good troubleshooting and problem solving skills. Good verbal communication, organization, presentation, and technical writing skills. Ability to work and adapt in a fast-paced and dynamic environment Document, review results, and maintain electronic laboratory notebooks Work with development team to implement methods, analyze and interpret data Solve technical problems with both instrument and assay issues as part of troubleshooting Author, review, and data verify technical documents Communicate project updates as appropriate Participate and present scientific data in meetings Interact with collaborators for data and project demands Maintain instruments and follow lab’s general equipment cleaning protocols Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The dynamic professional we seek is an employee with these qualifications. Attribute Sciences group within Process Development provides scientific and technical expertise to support development and commercialization of Amgen’s pipeline of drug candidates. The department identifies and coordinates the achievement of desired product quality attributes towards target product profiles, develops and applies fit-for-purpose analytical methodologies. This position is an exciting opportunity to be a part of Amgen. Our culture encourages open communication to help our staffs to excel throughout their career at Amgen. Amgen focuses on areas of high unmet medical needs and uses its expertise to strive for solutions that improve health outcomes and dramatically improve people’s lives. A biotechnology pioneer since 1980, Amgen has grown to be one of the world’s leading independent biotechnology companies, has reached millions of patients around the world and is developing a pipeline of medicines with breakaway potential. In this vital role you will contribute to Amgen’s diverse process development portfolio of therapeutic modalities with a focus on understanding process and product properties of large molecule drug candidates and assessing the quality attributes of protein therapeutics being developed across multiple therapeutic areas in Amgen’s pipeline. Collaborate cross-functionally to drive the efficient transfer of technologies and to ensure appropriate delivery of procedures and processes. Responsible for analytical leadership of pre-pivotal programs, Scientific and technical expertise to advance the pre-pivotal portfolio Lead development and implementation of sophisticated analytical techniques. Pre-Pivotal Attribute Sciences Scientist Key Responsibilities: Good understanding of cGMP principles and follow compliance requirements in routine day to day work. Technical leadership in support of incoming method transfer/qualification, method optimization, troubleshooting method related issues, and investigations in an early phase GMP environment. Lead a team responsible for implementing and executing color, clarity, visual, pH, osmolality, density, concentration, solid state extraction, HIAC, Karl-Fisher techniques as part of the product release testing, stability testing, characterization, method optimization, investigations, and regulatory submissions Documenting all experiments following Good Documentation Practices. Generating, analyzing, and critical evaluation of analytical data to support product release and stability, process characterization, investigations, and regulatory submissions May participate or contribute to critical activities to support analytical development teams (e.g., Product and process development teams, Product quality teams) by providing analytical updates, analytical documentation and data interpretation Provides training and mentoring to junior staff Duties may include managing timelines and resources to delivery to major milestones, participating in process improvement and strategy development. Revise SOPs, training qualifications, and GMP documents with guidance Perform both technical and personnel aspects of group operations Act as a technical resource, trainer, and troubleshooter to specific department, make recommendations for operational and/or technical improvements Ensure samples were tested in compliance with cGMP regulations and completed in a timely manner to meet TAT Meets all quality and productivity metrics and demonstrates strong teamwork and collaboration Support and drive operational improvements Conduct semi-annual performance reviews, interview applicants, keep training records up to date for assigned employees, evaluate succession plans in preparation for growth Monitor and approve employees’ time worked through time-entry system Subject matter expertise in techniques such as: UV-Vis, KF, Solid Phase Extraction, HIAC, visual, color, clarity, pH, osmolality, density Investigates method performance, reliability, and evaluates impact of proposed changes. Work collaboratively with other scientists on multidisciplinary teams Keep current with field of expertise and evaluate emerging analytical technology Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve earned your degree. How will you use that achievement to reach your goals? Do more with the knowledge you’ve worked hard to acquire and the passion you already have. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Become the professional you are meant to be in this meaningful role. Process Development Scientist We are currently seeking a Process Development Scientist in our Pre-Pivotal Attribute Sciences Department in Thousand Oaks, CA. Amgen’s Attribute Sciences (AS) department within the Process Development (PD) organization defines the critical quality characteristics of the therapeutics and uses innovative analytical tools to assess product quality attributes and guide the drug development. The Pre-Pivotal AS organization’s focus is on supporting analytical method development and product characterization to advance candidates from research to first-in-human clinical trials. The Process Development Scientist will chip in to Amgen’s diverse early-stage portfolio of therapeutic modalities with a focus on understanding process and product properties of large molecule drug candidates and assessing the quality attributes of protein therapeutics being developed across multiple therapeutic areas in Amgen’s pipeline. The candidate will be responsible for analytical leadership of pre-pivotal programs and the implementation of sophisticated analytical techniques to characterize novel modalities in the pipeline. Key responsibilities: Routinely build experiments that lead to a fundamental understanding of a therapeutic protein’s attributes and stability characteristics. Advanced technical expertise in analytical methodologies used to characterize protein therapeutics including CE, SEC, IEX, RP, HILIC, and mass spectrometry, with good understanding both theoretical and practical aspects of stability-indicating assay, e.g., design, performance, results, etc. Investigates method performance, reliability, and evaluates impact of proposed changes. Deep understanding of product quality attributes and methodology to measure attributes, and to ensure accurate control strategy. Optimally functions as an Attribute Sciences representative on project teams. Support drug substance and drug product process development and protein characterization, collects analytical data to be used for regulatory submissions, and participates in technology transfer activities. Authoring regulatory documents. Understanding of regulatory expectations for analytical methods, control and stability strategy and comparability. Work collaboratively with other scientists on multidisciplinary teams Keep current with field of expertise and evaluate emerging analytical technology Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree OR Doctorate's Degree by Time of Hire Master’s degree and 4 years of directly related life science experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 6 years of directly related life science experience Preferred Qualifications: Ph. D. in analytical chemistry, biochemistry, biophysics or other life science area plus 2 or more years of industry experience. Strong expertise in analytical method development, validation and trouble-shooting for using HPLC/UPLC, CE and mass spectrometry etc. to characterize protein therapeutics. Strong experience in separation sciences, protein chemistry and/or mass spectrometry. Strong lab skills to craft and complete scientific experiments, interpretation of sophisticated data and deliver results Familiarity with commonly observed product quality attributes associated with therapeutic proteins (such as fragmentation, deamidation, oxidation, partial reduction etc.), and their characterization and quantification tools Understanding/experience of GMP compliance is a preferred qualification. Prior experience authoring or chipping in to regulatory filings. Work independently in advancing projects and studies within required deadlines. Excellent written and oral communication skills for the timely documentation, presentation, and discussion of scientific results in a fast-paced, multi-disciplinary environment Thrive Some of the vast rewards of working here As we work to develop treatments that look after others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. Let’s change the world. In this vital role, you will be part of our Pivotal Drug Product Technology Group in Cambridge, MA which is responsible for late-stage drug product formulation and fill/finish process development for large molecule modalities (e.g. monoclonal antibodies, bispecific T-cell engagers (BiTEs), and fusion proteins). Working closely with a team of scientists and engineers, the successful candidate will apply scientific and engineering principles to advance the technical aspects of Amgen’s drug product and process development. Lead the design and planning of laboratory studies related to formulation and fill/finish process development by applying basic science/engineering skills, first principle modeling, and prior knowledge Execute and document laboratory studies with a high degree of technical rigor Develop technical project plans to generate comprehensive data packages in support of commercial formulation/process development and process characterization Author and review guideline documents, technical protocols, reports, and regulatory sections in support of IND and marketing application submissions Lead multiple activities in parallel to drive project plans to completion, meeting project timelines, and achievements Participate in Drug Product Commercialization Teams responsible for conducting process development on pipeline and lifecycle management programs Perform data analysis using advanced statistical/analytical techniques with proficiency in statistical analysis software Deliver progress reports and presentations to management on technical challenges, proposed solutions, and results Ability to travel domestically and internationally up to 10% of the time ' Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our outstanding contributions to serve patients. The hard-working professional we seek is collaborative with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Master’s degree and 3 years of process development or scientific experience Or Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of process development or scientific experience Preferred Qualifications: Advanced degree in Chemical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Biochemistry, Biotechnology, Pharmaceutics, or related field 2+ years of post-doctoral or industry experience in pharmaceuticals/ biotechnology or related field Knowledge of/hands-on experience with formulation and commercial process development for liquid and lyophilized drug products Experience with the unit operation (i.e. filling, filtration, mixing, etc.) specific scale-down model development, characterization, and scale-up Understanding of physical/chemical stability of proteins and how process-related stress impacts product quality, specifically, the impact of freezing and drying on short- and long-term stability Strong problem-solving and effective multi-functional interpersonal skills Experience with coding/scripting for automated data analysis and modeling Experience with data visualization tools or packages, such as Tableau or Spotfire Experience that includes elements of new product development, formulation development, process characterization, equipment design and implementation, technical transfers to global manufacturing sites, statistical process control (SPC), and statistical design and analysis of experiments Proven ability to learn and act on dynamic information at a rapid pace Thrive Some of the vast rewards of working here As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve earned your degree. How will you use that achievement to reach your goals? Do more with the knowledge you’ve worked hard to acquire and the passion you already have. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Become the professional you are meant to be in this meaningful role. Process Development Scientist Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. Responsibilities: Characterizing candidate molecules to support protein primary structure as well as characterizing drug candidate chemical and post-translational modifications (quality attributes) and their susceptibility to modification during the process and product development activities. This includes the use of mass spectrometry coupled with a variety of separation techniques, including liquid chromatography (reversed-phase, size-exclusion, cation-exchange) and capillary zone electrophoresis to identify, characterize, and quantitate quality attributes. LC-MS analysis of intact therapeutic proteins and LC-MS/MS peptide mapping. Focus on developing novel sample preparation and MS-based technologies to reduce time and material requirements during all phases of candidate selection. This role will also emphasize mass spectrometric method development and application for product characterization, including primary structure/glycan structure elucidation. Generation of technical documents and technical presentations is required. Working as part of a cross-functional team to define strategies for protein mass spectrometry testing, performing complex data analyses, and developing high throughput methods to monitor attributes. Requires ability to work collaboratively with other scientists on multidisciplinary teams. Additional responsibilities include keeping current with the field of expertise, including literature and technology development. Responsible for providing scientific results that support the generation of publications, patents, and regulatory submissions, participating in recruiting and candidate evaluation, exploring and evaluating emerging technologies relevant to MS-based characterization of therapeutic proteins, and supervising and analyzing driven scientific knowledge from external sources. Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree OR Master’s degree and 4 years of experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 6 years of experience Preferred Qualifications: Ph.D. in biological sciences, analytical chemistry, biochemistry, pharmaceutical sciences, physical sciences, chemical engineering Expertise with mass spectrometry of proteins, peptides, and glycans. Expertise with Thermo mass spectrometers, Agilent and Waters HPLC systems, and corresponding data acquisition software such as Chromeleon and Empower. Expertise with one of the mass spectrometry data processing software packages (BioPharma Finder, Byonic, Byos, Expressionist, Pinpoint, Skyline) Expertise with statistical software, including Excel, is recommended Experience within the biotech industry, experience including data analyses, statistical analysis, setting acceptance criteria in support of process development, process/method transfers, and comparability studies is a plus. Good problem-solving skills requiring the application of scientific theory Ability to demonstrate skills in independently determining and developing scientific analysis and solutions, as well as demonstrate strong laboratory work skills to include the design and performance of scientific experiments and interpretation of results. Excellent written and oral communication skills for the timely documentation, presentation, and discussion of scientific results in a fast-paced, multi-disciplinary environment.
