Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role. Process Development Senior Associate Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. Amgen's Attribute Sciences (AS) department within the Process Development (PD) organization defines the favorable quality characteristics of the therapies it produces, and optimizes innovative analytical tools to guide that development. The Pivotal PD organizations focus is developing and commercializing robust manufacturing processes across a wide range of therapeutic modalities, including (but not limited to) monoclonal and bispecific antibodies, bispecific T-cell engagers ("BiTEs"), live oncolytic viruses, and synthetic medicines. As a PD Sr Associate, the candidate will participate in protein characterization studies to support regulatory filings using High-Performance Liquid Chromatography (HPLC) / Ultra Performance Liquid Chromatography (UPLC) and mass spectrometry (MS). The candidate will also work to develop, qualify, and transfer analytical methods to Quality Control, and optimize and troubleshoot existing methods. They will collaborate with other process development departments to support commercial process development and process characterization studies in support of marketing applications. This position is located in our Thousand Oaks, CA office. Key Responsibilities Perform method development and qualification studies using HPLC, UPLC, and Capillary Electrophoresis platforms Perform chromatographic fractionation, peptide mapping, intact mass, and other LC-MS studies to support product characterization and comparability studies Author results in laboratory notebooks and method development reports, inter‐facing closely with Attribute Sciences Team Leads and Quality Control to transfer and troubleshoot qualified methods Participate in the maintenance of Attribute Sciences instruments and assist the Attribute Sciences department in maintaining a phase-appropriate good manufacturing practices (GMP) environment With a focus toward evaluation of critical quality attributes, coordinate and per‐form attribute identification and characterization studies, including isolation and analysis of chromatography fractions Conduct and coordinate accelerated stability studies to define therapeutic degradative pathways Perform evaluation of novel platform analytical technologies to help drive innovation Perform experiments to help answer questions from health authorities Collaborate with partner organizations during commercial process development, process characterization, and process validation studies to support marketing applications Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. As a science-based, patient-focused organization, we discover and develop innovative therapies to treat serious illnesses. Amgen’s Attribute Sciences (AS) department within the Process Development (PD) organization defines the favorable quality characteristics of the therapies and utilizes state-of-the-art analytical tools to measure product quality attributes (PQA) and guide the drug development. The Pre-Pivotal AS (PPAS) organization is seeking a Senior Scientist in biologics therapeutic development in Thousand Oaks, CA. A successful candidate should demonstrate the key competencies and R&R include, but not limited to, the followings: Experienced in authoring FIH IND CTA Quality Module 3 DS/DP sections for regulatory filing to various jurisdictions. Knowledgeable in PQA and their impacts to safety and efficacy to patients Capable of implementing attribute control strategy to mitigate risks Deep understanding in analytical methods and technologies Well organized and good communication skills Sense of ownership, responsible, and reliable Positive attitude and 'can-do' mentality to navigate through changes proactively Job responsibilities will include Lead and work collaboratively with multidisciplinary AS team members and set release, specification, stability testing strategies to advance PPAS pipeline product projects Represent AS department in cross-functional product delivery teams Responsible and accountable for planning, design, execution of stability studies and product characterization Guide and implement analytical method development and transfer to internal and external partner organizations Communicate (verbal and in written) scientific concepts and results to multidisciplinary audiences Work independently in advancing projects and studies within required deadlines. Continuous adherence to compliance requirements and meeting organization’s goals and priorities Additional responsibilities will include authoring and reviewing scientific results in electronic notebooks, participating in group and project meetings, deliver progress reports, presentations, publications, and patent applications as appropriate. Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The dynamic professional we seek is an employee with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree and 2 years of directly related experience OR Master’s degree and 5 years of directly related experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 7 years of directly related experience Preferred Qualifications: Ph.D. in Analytical Chemistry, Biochemistry, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering or other life science-related fields Prior experience in regulatory filing Two or more years in the pharmaceutical or biotech industry in analytical method development Strong technical background and understanding of LC, CE, and MS method development, qualification, and troubleshooting for methods that generate product quality attributes associated with therapeutic proteins (such as glycosylation, deamidation, oxidation, partial reduction etc.) Principally understanding the spirit of ICH guidelines, Good Laboratory Practices (GLP), and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) requirements and their applications in a phase-appropriate manner Ability to create and conceptualize solutions to address complex problems Demonstrated leadership skills and experience in managing teams and deliverables Experience in external collaboration with industrial peers, consortium, and regulatory bodies Strong scientific journal publications and/or successful patent applications Thrive What You Can Expect Of Us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. Amgen is currently seeking a Process Development Senior Associate for our Pre-Pivotal Drug Product Technologies group in Thousand Oaks, CA. This group is responsible for early-stage drug product formulation development for multiple modalities. Additionally, the position will develop novel formulations (liquid, lyophilized and frozen). The Associate Scientist will provide technical and project leadership while integrating information generated by cross functional teams to ensure success through the early-stage drug product development process. Responsibilities include: Participate in the planning, design, execution, and documentation of laboratory studies related to formulation and fill/finish process development in support of product commercialization. Conduct stability studies, including preparation of formulations. Solid skills in the lab will be needed. Implement development of protein drug formulations, analytical characterization of proteins, development of chromatographic and electrophoretic assays (UPLC/HPLC, SEC, CEX, RP-HPLC, CE-SDS and cIEF). Additional responsibilities include documenting and retrieving scientific results in electronic notebooks and computer files for regulatory filings, participating in group and project meetings, and presenting at departmental seminars. Perform data analysis using advanced statistical/analytical techniques with statistical analysis software as needed. Author and review guideline documents, technical protocols, reports, and regulatory sections in support of IND application submissions. Deliver progress reports and presentations to ensure management awareness and engagement of the status, advancement, and future program functional needs within Operations. Ability to operate with principles of a safe laboratory environment. Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The dynamic professional we seek is an individual with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Master’s degree OR Bachelor’s degree and 2 years of scientific experience Preferred Qualifications: Advanced degree in Biochemistry, Chemistry, Biomedical Engineering, Biotechnology, Pharmaceutics or related field with experience in pharmaceutical development and manufacturing Working experience with Protein Analytical methods: SoloVPE, HPLC/UPLC, Capillary Electrophoresis, Particle analysis, Moisture analysis, Biophysical techniques such as CD and Fluorescence, Analytical centrifugation, light scattering (DLS, SLS). Should have fundamental knowledge of instrumental analysis, analytical chemistry and protein biochemistry. Knowledge of formulation development, viscosity reduction and fill/finish processes are. appreciated Knowledge on SPR, Octet, BLI, etc. appreciated Proficient troubleshooting skills regarding laboratory analytical instruments. Strong teamwork, organizational skills, attention to detail and accuracy, excellent written and oral communication skills. Capable of quick learning and multitasking. Capable of learning a variety of computer software including software for electronic notebooks. Experience that includes elements of new product development, formulation development, process characterization, equipment design and implementation, Ability to learn and act on dynamic information at a rapid pace Thrive Some of the vast rewards of working here As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. jobTitle: Product Owner/Business Analyst - SAP Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) - US Remote
jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us. Product Owner/Business Analyst - SAP Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) - US Remote As a member of the Amgen team, we provide you with valuable opportunities to broaden your experience and maximize your potential. We ensure our staff are equipped to excel today and tomorrow by leveraging state-of-the-art technologies and modern working environments, encouraging open dialogue and professional debate, and collaborating with world-class talent and institutions around the globe. We believe in rewarding those who do rewarding work and are committed to providing careers that can help turn the tide of serious, life-interrupting illnesses. Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will lead the Logistics and Warehouse Management capability teams within the Operations Digital, Technology & Innovation (OPS DTI) group to support the Global Supply Chain business organization. We are embarking on our journey to establish a State-of-the-Art Site for Amgen and are implementing SAP Extended Warehouse Management System (SAP S/4) as well as ASRS (Automatic Storage and Retrieval System) as part of advancing strategic capabilities within Amgen’s Supply Chain to enable digitalization, faster decision making & speed to/in market. If that motivates you then this is just the role for you! As the Warehouse Management Product Owner/ Business Analyst, you will report into the Order to Cash Product Manager and you will work closely with the functional and technology stakeholders at each stage of the development lifecycle to build and sustain the best fitting technology solutions using Agile and Scrum methodologies. You will develop and maintain a vision for how technology can be leveraged to solve critical business problems, understand the impact of technical solutions on business outcomes and ensure to maximize the ROI of investments made. You will proactively lead the collaboration and engagement with various stakeholders and help in delivering best practice solutions based on business requirements. This role will be critical in our path of transformation to have a best-in-class Warehouse Management capability and you will be leveraging a portfolio of systems like SAP Extended Warehouse Management, ASRS (Automatic Storage and Retrieval System), ERP/SAP, Rapid Response/Kinaxis, Data Lake and Control Tower. As a Product Owner / Business Analyst you will: Work closely and lead discussions with stakeholders to elicit information in order to understand true business needs as User Stories Exhibit business process expertise in Logistics overall and more specifically in SAP Extended Warehouse Management. Operate as the Technical Product Owner for the End-2-End solution within your domain. Lead and support the analysis, solution, design, and estimation of various projects and backlog items that address business problems Prioritize work based on understanding of requirements and business impact Understand technology strategy and help develop business case alternatives which anticipate the future direction of the business Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The professional we seek is a product owner with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications Doctorate degree and 2 years of Information Systems experience OR Master’s degree and 6 years of Information Systems experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 8 years of Information Systems experience OR Associate degree and 10 years of Information Systems OR High school diploma/GED and 12 years of Information Systems experience Preferred Qualifications Expert knowledge in the following SAP areas in order of priority: Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) Systems, Order to Cash process, Transportation Management Systems and Master Data concepts Experience in business process re-engineering or process improvement, involving broad-based information systems, utilizing tools and techniques to effect business change Ability to understand business strategy and needs and support the translation into application requirements Ability to create compelling business cases balancing business benefits and costs Ability to understand business complexity and project interdependencies Intellectual curiosity and the ability to question thought partners across functional areas Exceptional communication skills and the ability to communicate appropriately at all levels of the organization; this includes written and verbal communications as well as visualizations Strong understanding of basic system engineering, information risk and security guidelines and architecture standards Team player able to work effectively at all levels of an organization with the ability to influence others to move toward consensus Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Demonstrable experience in the following areas: Business Analysis, Defining a business case, Model requirements, Validate solutions, Project and Product management and Creating and maintaining backlog of user stories Thrive What You Can Expect Of Us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. In this vital role you will work with the Diagnostic Development Team (DxDT) and the Diagnostic Launch Team (DxLT) to support the development and implementation of high quality, global, integrated cross-functional diagnostic project plans for one or more products in support of the overall program strategy. These teams work with Amgen Product Development teams and Diagnostic companies to support the timelines and results for the programs. Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to: Working with the DxDT / DxLT Leads, identifies key Dx deliverables for each function and their inter-dependencies Specifically, executing the following: Dx joint project team decision log, meeting minutes, budget, forecast Dx deliverables tracking Dx regulatory risk log Dx development timelines paired with the clinical development plans, working with the Dx strategy and technical leads, and clinical operation leads Facilitates planning for diagnostic development and commercialization activities that support key drug development stage-gate decision points (e.g., First in Human, End of Phase 2, Filing, and Launch) Manage the DxDT SharePoint and Teams to centralize DxDT information, planning, and budget Implements standard methodologies and ensuring cross-functional alignment and accountability Identifies project issues or resource gaps and facilitating resolution Reinforces proper decision making according to Amgen’s Decision-Making Framework Monitors and communicates progress and adherence to diagnostic development timelines Facilitates resource planning, financial and capacity assessments Conducts risk management, contingency and scenario planning using a variety of project management tools Leads review and execution of Diagnostic development budget, processing of invoices, purchase orders, contracts, statements of work The Dx PM leads DxDT and DxLT team effectiveness by: Identifying and efficiently resolving issues, facilitating decisions, and tracking action items; appropriate issue escalation Partners with DxDT or DxLT Leads to develop governance board deliverables and subsequent implementation of decisions Develops positive relationships with external business partners and strategic alliances The Dx PM drives effective DxDT and DxLT communication by: Serves as a point of contact for cross-functional information (content and quality) Communicates cross-functional project information at meetings and to other partners, as appropriate Ensures alignment of functional and regional issues Demonstrates strong written / oral communication skills and executive presence across functions and across different levels of leadership Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve earned your degree. How will you use that achievement to reach your goals? Do more with the knowledge you’ve worked hard to acquire and the passion you already have. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Become the professional you are meant to be in this meaningful role. Does the thought of building an entirely new site, from the ground up excite you? Do you love building and developing impactful teams? If you have a passion for talent development and want to be a part of Amgen’s mission to serve patients – every patient every time – then check out this exciting new opportunity. Be part of the Amgen Advanced Assembly and Final Product Operation, a new facility focused on medical device assembly and packaging of injectable medicines. When completed, the facility will not only feature the best in-class assembly and packaging technologies with embedded industry 4.0 capabilities, but it will also integrate sustainability innovations to reduce carbon and waste, as part of Amgen’s plan to be a carbon-neutral company by 2027. Quality assurance specialist Reporting to the Director Quality, the QA specialist for the new Amgen Advanced Assembly and Final Product Operation facility will provide quality oversight of the design, installation, commissioning & qualification and process qualification of the new facility and equipment. QA specialist will also support implementation of the Amgen Quality management system into the new facility. This can cover a wide range of quality processes that drive and govern operations in manufacturing, warehousing and quality assurance (e.g. deviation management, disposition, change control etc.). Once the site is in operation, the QA specialist will also provide quality oversight for manufacturing and be responsible for batch disposition. This role will require local presence at the New Albany facility near Columbus, Ohio. Live What You Will Do Let’s do this! Let’s change the world! At Amgen, we are committed to being science-based and follow a continuous learning approach to advancing science, driving discovery and igniting innovation that works to help reduce disease. It is in this context that we endorse an inclusive and diverse workforce that helps fuel scientific innovation and problem solving, leading to better scientific solutions that benefit both patients and society. In this vital role you will be responsible for leading and directing cross functional staff as an informed Subject Matter Expert in the Quality deliverables under general supervision. A key aspect of this role is to apply critical thinking skills to ensure quality and compliance to GMP regulations for all area operations and associated processes. Duties include validation documentation review & approval, SOP creation, review & approval, quality support in electronic batch record creation, quality approval of deviations & CAPA records and batch disposition. Responsibilities will include evaluation of compliance issues, providing recommendations, and assuring progress of records to completion. Provides quality and compliance expertise & guidance and agrees on execution strategies related to the design, installation, commissioning & qualification and process qualification of the new facility, equipment and information systems. Reviews and approves controlled documents, including Standard Operating Procedures, Validation Protocols, Validation Reports, Electronic Master Batch Records etc. Provides quality oversight for quality records including deviations/CAPAs, technical change controls and work orders assuring adherence to procedural requirements and confirming assessments and evaluations of different partners are complete and accurate Ensures that all activities & related documentation for facilities, equipment, materials and processes align with applicable regulations and Amgen requirements relating to Good Manufacturing Practices, Good Documentation Practices, Safety, and Controls. Own quality related Standard Operating Procedures, Work Instructions, Forms and Methods Provides quality oversight for manufacturing and responsible for batch disposition. Support and represent Quality during audits and inspections; may directly interact with regulatory agencies during on-site inspections. HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve earned your degree. How will you use that achievement to reach your goals? Do more with the knowledge you’ve worked hard to acquire and the passion you already have. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Become the professional you are meant to be in this meaningful role. Does the thought of building an entirely new site, from the ground up excite you? Do you love building and developing impactful teams? If you have a passion for talent development and want to be a part of Amgen’s mission to serve patients – every patient every time – then check out this exciting new opportunity. Be part of the Amgen Advanced Assembly and Final Product Operation, a new facility focused on medical device assembly and packaging of injectable medicines. When completed, the facility will not only feature the best in-class assembly and packaging technologies with embedded industry 4.0 capabilities, but it will also integrate sustainability innovations to reduce carbon and waste, as part of Amgen’s plan to be a carbon-neutral company by 2027. Quality assurance specialist Reporting to the Director Quality, the QA specialist for the new Amgen Advanced Assembly and Final Product Operation facility will provide quality oversight of the design, installation, commissioning & qualification and process qualification of the new facility and equipment. QA specialist will also support implementation of the Amgen Quality management system into the new facility. This can cover a wide range of quality processes that drive and govern operations in manufacturing, warehousing and quality assurance (e.g. deviation management, disposition, change control etc.). Once the site is in operation, the QA specialist will also provide quality oversight for manufacturing and be responsible for batch disposition. This role will require local presence at the New Albany facility near Columbus, Ohio. Live What You Will Do Let’s do this! Let’s change the world! At Amgen, we are committed to being science-based and follow a continuous learning approach to advancing science, driving discovery and igniting innovation that works to help reduce disease. It is in this context that we endorse an inclusive and diverse workforce that helps fuel scientific innovation and problem solving, leading to better scientific solutions that benefit both patients and society. In this vital role you will be responsible for leading and directing cross functional staff as an informed Subject Matter Expert in the Quality deliverables under general supervision. A key aspect of this role is to apply critical thinking skills to ensure quality and compliance to GMP regulations for all area operations and associated processes. Duties include validation documentation review & approval, SOP creation, review & approval, quality support in electronic batch record creation, quality approval of deviations & CAPA records and batch disposition. Responsibilities will include evaluation of compliance issues, providing recommendations, and assuring progress of records to completion. Provides quality and compliance expertise & guidance and agrees on execution strategies related to the design, installation, commissioning & qualification and process qualification of the new facility, equipment and information systems. Reviews and approves controlled documents, including Standard Operating Procedures, Validation Protocols, Validation Reports, Electronic Master Batch Records etc. Provides quality oversight for quality records including deviations/CAPAs, technical change controls and work orders assuring adherence to procedural requirements and confirming assessments and evaluations of different partners are complete and accurate Ensures that all activities & related documentation for facilities, equipment, materials and processes align with applicable regulations and Amgen requirements relating to Good Manufacturing Practices, Good Documentation Practices, Safety, and Controls. Own quality related Standard Operating Procedures, Work Instructions, Forms and Methods Provides quality oversight for manufacturing and responsible for batch disposition. Support and represent Quality during audits and inspections; may directly interact with regulatory agencies during on-site inspections. Support Lean Transformation and Operational Excellence initiatives Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. jobTitle: Rare Disease Key Account Director - Mid-Atlantic
jobDescription: The Rare Disease Key Account Director (RD KAD) is responsible for leading and coaching the Rare Disease Key Account Management Regional team, with a key focus on executing a patient first approach while impacting aligned market and brand goals. As the most senior Account Management role in the field, the Rare Disease KAD will impact goal progression by utilizing local knowledge and leadership skills to coach their RD KAM direct reports to develop and execute against strategic account plans that are mutually aligned to both Amgen and the customer. RD KADs will also compliantly provide and coach their RD KAMs to provide cross-functional leadership with account and customer information to enable collaborative communications that support aligned business imperatives across the appropriate roles aligned to the Integrated Account Team model. Job Responsibilities Provide the day-to-day leadership and management of Account Management Colleagues, including alignment to brand / market goals, KPIs and performance management Take full accountability for all personnel issues and act as the final point of escalation for all Account Management roles in their region, coordinating with the National Integrated Account Team lead Lead the consistent execution Business and Account priorities within the region with a focus on long and short-term mutual value opportunities identified with Prioritized Accounts and aligned with market and brand goals, as well as company and Rare Disease Strategic Customer Group Vision Lead Account Management roles to execute while leveraging the IAT model and Account / Customer engagement strategies to drive business performance Deliver documented capabilities-based coaching to support skill excellence and optimal development across the RD KAM team Manage the various budgets for the assigned region Maintain required technical, environmental and Account Management expertise in order to respond accurately and compliantly to all questions regarding products, policies and business-related issues from customers and Account Management Colleagues Recruit and select candidates for Account Management positions in compliance with Amgen requirements, utilizing approved hiring materials Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree & 2 years of collective account management experience, sales, & commercial experience OR Master’s degree & 6 years of collective account management experience, sales, & commercial experience OR Bachelor’s degree & 8 years of collective account management experience, sales, & commercial experience OR Associate degree & 10 years of collective account management experience, sales, & commercial experience Preferred Qualifications: Advanced degree, e.g. MBA, MPH Strong leadership skills, with experience leading cross-functional teams; direct experience building and leading new sales, account management and marketing teams Managerial experience directly managing people such as or District Manager experience and/or leadership experience leading cross functional teams, projects, programs or directing the allocation of resources Significant prior Account Management or Payer experience preferred Proven track record of access creation in managed markets Experience negotiating contracts with regional payers & IDNs Knowledge of the US reimbursement environment and state level policies within a regional geography Prior experience developing and implementing strategic initiatives with cross-functional Business Units that successfully enable access and demand creation in key accounts Prior experience working with Medical Science Liaisons (MSLs), Health Outcomes & Pharmacoeconomics (HOPE) MSLs/Field HEOR Managers, Medical platform or policy development and opinion leader engagement Account Management, Reimbursement, Quality, and Value experience Strong communication and presentation skills including experience with executive-level audiences Excellent negotiation skills Strong analytical skills/business acumen Demonstrated ability to take initiative, impart energy and enthusiasm, and work in teams Join Us If you're seeking a career where you can truly make a difference in the lives of others, a career where you can work at the absolute forefront of biotechnology with the top minds in the field, you'll find it at Amgen. jobTitle: Rare Disease Key Account Manager - Denver
jobDescription: Amgen is seeking a Rare Disease Key Account Manager (RD KAM) to execute commercial activities for the assigned geography and establish relationships with customers to drive demand for Tavneos (avacopan) in approved patients. Tavneos is indicated as an adjunctive treatment of adult patients with severe active anti-neutrophil cytoplasmic autoantibody (ANCA)-associated vasculitis (granulomatosis with polyangiitis [GPA] and microscopic polyangiitis [MPA]) in combination with standard therapy including glucocorticoids. This role is field based and will require gaining access to customers in a clinic OR hospital setting while also maximizing your ability to engage through digital channels. The RD KAM will be responsible for product performance at a territory level, expected to be a disease category expert, a product champion, provide account management support, and exhibit business knowledge of the local landscape to assess key stakeholders plus future trends within the marketplace. Job Responsibilities Proficiency in both live and virtual customer engagements Develop a comprehensive and effective territory business plan aimed at achieving and exceeding annual goals established by commercial leadership Ability to engage all stakeholders around patient ecosystem – caregivers, HCPs, case managers, nurses, infusion centers, etc. in multiple settings of care-Hospital, Clinic, etc. Must be able to effectively collaborate across all corporate functions-MSLs, TLLs, Nurse Coordinators, Field Access Team, supporting sales teams, etc. Key account strategic lead; Develops and executes innovative market strategies to reach difficult to access health care providers and accounts in a compliant manner Channel patients to treatment: Creating referral networks to both existing centers of excellence, as well as, setting up new treatment CoEs. Building long-term relationships across multiple stakeholders and senior decision-makers, both inside and outside of Amgen, and sustaining extensive and rich networks to advance business partnerships and deep customer relationships. Developing, deploying, and enhancing deep and broad requisite knowledge of the U.S., regional healthcare ecosystem, Amgen, competitor portfolios and customers (provider organization and payer), in order to build powerful, evidence-based solutions that create value for Amgen, potential customers and partners in the healthcare market. Ability to create broader disease awareness beyond the expert (i.e., with patients, GPs) Identifies drivers/barriers and coordinates pull-through initiatives across field teams Provides actionable field intelligence and recommendations to Amgen home office Partners closely with Market Access Team Account Executives in shared accounts. Promote Tavneos within approved labeling in a comprehensive, fair and ethical manner that is consistent with industry specific and corporate legal and regulatory guidelines Develop strong customer relationships by better understanding the customer’s needs Serves as a resource/consultant to customers and staff regarding payer policies and processes (eligibility and benefit verification, prior-authorization and appeals/denials) Maximizes use of marketing resources to maintain and develop customer relationships for the purpose of growing the customers’ confidence to prescribe Amgen medications for appropriate patients Communicates territory activity in an accurate and timely manner as directed by management Provides feedback to sales and commercial leadership, marketing colleagues, and other internal departments about changing environment and other internal departments Successfully completes all training classes Completes administrative duties in an accurate and timely fashion Manages efforts within assigned promotional budget Attends medical congresses and society meetings as needed Ensures timely access for patients through patient services and savings programs Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree & 2 years of collective account management experience, sales, & commercial experience OR Master’s degree & 6 years of collective account management experience, sales, & commercial experience OR Bachelor’s degree & 8 years of collective account management experience, sales, & commercial experience OR Associate degree & 10 years of collective account management experience, sales, & commercial experience Preferred Qualifications: Advanced degree, e.g. MBA, MPH Prior Account Management or Payer experience preferred Managerial experience directly managing people such as or District Manager experience and/or leadership experience leading cross functional teams, projects, programs or directing the allocation of resources Proven track record of access creation in managed markets Experience negotiating contracts with regional payers & IDNs Working knowledge of geography including existing relationships with key customers Prior experience developing and implementing strategic initiatives with cross-functional Business Units that successfully enable access and demand creation in key accounts Prior experience working with Navigating IDNs / Centers of Excellence, Professional Organizations, Foundations/Patient Organizations) Manage OL Speaker bureau relationships including supporting speaker training, compliance, and product theater speaker management Manage regional speaker bureau, including providing speaker recommendations Identify, map, and manage relationships with key national Vasculitis Centers and other large treatment facilities (includes the detailed mapping of referral patterns, key relationships, and influencers) Coordinate and leading all one-to-one exchanges between brand team and KOLs across key initiatives and events Congress / Key Event Management Attend and manage brand activity at key regional and national inflammation conferences (may encompass Rheumatology, Nephrology, Pulmonology), board strategy, content, advisory recommendations, and attend advisory boards as appropriate Provide insights summary from key congresses to the marketing team Drive key initiatives Leading peer-to-peer marketing initiatives such as advisory boards, speaker bureau & product theater content development Shaping team content development needs include disease state Participate in strategic discussions with brand team Additional Information: Business travel, by air or car, is regularly required (50% - 65%) Willingness to work evenings and select weekends is required Located near a hub Excellent written and verbal communication skills including confident executive presence Ability to build productive partnerships and collaborate effectively in a matrix organization. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role. Risk Management Manager Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will work in Global Strategic Sourcing and in collaboration with the Global Environment Sustainability (ES) Team in Operations. The role will be both internal and external facing and will be responsible for Supplier Sustainability in conjunction with Global Strategic Sourcing and appropriate business partners. This highly visible role will be responsible for partnering with collaborators at all levels (e.g., Global Commercial Organization, Digital Technology Innovation, Operations, R&D and Corporate Functions). As part of Amgen’s newly approved Science-Based Target Initiative (SBTi) Targets, the Supplier Sustainability Manager will also be responsible for implementing our Supplier Engagement efforts that aim to drive down Amgen’s Scope 3 carbon emissions by asking our suppliers to set science-based targets by 2027. The Supplier Sustainability Manager will develop and implement supplier engagement strategy to meet the SBTi Scope 3 commitment. The role will ensure that the company’s environmental sustainability efforts enhance business performance, supporting the long-term interests of the company through our suppliers as an extension of our business. The Supplier Sustainability Manager must be an innovative problem solver who can constructively challenge conventional ways of thinking and introduce new insights. Support the development and implementation of the corporate wide Supplier Sustainability strategy, program, policies and procedures. Lead Supplier Engagement efforts in relation to implementing Scope 3 strategy and Science Based Targets Initiative. Lead and manage company initiatives related to Supplier Sustainability and serve as the Subject Matter Expert (SME). Assist the leadership team in defining program goals, metrics, and a long-range plan; present and report progress to all levels of management. Develop, implement, and monitor appropriate program governance; communicate and partner effectively with appropriate internal teams based on benchmarking and industry standard processes. Drive engagement and relationships with key external organizations: e.g., Pharmaceutical Supply Chain Initiative (PSCI), Schneider, EcoVadis etc. Manage and improve Supplier Sustainability content and communication channels, including internal and external webpages. Manage and improve Conflict Mineral process and reporting. Responsible for training/awareness of Sourcing professionals, appropriate business partners and suppliers, as appropriate. Maintain process integrity, adherence to internal policies and controls, and ensure compliance to all applicable laws and regulations related to Supplier Sustainability. Works closely with our suppliers’ executive management and our internal executives Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. If you have a passion for talent development and want to be a part of Amgen’s mission to serve patients – every patient every time – then check out this exciting new opportunity. Be part of the Amgen Advanced Assembly and Final Product Operation, a new facility focused on medical device assembly and packaging of injectable medicines. When completed, the Advanced Assembly and Final Product Operation facility will not only feature the best in-class assembly and packaging technologies with embedded industry 4.0 capabilities, but it will also integrate sustainability innovations to reduce carbon and waste, as part of Amgen’s plan to be a carbon-neutral company by 2027. SAP/EWM Superuser Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this role, you will be part of the Supply Chain team and report directly to the site Senior Warehouse Operations Head, and you will participate in multiple cross-functional initiatives for Amgen Ohio (AOH) leading to the improvement of the overall planning process using enterprise-wide programs. In addition, you will coordinate, drive, and/or support the identification and implementation of related Warehouse systems and processes. The Manager, Supply Chain Warehouse Systems will be the systems super user or Amgen’s warehouse systems and sub-systems. As the expert you will develop and provide education and training to all impacted departments. This role is also responsible for identifying, establishing, modeling, and tracking key performance measures that will insure the achievement of Best Practices across Amgen sites. The Manager Supply Chain Warehouse Systems will serve as a key representative on various cross-functional task forces and teams to ensure that consistent and well-integrated practices are developed throughout the organization. This role requires consistent and strong communication within Supply Chain and throughout all of Amgen and across all sites and may directly or indirectly coordinate the activities of other staff members or outside consultants. Responsibilities may include: Represent AOH Supply Chain in large, interdisciplinary system-related projects/initiatives and possibly lead work streams within such projects (e.g., EWM implementation, technical upgrades). Detailed assessment of pros and cons related to current Supply Chain processes and the related system support. Providing guidance on to-be system and process design. Translating of business requirements into IS system design specifications. Communicating with all parties involved in or impacted by the project. Guiding project champion and sponsor toward timely decisions. Performing risk and issue management. Change control record if applicable. Involvement in test process for new functionality. Training of end-users and/or trainers on new functionality. Serve as partner concern point for Key Users in case of system related issues that require liaising with IS staff to resolve. Identify and lead Operational Excellence initiatives in Supply Chain processes, including data analysis and case development. Support SAP releases: planning, prioritization, requirements gathering Support Supply Chain management by data analysis and providing input for Business Reviews / KPIs Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. Knowledge of staff relations with the ability to coach, mentor and counsel staff when needed. Good organizational and communications skills Excellent written and verbal communication. Continuous improvement mentality. Experience working in a global environment, ability to collaborate /communicate effectively at different management levels. Proficient user of software applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Smart sheet, Skype, Tableau). Leadership and team building skills. jobTitle: SAP MDM Solution Architect - US Remote
jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. SAP MDM Architect Description: Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will enable the transformation of SAP MDM technology stack and collaborate with the S4/HANA upgrade program. You will lead the incremental product delivery of SAP MDM technologies and adoption of data management capabilities. Responsibilities Configuration of MDM platform to enable MDG Business Partner (Customer and Supplier), MDG Finance or MDG Material. Maintenance of SAP MDM data dictionary and Application Programming Interface (API). In collaboration with business owners, implement data strategy, policies and controls to ensure the SAP master data is accurate, complete, secure, and reliable Assist in data management and data quality to ensure data integrity within SAP and across the enterprise is consistent and meets stated business rules and requirements Analyze data and identify business processes impacting or impacted by data quality Establish data governance and maintenance processes for master data with focus on quality and speed. Collaborate closely with the Enterprise-MDM Product Team to ensure complete end to end use cases related to MDM are considered and reviewed Collaborate with multi-functional teams to unlock new data elements that support business processes enhancements and strategic decision making Basic Qualifications Doctorate degree OR Master’s degree and 3 years of Information Systems experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of Information Systems experience OR Associate degree and 10 years of Information Systems experience Or High school diploma / GED and 12 years of Information Systems experience Preferred Qualifications: MDM experience (preferable MDG or Informatica MDM) with a solid understanding of Master Data integration points Understanding of functional and technical objects in SAP Master Data Experience with SAP Data Architecture, and SAP MDG/MDM Experience implementing MDG master data domains Experience in evaluating all business requirements and author master data solutions that provide an integrated approach on SAP Business Transformation programs Experience in MDG UI Modelling, Process Modelling, and Governance S4 HANA experience Experience working in SAFe development environment Amgen is committed to unlocking the potential of biology for patients suffering from serious illnesses by discovering, developing, manufacturing and delivering innovative human therapeutics. Amgen focuses on areas of high unmet medical need and uses its expertise to strive for solutions that improve health outcomes and dramatically improve people’s lives. A biotechnology pioneer since 1980, Amgen has grown to be one of the world’s leading independent biotechnology companies, has reached millions of patients around the world and is developing a pipeline of medicines with breakaway potential. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Scientific Director - Project Toxicologist (US-Remote) Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role, you will be the key scientific interface between TS&BA and your project teams from discovery through post-marketing. The Translational Safety & Bioanalytical Sciences (TS&BA) function at Amgen is seeking a Scientific Director to serve as a Project Toxicologist and a Subject Matter Expert, reporting to the Executive Director US Head Translational Safety and Bioanalytical Sciences Portfolio Scientific Leadership. You will develop and implement a fit-for-purpose nonclinical safety strategy based on a strong scientific foundation, flexibly evolve the strategy in response to team goals and emerging data, and lead multidisciplinary TS&BA teams. As PTR, you will partner with Project Teams developing therapeutics leveraging multiple modalities (including biotherapeutics, small molecules and RNA therapies) to treat diseases in inflammation, oncology and/or cardiometabolic diseases. PTRs also develop subject matter expertise related to a specific modality, therapeutic area, safety concern or related to therapeutic or process development etc. The successful candidate will have: A proven sustained track record of scientific leadership in late-stage drug development (including BLA/NDA filings) as well as in preclinical development with a strong understanding of cross-functional needs and the ability to develop integrated plans to enable successful development of a therapeutic. Experience with matrix management, and demonstrated effective mentoring skills. Represent Amgen's nonclinical safety issues at national and international regulatory meetings and participate in external industry initiatives to improve drug safety assessment paradigms. Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The scientific professional we seek is innovative with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications Doctorate degree in Toxicology or a related scientific field, and 4 years of experience OR Master’s degree and 7 years of experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 9 years of experience Excellent and professional communicator; proven ability to influence a broad spectrum of partners toward achieving business goals Preferred Qualifications A minimum of 10 years of drug development experience, at all stages of development but must include late-stage assets and interactions with global regulatory agencies for IND/CTA and NDA/BLA filings Experienced scientific leader with direct management experience End-to-end small and large molecule safety assessment experience across multiple therapeutic areas and modalities including small molecules, antibody drug conjugates and T-cell engagers Expertise in developing nonclinical safety strategies for new modalities or to address unique safety concerns and resolving safety-related issues External visibility as a toxicology expert as demonstrated by a strong external presentation and publication record Multi-disciplinary team leadership especially across R&D functions Diplomate of the American Board of Toxicology Thrive What You Can Expect Of Us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. jobTitle: Scientist - Bioanalytical Sciences & Translational Safety (Ligand Binding Assays)
jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role. Scientist - Bioanalytical Sciences & Translational Safety (Ligand Binding Assays) Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital Scientist role, you will contribute to developing, validating and implementing robust bioanalytical methods for the measurement of large molecule biotherapeutics. These methods will be required to support both nonclinical and clinical studies. Amgen is seeking a Scientist at our Thousand Oaks, CA location. The department of Translational Safety & Bioanalytical Sciences (TS&BA) within Amgen is dedicated to the discovery and development of novel effective, safe medicines. TS&BA Scientists work closely in partnership with other teams, such as protein therapeutics, medicinal chemistry, pharmacology, toxicology, pharmaceutical sciences and clinical pharmacology and regulatory to design promising clinical therapeutic candidates, conduct preclinical development studies, support clinical evaluation and contribute to regulatory submissions. The primary responsibilities will include: To design, develop and validate robust ligand binding assays (ELISA, MSD, Gyrolab platforms) for the measurement of large molecule, and oligo/siRNA, therapeutic levels in biological matrices. The bioanalytical methods are used to support regulated non-clinical and clinical studies. Manage the method lifecycle by working with external service providers, performing troubleshooting, data review and engaging in continuous improvement efforts. Direct the conduct of sample analysis, adherence to timelines, author reports and review data for technical content and regulatory compliance. Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The scientific professional we seek is innovative and motivated with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree OR Master’s degree and 4 years of pharmaceutical-biotechnology and/or CRO industry, and/or Scientific experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 6 years of pharmaceutical-biotechnology and/or CRO industry and/or Scientific experience Preferred Qualifications: 2 or more years of relevant laboratory GxP experience. Analytical skills in applying a broad range of technologies used for ligand binding assays and the detection of large molecule in complex biological matrices (MSD, Gyrolab, ELISA, Automated liquid handlers, etc.) Experience in any of the following areas: immunology, immunochemistry, biochemistry, cell biology or equivalent. Working knowledge of the regulatory (GxP) requirements for bioanalysis in drug development and possess critical thinking skills with an ability to integrate data and information to solve complex problems to advance drug discovery and development programs. Experience communicating complex ideas to audiences with varying degrees of knowledge. Demonstrated ability to drive scientific excellence and innovation. Demonstrated experience of contributing as lead author on external peer review publications. Ability to work in a team environment with excellent verbal and written communication skills. HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role. Scientist - Cardiometabolic Disorders Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role, you will drive discovery efforts to identify how Amgen’s innovative biological modalities can improve the lives of patients who suffer from heart failure and related co-morbidities. Amgen's Department of Cardiometabolic Disorders in Thousand Oaks, CA is seeking a dedicated Scientist to contribute to our research efforts in developing new treatments for cardiometabolic diseases. This role requires a commitment to develop a deep understanding of the pathogenic mechanisms that underlie HFrEF or HFpEF. Key Responsibilities: Identification of new therapeutic targets and preclinical validation. The candidate is encouraged to be continuously aware of scientific developments in cardiometabolic disease, with emphasis on HFrEF and HFpEF. Collaborate with a team of experienced cardiometabolic scientists. Present research discoveries to colleagues and scientific meetings (oral/poster presentations and publish scientific papers in peer-reviewed journals). Lead ethical high quality research experiments in accordance with regulatory agencies and compliance guidelines. Facilitate scientific collaborations with academic centers and partners. Design/assist in the development of medium to low throughput assays used to support both small and large molecule drug development programs. Design and implement in vitro, ex vivo, and in vivo cardiovascular studies. It is essential that the candidate is familiar with the pathophysiology of heart diseases. Independently design, perform, and analyze laboratory experiments, including troubleshooting, optimization of assays, data collection, interpretation, biostatistical analysis, and presentation. Participation on cross-functional drug development teams as a key intellectual and technical contributor. Function optimally in a team based/collaborative environment as part of a highly integrated team, possess excellent organizational, verbal, and written communication skills and demonstrate ability to produce reliable and reproducible results. Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The scientific professional we seek is innovative and motivated with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree OR Master’s degree and 4 years of relevant scientific experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 6 years of relevant scientific experience Willing to work in a team environment and possess good laboratory documentation skills. Preferred Qualifications: Postdoctoral research experience. 2 or more years of experience in cardiovascular research in industry or academic settings. Experience performing echocardiography and analyzing cardiac function in rodent models of heart disease. In vivo experience with rodent models of heart failure. Ability to perform in vitro assays to dissect the mechanism of action of therapeutic molecules in cardiac myocytes, fibroblasts, adipocytes, endothelial cells, and other relevant cardiac cell types. In vitro experience with cultured cell lines, siRNA transfection techniques, western blotting, quantitative PCR techniques, RNA/DNA isolation, laboratory automation, high content imaging technology, and fluorescence microscopy. In this vital role, you will design and perform biochemical and cell-based assays to support biological discovery and characterization of therapeutic candidates. The Cardiometabolic Disorders department at Amgen in South San Francisco is seeking a highly motivated Scientist to join our drug discovery research team at our new campus. This team member will play a pivotal role on a team identifying targets and therapeutic molecules aimed at creating the next generation of cardiovascular medicines. The successful candidate will join a multidisciplinary cross-functional team, collaborate with scientists of diverse expertise, and contribute to projects at both the early and late stages of drug discovery. The science-based, patient-first environment at Amgen provides the platform for the successful candidate to reach their full potential and apply scientific expertise to benefit patients with grievous diseases in need of innovative medicines. Key responsibilities will include: Advancing Amgen’s scientific objectives through laboratory-based experimentation and collaboration Design, perform, and optimize assays for biological characterization and candidate screening Independently perform data analysis and interpretation Communicate scientific results through written and oral presentations Documentation of work through written protocols and electronic notebook Advise colleagues and supervisors in areas of expertise Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role. Scientist - Immuno-Oncology Research Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will join and lead discovery research projects in Immuno-Oncology group. Amgen is seeking a researcher who is enthusiastic about exploring the new area of research, innovating new technology, being an integral member of our discovery research team, collaborating with scientists in multi-functional areas at Amgen, and contributing to Amgen’s drug development pipeline and to publications and patents. Position Responsibilities Enable the discovery, validation, and mechanistic understanding of novel cancer immunotherapies for the treatment of cancer. Lead Immuno-oncology discovery research projects (as a biology therapeutic area lead) and develop novel immuno-oncology therapeutics. Independently craft experimental strategy, complete laboratory-based experiments, analyze data, and communicate and present data in team and departmental meetings. Stay up to date with relevant literature and incorporate recent advances in relevant fields into experimental design and implementation. Publish experimental findings in credible journals and present at leading scientific conferences. Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The qualified professional we seek is a Scientist with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications Doctorate degree OR Master’s degree and 4 years of immunology, cancer biology, and molecular biology experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 6 years of immunology, cancer biology, and molecular biology experience Preferred Qualifications Doctorate degree with postdoctoral training and research experience in the field of immunology, cancer biology, and molecular biology. Demonstrate expertise in T cell biology, immunology and/or cancer biology as evidenced with publication in high impact journals and/or patents. Demonstrate a track record (publication) of independent and creative thinking, designing (in vitro and in vivo biological studies) and troubleshooting to tackle problems. Demonstrate technical expertise in one or more of following areas: multi-color flow cytometry, primary immune cell culture, complex cell-based assays, mRNA transfer/viral transduction to T cells, and synthetic biology/genetic engineering of T cells (highly preferred). Experience with preclinical animal models of various tumor types, crafting efficacy/PD (pharmacodynamics), and/or adoptive T cell transfer is preferred. Direct experience with T cell-targeted therapy development (e.g. CAR-T, TCR-T, bispecific antibodies, targeted protein degradation, or small molecules) is a plus. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Prioritize and implement next steps with efficient time management. Thrive Some of the vast rewards of working here As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. Career Category Clinical Job Description HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us. SDTM Consultant, Senior Manager Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will be accountable and responsible for defining Study Data Tabulation Model strategy for Amgen Global Statistical Programming Department by providing technical expertise and programming leadership to ensure high quality Study Data Tabulation Model project delivery. Overview: Define Study Data Tabulation Model strategy for Global Statistical Programming Provide Study Data Tabulation Model technical expertise to ensure project deliveries meet regulatory standards for Study Data Tabulation Model Offer Study Data Tabulation Model advice and consultation to Global Statistical Programming and cross-functional teams Responsibilities: Review of study start up documents such as SAP, CRFs and programming specifications as they pertain to Study Data Tabulation Model study-specific requirements Assess Study Data Tabulation Model datasets and related documents for analysis and regulatory submissions Provide Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium expertise and guidance to Global Statistical Programming teams and cross functional partners Offer Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium expertise to teams that develop compliant and consistent Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Study Data Tabulation Model datasets, define file and reviewer’s guides on time with high quality Promote, adhere to and comment on global and functional standards, processes and methods across all products and studies Evaluate the regular run and disposition of published conformance checks for all snapshots and Study Data Tabulation Model audit for all pivotal snapshots Collaborate with functional service provider (FSP) staff members Participate in the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Community Assist in study and system audits by internal and external bodies and provide guidance for responses to audit questions and findings. Overview: Define Study Data Tabulation Model strategy for Global Statistical Programming Provide Study Data Tabulation Model technical expertise to ensure project deliveries meet regulatory standards for Study Data Tabulation Model Offer Study Data Tabulation Model advice and consultation to Global Statistical Programming and cross-functional teams Responsibilities: Review of study start up documents such as SAP, CRFs and programming specifications as they pertain to Study Data Tabulation Model study-specific requirements Assess Study Data Tabulation Model datasets and related documents for analysis and regulatory submissions Provide Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium expertise and guidance to Global Statistical Programming teams and cross functional partners Offer Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium expertise to teams that develop compliant and consistent Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Study Data Tabulation Model datasets, define file and reviewer’s guides on time with high quality Promote, adhere to and comment on global and functional standards, processes and methods across all products and studies Evaluate the regular run and disposition of published conformance checks for all snapshots and Study Data Tabulation Model audit for all pivotal snapshots Collaborate with functional service provider (FSP) staff members Participate in the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Community Assist in study and system audits by internal and external bodies and provide guidance for responses to audit questions and findings. Mentor junior consultants and offer guidance to Global Statistical Programming staff Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The strong professional we seek is an expert with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree and 2 years of relevant experience OR Master’s degree and 6 years of relevant experience experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 8 years of relevant experience Preferred Qualifications: MSc or higher degree in quantitative or scientific subjects At least 8 years of relevant statistical programming experience, or equivalent clinical data standards experience, in a clinical development environment Thorough understanding of therapeutic areas (e.g. oncology, respiratory) standards Prior leadership and/or 2 years management experience with projects and people Working experience with external Functional Service Providers Experience working effectively in a globally dispersed team environment with cross-cultural partners In-depth experience creating/working with Study Data Tabulation Model annotations on blank CRF.pdf, reviewers guide, published conformance checks and controlled terminology Comprehensive experience in project management to enable deliverables to be done on time and to a high quality Experience with clinical trial data Thrive What You Can Expect Of Us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, so we work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us. SDTM Consultant, Senior Manager Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will be accountable and responsible for defining Study Data Tabulation Model strategy for Amgen Global Statistical Programming Department by providing technical expertise and programming leadership to ensure high quality Study Data Tabulation Model project delivery. Overview: Define Study Data Tabulation Model strategy for Global Statistical Programming Provide Study Data Tabulation Model technical expertise to ensure project deliveries meet regulatory standards for Study Data Tabulation Model Offer Study Data Tabulation Model advice and consultation to Global Statistical Programming and cross-functional teams Responsibilities: Review of study start up documents such as SAP, CRFs and programming specifications as they pertain to Study Data Tabulation Model study-specific requirements Assess Study Data Tabulation Model datasets and related documents for analysis and regulatory submissions Provide Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium expertise and guidance to Global Statistical Programming teams and cross functional partners Offer Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium expertise to teams that develop compliant and consistent Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Study Data Tabulation Model datasets, define file and reviewer’s guides on time with high quality Promote, adhere to and comment on global and functional standards, processes and methods across all products and studies Evaluate the regular run and disposition of published conformance checks for all snapshots and Study Data Tabulation Model audit for all pivotal snapshots Collaborate with functional service provider (FSP) staff members Participate in the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Community Assist in study and system audits by internal and external bodies and provide guidance for responses to audit questions and findings. Mentor junior consultants and offer guidance to Global Statistical Programming staff Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The strong professional we seek is an expert with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree and 2 years of relevant experience OR Master’s degree and 6 years of relevant experience experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 8 years of relevant experience Preferred Qualifications: MSc or higher degree in quantitative or scientific subjects At least 8 years of relevant statistical programming experience, or equivalent clinical data standards experience, in a clinical development environment Thorough understanding of therapeutic areas (e.g. oncology, respiratory) standards Prior leadership and/or 2 years management experience with projects and people Working experience with external Functional Service Providers Experience working effectively in a globally dispersed team environment with cross-cultural partners In-depth experience creating/working with Study Data Tabulation Model annotations on blank CRF.pdf, reviewers guide, published conformance checks and controlled terminology Comprehensive experience in project management to enable deliverables to be done on time and to a high quality Experience with clinical trial data Thrive What You Can Expect Of Us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, so we work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. Vast opportunities to learn and move up and across our global organization Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where teammates are empowered to bring ideas to the table and act Generous Total Rewards Plan comprising health, finance and wealth, work/life balance, and career benefits Apply now for a career that defies imagination In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us. careers.amgen.com

Overview: Define Study Data Tabulation Model strategy for Global Statistical Programming Provide Study Data Tabulation Model technical expertise to ensure project deliveries meet regulatory standards for Study Data Tabulation Model Offer Study Data Tabulation Model advice and consultation to Global Statistical Programming and cross-functional teams Responsibilities: Review of study start up documents such as SAP, CRFs and programming specifications as they pertain to Study Data Tabulation Model study-specific requirements Assess Study Data Tabulation Model datasets and related documents for analysis and regulatory submissions Provide Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium expertise and guidance to Global Statistical Programming teams and cross functional partners Offer Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium expertise to teams that develop compliant and consistent Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Study Data Tabulation Model datasets, define file and reviewer’s guides on time with high quality Promote, adhere to and comment on global and functional standards, processes and methods across all products and studies Evaluate the regular run and disposition of published conformance checks for all snapshots and Study Data Tabulation Model audit for all pivotal snapshots Collaborate with functional service provider (FSP) staff members Participate in the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Community Assist in study and system audits by internal and external bodies and provide guidance for responses to audit questions and findings. Mentor junior consultants and offer guidance to Global Statistical Programming staff Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The strong professional we seek is an expert with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree and 2 years of relevant experience OR Master’s degree and 6 years of relevant experience experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 8 years of relevant experience Preferred Qualifications: MSc or higher degree in quantitative or scientific subjects At least 8 years of relevant statistical programming experience, or equivalent clinical data standards experience, in a clinical development environment Thorough understanding of therapeutic areas (e.g. oncology, respiratory) standards Prior leadership and/or 2 years management experience with projects and people Working experience with external Functional Service Providers Experience working effectively in a globally dispersed team environment with cross-cultural partners In-depth experience creating/working with Study Data Tabulation Model annotations on blank CRF.pdf, reviewers guide, published conformance checks and controlled terminology Comprehensive experience in project management to enable deliverables to be done on time and to a high quality Experience with clinical trial data Thrive What You Can Expect Of Us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, so we work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies.
