jobTitle: Supply Chain Sr. Manager - US Regional Operations Lead (ROL)
jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role. Supply Chain Sr. Manager - US Regional Operations Lead (ROL) Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this pivotal role, you will be the primary point of contact for US finished product between supply chain, manufacturing, and the commercial organization. The ROL is accountable for implementing regional launches, lifecycle management, supply fulfillment, and inventory management of U.S. finished goods. The role is also responsible for the delivery of Integrated Business Planning (IBP) for the assigned product for U.S. region, which includes demand insight analysis and consensus demand planning with cross-functional partners in marketing, forecasting, and finance as well as tracking of key performance metrics. Responsibilities: Serving as the Operations champion for US commercialization of assigned product(s) Lead Regional Operations Team Meetings to manage launch and product life-cycle deliverables Regularly and clearly communicate region’s decision, risks, and project timeline to the PDT and appropriate Operations management/governance. Participate in Operational Excellence opportunities and drive regional improvements and cost savings by demonstrating Network Knowledge sharing forums Develop regional network supply strategy with Global Supply Chain and Sites Own uninterrupted patient supply, supply risk assessment and mitigation plan for assigned products Support Demand and Supply Alignment activities for assigned product/market Represent the supply network and work with region’s cross functional team (Commercial, Finance, Regulatory Affairs, Quality) to develop compliant product supply strategy for the planning horizon Represent the region commercial needs and work with supply network to resolve supply conflicts Critically review aggregate regional unit forecasts and make recommendations to commercial for changes to be part of the demand consensus meetings Facilitate the monthly IBP meetings between commercial, manufacturing and other functional representatives as needed to drive a strategic plan to drive supply strategies, minimize inventory obsolesces and ensure supply. Some international and domestic travel possible but less than 15%. Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree and 2 years of experience OR Master’s degree and 4 years of experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 6 years of experience OR Associate’s degree and 10 years of experience OR High school diploma / GED and 12 years of experience Preferred Qualifications: Master’s Degree in Business, Supply Chain, or engineering 10+ years of experience in pharmaceutical product commercialization, life cycle management, Planning, Regulatory Affairs, Clinical Development and/or international supply chain operations. knowledge of Rapid Response system, Anaplan system, and SAP/ERP systems APICS or equivalent certification Understanding of demand forecasting principles and practices. Understanding of variation management, jurisdictional control procedures, and product life cycle Mgmt. Understanding of new product launch or LCM launch readiness such as Master data, artwork/layout, and other launch preparation. Experience in project management across departments and geographies Ability to recognize strategic implications of complex product development activities and manage them cross-functionally Quick process understanding, insight and visualizing Strong analytical skills (incl. MS Excel, MS Powerpoint) and ability to summarize findings Independent self-starter, able to work autonomously, under pressure and in teams Motivated, persistent, eager to optimize, drive for excellence Problem solver with high sense of responsibility to achieve results Strong communication and presentation skills (verbal & written) GMP knowledge and understanding of pharmaceutical regulations Thrive Some of the vast rewards of working here As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Synthetics Principal Product Quality Leader Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will provide technical expertise and product leadership to the Product Quality organization. As a product expert in Quality, the Principal Product Quality Leader has responsibility for working with Product Quality Leaders, International Quality, Quality Control, Regulatory, Process Development, Quality Assurance and other departments on projects, issue resolution, and investigations associated with product manufacturing, in-process controls, analytical methods, specifications, stability, reference standards, importation testing, change control, regulatory submissions and inspections. Amgen offers the opportunity to be at the interface between research, global development and manufacturing to ensure that our molecules become medicines. Many of the technologies we’re employing are not only new to Amgen but are new to the industry as a whole. Help us to pave new roads for helping patients. This role will support one or more of Amgen's synthetic products. The individual will provide technical expertise and project support to the relevant Product Quality Team(s) to develop, implement, and manage strategy for Quality to meet the Product Development Team goals. The individual will be directly responsible for Product Quality related tasks including ownership, authoring and review of GMP and regulatory documents, execution of transactions in relevant GMP systems (change control, data systems, etc), and product data management, including comparability assessments, annual product reviews, and product quality risk assessments. In addition, the candidate will be expected to play a role in supporting Product Quality initiatives intended to ensure the overall product health. This role is preferred to be on site in either Thousand Oaks, CA or Cambridge, MA, remote will be considered if applicable. Key Responsibilities include: Provide effective, cross-functional quality leadership, and support PDT deliverables for late phase and commercial synthetic programs, including actions required for the PQT, APR, specification, comparability, and stability programs; site and method transfers; product quality impact statements for NCs; and PQ owned regulatory filing sections and RTQs Support science and risk-based evaluation of complex process and product quality data, including ability to develop patient-oriented strategies that account for business needs and/or provide novel solutions to complex issues Demonstrate proficiency in oral and written communication of complex information to Product Quality leadership, peers and regulatory agencies Demonstrate proficiency in knowledge of cGMP and international regulatory expectations Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The dedicated professional we seek is a collaborative partner with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree & 2 years of Quality, Operations, Scientific, or Manufacturing experience, or Master’s degree & 6 years of Quality, Operations, Scientific, or Manufacturing experience, or Bachelor’s degree & 8 years of Quality, Operations, Scientific, or Manufacturing experience or Associate's degree and 10 years of Quality, Operations, Scientific or Manufacturing experience or High School Diploma/GED and 12 years of Quality, Operations, Scientific or Manufacturing experience Preferred Qualifications Bachelors of Science or advance degree in chemistry, biochemistry, biology, or a related pharmaceutical sciences field and experience with increasing responsibility in a quality, analytical development, process development, pharmaceutics, regulatory, or manufacturing environment 6+ years working in a regulated environment (either direct GMP or technical support) 1+ year experience with authoring or review of market applications, IND, supplements or similar regulatory documentation 1+ year experience supporting non-conformance investigations, authoring, reviewing and defending critical product impacting non-conformances Experience in Project Management in support of pharmaceutical development Understanding of synthetic pharmaceutical bulk and drug product development, manufacturing, and analytical techniques General knowledge of cGMP and US & international filing regulations, practices, and trends pertaining to the manufacture and testing of pharmaceuticals and/or biopharmaceuticals Experience working on a cross-functional team in a matrix environment Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including facilitation and presentation skills Experience with new synthetic modalities/ technologies with siRNA, mRNA, new extended release formulations, and or combination products a plus Thrive What You Can Expect Of Us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. Lead TA operations globally across all channels to help ensure an engaging experience to our stakeholders through project management efforts, process improvement exercises, and swift problem resolution Responsible for supplier, contract management and compliance Responsible for a globally consistent end-to-end process for clearance to hire, including the US and PR I9 process Develop and design end to end process for global referral program to guarantee adherence Develop and design end to end processes for job postings which adhere to local laws, globally Responsible for auditing job postings in the U.S. adhering to new pay transparency laws Develop and design end to end processes to guarantee adherence with global, regional, and local HR data privacy laws and disclosures Leads talent insight delivery to local recruitment teams, globally (i.e., using internal voice of customers and external data) Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our contributions to serve patients. Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. Amgen is seeking a Senior Manager to be part of Amgen’s global transfer pricing team. The team is part of a world class tax department that provides tax planning, transfer pricing, tax reporting, and tax audit defense for the Company. The transfer pricing team works closely with the other tax functions, the business, and the Finance, Accounting, and Treasury departments in Tampa and Amgen’s Thousand Oaks headquarters, to develop, implement, and report the Company’s transfer pricing. As a global biopharmaceutical company with over $20 billion in revenue, Amgen has a large international footprint and does business in over 75 countries. As a critical SOX-controlled process, Amgen’s transfer pricing function collaborates with the Operations, Supply Chain, and other business functions business and plays a critical role in the Company’s tax compliance and provision processes. The Senior Manager, Transfer Pricing, will be a key member of the team overseeing the Company's worldwide transfer pricing function. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: understanding Amgen’s global footprint and supply chain to evaluate and develop transfer pricing policies; performing periodic forecasts, monitoring affiliate profit levels and establishing transfer prices for intercompany transactions; collaborating with the other tax functions and the Treasury, Accounting and Finance departments to ensure accurate implementation of the Company’s transfer pricing policies; providing transfer pricing technical advice to stakeholders in Tax, Finance, and the wider business; appropriately documenting Amgen’s transfer prices and transfer pricing policies; ensuring compliance with SOX requirements; and supporting international and domestic tax planning and transfer pricing initiatives. Amgen has a large international footprint and does business in over 100 countries. As a global biopharmaceutical company with over $25 billion in revenue, the Company’s tax matters include mergers and acquisitions, collaboration and licensing transactions, research and development activities, complex supply chain and manufacturing issues, commercial operations, and financing transactions, among others. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree and 2 years tax planning experience OR Master’s degree and 4 years tax planning experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 6 years tax planning experience OR Associate’s degree and 10 years of tax planning experience OR High school diploma / GED and 12 years of tax planning experience Preferred Qualifications 10+ years of experience in transfer pricing with a Big Four Accounting firm, large law firm, and/or the tax department of a biopharmaceutical or life sciences company Strong project management skills, including experience leading transfer pricing projects Experience with transfer pricing operations, including the setting and adjusting of transfer prices Experience working with transfer pricing and tax issues common to large outbound multinational companies that own high-value intangibles and have complex supply chains Understanding of accounting for income taxes Excellent written and oral communication skills Excellent critical thinking skills Strong interpersonal skills critical to a team-oriented organization Ability to work in a fast-paced environment Amgen is committed to unlocking the potential of biology for patients suffering from serious illnesses by discovering, developing, manufacturing and delivering innovative human therapeutics. This approach begins by using tools like advanced human genetics to unravel the complexities of disease and understand the fundamentals of human biology. Amgen focuses on areas of high unmet medical need and leverages its expertise to strive for solutions that improve health outcomes and dramatically improve people’s lives. A biotechnology pioneer since 1980, Amgen has grown to be one of the world’s leading independent biotechnology companies, has reached millions of patients around the world and is developing a pipeline of medicines with breakaway potential. jobTitle: Technical Accounting Senior Manager - Thousand Oaks, CA
jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Technical Accounting Senior Manager, Thousand Oaks CA Live What You Will Do Let’s do this! Let’s change the world! In this vital accounting role you will act as a Senior Manager for Technical Accounting on our Corporate Accounting team. This Sr. Manager is a key part of the Finance organization and is responsible for ensuring GAAP and SEC reporting requirements are met for significant and/or non-routine transactions. Ideally, this Sr. Manager will work from the Thousand Oaks, CA or Tampa, FL offices. Hybrid and/or remote work may be considered in specific scenarios. Main responsibilities include supporting Global Accounting Operations, Treasury, Tax, and Financial Planning and Analysis functions by providing advice on the accounting treatment for a wide range of transaction types (e.g., revenue recognition, leases, and debt). In addition, the role would work with Amgen’s Business Development group to provide accounting support related to strategic transactions and ensure compliance with GAAP and SEC reporting requirements. Also, the Sr. Manager participates in the preparation of the company’s SEC reports (10K, 10Qs, 8-Ks, Proxy, etc.). The Sr. Manager reports to the Director, Technical Accounting, and will assist in providing thought leadership and current best practices surrounding technical accounting and external reporting issues globally. Responsibilities for the Sr. Manager include: Ensure compliance with GAAP and SEC reporting requirements Assist Business Development by providing accounting guidance and recommending deal structures on potential licensing agreements, collaborations, equity purchases, and business combinations Support Global Accounting Operations, Treasury, Tax and Financial Planning and Analysis functions by providing advice on the accounting treatment for a wide range of transaction types (e.g., revenue recognition, leases, and debt) Ensure key stakeholders (including, but not limited to, the Chief Accounting Officer, leadership within Accounting Operations, and Amgen’s independent auditors) are aware of contemplated deals and the potential impact to Amgen Collaborate with different business functions and teams to perform accounting due diligence on potential transactions Ensure optimization for all contract provisions related to ongoing accounting obligations such as reporting, royalties, audits, etcetera Account for business combinations, including the review and management of any related purchase accounting valuation activities Monitor, assess, and document the potential impact of new accounting standards and assist with setting Amgen’s global accounting policies Document conclusions on executed transactions in technical accounting memos Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The dynamic accounting professional we seek is a solid leader with deep accounting knowledge and the following qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree and 2+ years of finance or technical accounting experience, OR Master’s degree and 6+ years of finance or technical accounting experience, OR Bachelor’s degree and 8+ years of finance or technical accounting experience, OR Associate’s degree and 10+ years of finance or technical accounting experience, OR High school diploma / GED and 12 years of finance or technical accounting experience Preferred Qualifications: MBA and/or CPA preferred 4+ years of Big 4 or other large national audit firm experience in the application of US GAAP to acquisitions, valuations, partnerships, and licensing transactions; SEC expertise is also desired 2+ years of managerial experience directly leading people and/or leadership experience coordinating teams, projects, programs, and/or directing the allocation of resources Progressive accounting/finance experience, including corporate-level public global company experience Experience in the application of US GAAP to acquisitions, valuations, partnerships, and licensing transactions Diligent with a strong intuition for business and analytical skills Outgoing personality, positive attitude, and ability to expertly and optimally work with all levels of management, leadership, partners, and/or vendors Thrive What You Can Expect Of Us As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. Vast opportunities to learn and move up and across our global organization Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where teammates are empowered to bring ideas to the table and act Generous Total Rewards Plan comprising health, finance and wealth, work/life balance, and career benefits Apply now for a career that defies imagination In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. jobTitle: Undergrad Co-op - Pilot Plant - Cambridge, MA
jobDescription: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION? Do more with the knowledge you’re working hard to acquire and the passion you already have. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Through this program, you will acquire valuable hands-on skills and foundational experience needed to become the professional you are meant to be in your chosen field. We are seeking hardworking individuals to join the Pilot Plant Network as Undergrad University Co-Ops. This will be a full-time, on-site engagement. This invaluable Co-Op provides an understanding of the biopharmaceutical industry today, as well as the challenges and opportunities that will drive the development of new medicines in the future. This Co-Op will be approximately 26 weeks that includes both project- based and experiential learning. Amgen provides a state-of-the-art workspace and promotes collaboration with senior leadership through a series of formal and informal events. Co-Ops will be encouraged to spend time participating in activities and networking with staff across the organization. As an undergrad Co-Op you will apply coursework concepts to real-world situations working alongside and guided by industry professionals while gaining valuable experience working for a world-class global biomanufacturing company. You will become part of the Pilot Plant Network - Amgen’s Center of Excellence for advancing new technologies - and will be mentored by senior staff members. Live This could be your everyday Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. During this full-time, 6-month program (January – June 2023), you will have the opportunity to work closely with a multi-disciplinary team in our state-of-the-art Mammalian Cell Culture and Purification Pilot Plants. Some of the projects you may find yourself working on include: Characterization of the relationship between shear rate, cell viability, tubing ID, RPM, for various pump types (peristaltic, magnetic). This work will help to inform cell culture operations such as inoculation on what types of setups are suitable under various conditions in order to avoid deleterious effects on cell growth profiles. Qualification of alternative thermoplastic elastomers for use in single-use flowpaths. Key study parameters will include tubing spallation, compatibility with various solutions used in cell culture operations, chemical stability, leachables, and extractables. Process modeling of complex cell culture processes using multivariate process modeling software. Develop and integrate new and improved automation and equipment, such as flow sensors and pneumatic valves, to enable more robust automated cell culture perfusion. This work will include flow sensor optimization and process analytical technology proof-of-concept development and testing. Evaluating and commissioning new manufacturing technologies in support of long-term strategy Hands-on operations experience (cell culture, purification, set-up, mixing studies) Win Here’s What It Takes To Win We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The kind of individuals we seek are hands-on self-starters with these qualifications: Basic Qualifications: 18 years or older Currently enrolled in a full time Bachelor’s Degree program from an accredited college or university (with a 3.0 minimum GPA) or equivalent Completion of one year of study from an accredited college or university prior to this Co-Op commencing Enrolled in a full time Bachelor’s or Combined Bachelor's/Master's degree program following the Co-Op assignment at an accredited college or university Must not be employed at the time the Co-Op starts Preferred Qualifications: Previous Co-Op or Internship experience Junior or Senior Thrive Some of the vast rewards of working here As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, so we work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. Full support and career-development resources to expand your skills, enhance your expertise, and maximize your potential along your career journey A diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where teammates are empowered to bring ideas to the table and act Generous Total Rewards Plan—comprising health, finance and wealth, work/life balance, and career benefits—with compensation and benefits rated above 4 stars (out of 5) on Glassdoor Apply Now For a career that defies imagination If you feel like you're part of something bigger, it's because you are. Undergrad Intern – Global Business Solutions (Summer 2023) During this 10-13 week program, you will have the opportunity to partner with Amgen’s Global Business Solution leaders and experience our mission-driven culture firsthand. Each summer intern will be placed on a team and assigned a meaningful project that’s tied directly to our strategic and tactical goals. These projects give interns the opportunity to think analytically, build a strong foundation. We provide several opportunities for executive and social networking events and to participate in community volunteer projects while providing a competitive compensation package. There are four different opportunities within Amgen’s Global Business Solutions (GBS) Organization. The Global Business Solutions team enables Amgen functions to maximize value related to goods, services, people, and space. Global Strategic Sourcing (GSS) GSS is within the broader Finance and Global Business Solutions organization, provides strategic oversight and execution to manage our broad external spend. GSS utilizes a standard sourcing process. Global Learning Solutions (GLS) An internal center of experts providing effective and efficient training administration and learning solutions across Amgen. The intern will have the opportunity to provide analytics and help manage GLS’s portfolio of learning solutions. Travel, Expense, and Card (TEC) Travel, Expense, and Card manages corporate expenses related to travel & employees. This group analyzes, tracks, & audits these corporate expenses to ensure Amgen Financial Policies are upheld. People Services People services supports payroll, mobility (relocations/immigration), HR technology, and global stock plans and benefits. The intern in People Services will work across these teams that provide direct support to Amgen’s employees. Live This could be your everyday Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. During our summer program, interns experience a fast paced, hands on environment under the mentorship of an GBS Manager. We match interns to meaningful and challenging projects that deliver lasting value. Win Here’s What It Takes To Win We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. Undergrad Intern – Process Development (Summer 2023) Live This could be your everyday Operations is one of the three foundational functions at Amgen with a mission to be consistent and efficient in delivering safe and effective medicines around the world. Operations manufactures and delivers Amgen therapeutics to our patients. Made up of five functions: Global Supply Chain, Process Development, Quality, Manufacturing, and Engineering, and spread across nine sites, Operations’ aspiration is simple: Ensure patients have access to the Amgen products they need. Every patient, every time. Process development (PD) is the department within Operations that takes molecules from Research & Development and turns them into products which can be manufactured for therapeutic use. With the support of their hiring manager, the PD intern will complete a lab-based project in one of the following areas: Drug Substance Technologies, Attribute Sciences, Development Supply Chain, Drug Product Technologies, or Final Product Technologies. The intern will be responsible for rigorously conducting and documenting their experiments as well as analyzing and interpreting data into meaningful, business-influencing outcomes, and then communicating this process to their team in a clear and compelling manner. In conjunction with the project work, interns will have the opportunity for professional development through training sessions, an executive speaker series, lab and facilities tours, one-on-one mentoring, and various networking events. Interns will also be able to interact with peers at Amgen-sponsored social events. Example projects from previous internships: Drug Substance Technology – Cell culture optimization through transcriptomics, media evaluation, and single-use bioreactor modification Drug Substance Technology – Assaying cell line stability at the single-cell level using Berkeley Lights next-general nanofluidic technology Drug Product Technology – Challenging the viscosity/fill volume design space and exploring novel technology in drug product filling Drug Product Technology – Increased product stability by understanding stopper moisture impact on lyophilized products Win Here’s What It Takes To Win We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. US Value & Access Insights Manager Live What You Will Do Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. This role will report to Senior Manager V&A Insights and will be part of a cross functional analytics insights team to provide integrated analyses and insights to Inflammation coverage and pricing team. This role is specifically responsible for providing insights impacting payer reimbursement strategies through secondary data analytics and data integration. In this role, the candidate will partner with US Payer Coverage and Pricing, Marketing teams to build a deep understanding of the US managed markets environment for assigned products. You will provide coordinated analysis combining multiple primary and secondary data sources to uncover deep insights that will guide payer, access, and reimbursement strategies Partner with Payer Marketing and Pricing/Contracting and Brand Marketing teams to build and prioritize analytics and insights plan in support of value and access strategy Understand pharmaceutical ecosystem and data sets including medial and pharmacy claims (ex. IQVIA LAAD, Symphony Claims), prescription (ex. IQVIA NPA), outlet (ex. IQVIA DDD) Partner with account C&P Leadership, marketing, data science and pricing/contracting teams to build and prioritize analytics and insights plan in support access strategy Provide in-depth, expertise-based oversight and delivery of managed markets analysis including product formulary position, utilization management controls, customer segmentation and control/sophistication assessment. Prepare, continuously refine and present periodic reports tracking product and portfolio performance against business objectives. Execute analytics plan to support payer insights from various payer datasets based on detailed understanding of related datasets i.e Patient level claims data; Payer claims data; Formulary coverage; Specialty Pharmacy Data.. Work with data management team to ensure to enable and maintain data integration to facilitate specific analytic needs; be able to use relevant tools to generate analytic datasets i.e. using SAS/SQL/Tableau to build analytical datasets. Build excel based tools to visualize data and drive decision-making Provide ad hoc analysis in response to business questions Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The analytics professional we seek is someone with these qualifications. Basic Qualifications: Doctorate degree OR Master’s degree and 3 years of analytics experience OR Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of analytics experience OR Associate’s degree and 10 years of analytics experience OR High School Diploma/GED and 12 years of analytics experience Preferred Qualifications: 3+ years of healthcare experience in the biopharmaceutical industry, health care, and/or strategy collaborating with specific experience and expertise in coverage, access and reimbursement drivers impacting the biopharmaceutical industry Build data analytics models to generate strategic concrete business insights using SQL, R, Python and Microsoft Excel High degree of analytical and problem-solving skills Exhibits strong understanding of business strategies Experience using SAS/SQL/Tableau to build analytical datasets Thrive Some of the vast rewards of working here As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being. In this vital role you will supervise the work done by the team members involving complex transactions, reporting and audits of worker data in the Human Resources (HR) system, Workday. The Workforce Operations & Reporting Manager will focus on innovation and continuous improvement and collaborate cross-functionally to analyze and optimize HR system and process functionality. Additionally, the manager understands how data flows to critical downstream systems (benefits, finance, etc.) and helps to mitigate risk when changes are made in the Workday system to these other systems. This position is a remote position within US. Responsibilities Leads the workforce administration team members in their operational daily responsibilities through yearly performance management via coaching/feedback, 1:1’s and quality of work. Leads the reporting workstream in output of reports from Visier, Tableau, Workday, SAS and other reporting platforms. Develops succession plans for each team member and cross trains to ensure coverage Deliver monthly metrics for reporting output to management Monitors effectiveness and quality of the workforce administration run activities and resource allocation needs. Provides direction of security and data auditing activities as well as reporting for Workday to ensure data integrity and compliance is met. Oversee execution of successful use of Enterprise Interface Building templates via team members for partner and business needs. Staff development through identification of performance strengths and needs through quality program initiatives and metrics/KPIs. Actively involved in the collection of system improvements/enhancements to raise requests for change. Coordinate system testing or requirements building to produce effective and sustainable system solutions. Develop and maintain Workforce Administration training curriculum and enhance system specific training for all new hires of HR Connect. Handle partner concerns from the business and other collaborators to solution and root cause issues to increase satisfaction and best in class service delivery. Managing relationships with global counterparts to ensure global consistency and consideration for system initiatives, changes and enhancements. Partnering with cross functional teams to improve process and procedures related to the workforce administration activities. Win What We Expect Of You We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The professional we seek possesses these qualifications.
